story:
Summary

Hey, we are cocos! That is Oscar and me, Phil. We have been producing and recording songs for 2 1/2 years now, having started in the 11th grade. Now both of us have moved out to go live in Stuttgart. After 2 semesters  of getting settled here we can finally continue creating songs. To reach the next level we would like to shoot a high-quality music video that is as professional as the songs are going to be. Therefore we need your support!

Here is a pre-mixed teaser of the song.


(It is strongly recommended to listen with headphones for now.)

What we get / What you get

What we would like to shoot exactly is a stereo-type Italian-style music video at the Boden in Southern Germany for our latest song "Toni Bambino". It is going to feature a typical mafia execution scene. Therefore we need
* props such as Italian wardrobe, hats and accessoires,
* to rent shooting equipment.
* to get to our shooting locations and back (300+ km) with all of the equipment and ~6 actors.
In return you receive our warmest wishes and "Thank you"s, the complete song & the full music video in HD.


    Risks & Challenges

    Gaining range is a very difficult procedure when producing music. You need to invest a lot of time and money, especially if you do all of it yourself. (Producing / Recording / working on ideas / doing videos etc)
    Still, we would like take in the challenge and any kind of support you can give us would take a great burde.


      Alternative ways to support

      Even if you can not or dont want to support us financially, you can still help us by spreading the word or raising attention to this campaign and/or the song/video.

      Please feel free to contact us if any questions should arise.
      We appreciate you and any help you provide!

      cocos

story:
Short Summary

We are Farewell, Dreamer. We're a band from Boston, Massachusetts, and for the past three and a half years, we have given everything to this band to make things happen, and it's finally paying off. After funding three independent releases, three independent tours and spending countless days playing, writing, practicing, and booking shows, we're ready to put out our third release, Adapt & Overcome. This record encompasses all of our hard work and struggles both metaphorically and literally, and we're ready to take the next step. It is imperative that our fans and our potential fans hear this album in any way they can, the most important of which would be our getting on the road and playing it in front of them so they can see the raw emotion and intensity we put into writing every song. The bottom line: we need to tour so people can know about us. After exhausting all of our resources, and paying every cent for recordings, merchandise, a van, a trailer, and all our gear out of pocket, we have nobody to turn to except our fans to help us take this next step. The purpose of this campaign is to reach out to our fans and ask them to help us in any way they can, because our van and trailer are on their last legs, and we need to replace them, as well as replenish our merchandise supply, print cd's, and pay countless other miscellaneous expenses that come with being in a band day-to-day.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what we need, completely broken down.

With $6000, we will be able to pay for:

  • A new van, or repairs to keep our current van on the road
  • A new trailer so we can fit all our equipment, luggage, and merchandise
  • A new stock of merchandise to sell at shows to make sure we have gas
  • Pressing more copies of our new album and paying for online distribution

With your donations , depending on the amount, you can receive perks such as:

  • A digital download of our new album
  • A signed copy of our new album
  • Signed thank you letters/Personal phone calls
  • Merch bundles that include CD's, bracelets, and T-shirts
  • Handwritten lyrics
  • A signed guitar
  • An all-expenses paid plane trip to come hang out with us
  • A band member will get your name tattooed on him
  • A personal concert
  • Inclusion in the thank you section of our next album
If we dont reach our full goal, anything close will be one step closer to making sure we're safe, and our van and trailer will hold up to the harsh demands of the road.

The Impact

Our fans are everything to us. We need them so much, and we never take them for granted. We have fans that ask us to come to different parts of the country- even different parts of the world to come play for them so they ca hear our music live and meet us; and as much as we would love to do so, it just isnt feasible with what little we have right now. As a contributor, your donation, be it $5 or $6000, will be one more thing that will keep this band alive and ready to see the world and meet all of our fans. We aren't signed, we dont have funding, we're 5 kids that want to make music and see the world; and that goal is easily within reach with the help of our fans and generous donors.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant help out with a monetary donation, you can help us by shooting us an email just to say hey, by sharing the link to our fundraiser so others can see it, and hopefully help out, or just by sharing our music and videos with everyone you know. Every little bit counts.

story:
The Jist

Contraband will be going to Grand Junction, Vegas, LA, Phoenix, and Albuquerque in a few weeks! We have this crazy dream of not running out of gas in the middle of California, so we need your help making our first tour a success! 

Even if you can only donate $1, we would be eternally grateful! Anything helps!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We Need: at least $1,000 to add to our band fund to fuel our tour. This money will also go toward our trailer, making cooler merch, and getting more recordings out to our fans.
  • You Get: All kinds of limited-edition and custom-designed merchandise, a free pass to any Contraband show of your choosing, and/or a private show/kegger just for you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Suppose you don't have a dollar... here's some other ways you can help!

  • Get the word out about this campaign, help us raise funds by bugging your friends, and share a link on facebook, twitter, tumblr, and whatever else you can!
  • Come out to one of our many live shows!

You Get: All kinds of limited-edition and custom-designed merchandise, a free pass to any Contraband show of your choosing, and/or a private show/kegger just for you!



Other Ways You Can Help


Suppose you don't have a dollar... here's some other ways you can help!

Get the word out about this campaign, help us raise funds by bugging your friends, and share a link on facebook, twitter, tumblr, and whatever else you can!
Come out to one of our many live shows!

story:
Hey Folks!

I'm a muscian named Bubbles Brown. Currently living in Chicago but a Flordia native.

I traveled up here 5 years ago to persue my dream of playing music, and what better place than Chicago, right? Its been a great 5 years. I've met so many interesting people and musicians who have greatly impacted my craft. 

Unfortunately with recording limitations I have yet to be able to market my talent. I make a point to perform at least once a week in bars across Chicago. But without a product to hand out, I can't stay in peoples minds the way some other recorded musicians might.

I've recorded here and there, but never in a professional studio. That is why I come to you. With your contribution I can finally sit down and record a full length album that I believe will definitely benefit my career as a muscian. Not only would I be recording an album, I would be adding to my portfolio. Something concrete to share with people.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What I Need: 

My goal is to reach 2000 dollars in the next 60 days. This will pretty much cover all the costs of recording in a professional studio. I will be recording a full length album, consisting of 10 to 12 songs.

With every contribution, you receive a free download of my 5 song demo. And after recording and releasing my full length album, a donation of 10 dollars or more, will land you a hard copy of my new album.

The Impact

I've been trying to make this happen for a long time. Everyday I get better and better, and its finally time I have something to show for it.

Recording this album is the jumpstart I need. I'll finally have something to show for all the hard work I've put into making this dream come alive.

 

Even the smallest contribution would be greatly appreciated.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, Please , Please!  Spread the word about my campaign. Share on Facebook or any social media website. Every little thing counts!

story:
（英文の後に日本語訳がございます）

Who is Michi?

Michi is an upcoming singer from Japan, who loves singing, acting, and performing on stage since she was little.  She has been in a number of musicals, and has even won a performance contest with a live dance group.  Michi has a real passion for bringing fun and joy to her audiences.  People naturally warm to her bubbly personality and infectious smile.  She's just fun to be around!

The project:

While she was taking vocal training in New York and in Vancouver, Michi started this project with other musicians who had the same passion and dreams as she had.  Together, they wrote and recorded 7 J-pop songs, ranging from uptempo, dance grooves to melodic ballads.  With these songs, they want to make and distribute a CD. 

The passion:

Michi has a strong passion for bringing enjoyment and positivity to others through her music and performances.  In the culture of Japan, there are many pressures on the people, and the younger generation are no exception. There is a need for people to hear uplifting words and music, to encourage them through everyday life.

You may also have seen Japan in the news the past while, with events such as the tsunami and the nuclear disasters.  This has added to the pressures that many people feel, and Michi wants to do her part to encourage the people of Japan, and also around the world.  Michi is excited to share her music with you!

The project so far:

Much of the work for Michi's cd has already been done. This includes:

  • recording all the tracks for each song
  • all the photography is completed
  • the graphics/layout for the cd packaging
  • rough pre-mixes and arrangments of the songs

Still to do:

  • mixing the songs
  • mastering [the final preparation for manufacturing
  • manufacturing the physical CD's
  • distributing and marketing - getting the music out there!

 Your support:

       This is the part where you can get involved!  There are 2 ways you can be a real part to help make this cd the best it can be.

   1]  You can help financially.

Michi needs to raise $7,500 to complete the cd.  Here is a breakdown of how the money will be used:

  • mixing = $5,500
  • mastering = $1,000
  • manufacturing = $1,000

This is the amount needed for the production of the cd.  If more than $7,500 is raised, which would be fantastic, it will be used to market/promote the cd!   

Michi is offering some special THANK YOU gifts for your participation in this project.

For $10 - you will receive a digital download of the cd

For $20 - get a physical cd and the digital download

For $35 - 2 cd's and the digital download

For $50 - a physical cd, a digital download, PLUS a "thank you" video from Michi

For $100 - a physical cd, a digital download, the "thank you" video PLUS you get your name in the cd credits!  How cool is that?!

Of course, you can contribute any amount you want, from a few dollars to a million or two  :) 

Please check them out on the right.  Any contribution is greatly appreciated! 

   2]  Spread the word!

     Please let others know about this project in any way you can!  This is a huge help for Michi to get the word out to as many people as possible. 

  • put a link on Facebook
  • mention this project on on Twitter
  • encourage your friends to check it out
  • fly a banner behind your private plane
  • use whatever creative means you have, or even ...
  • in conversation

 

A big thanks to all!  

Thanks to everyone who has helped out so far!  People have donated their time and energy, in many different ways.  Everything counts, whether large or small.  Any way you can become involved with this project is hugely appreciated!  Arigatou!

 

Michiってどんな人？

日本で活動する歌手。幼少の頃から歌や演技が大好きだった彼女はミュージカルにも出演しダンスグループではコンテストで賞をもらった経歴もあります。彼女は観客の方に楽しんでもらい喜びをもたらす事に情熱を持っています。Michiの明るい性格と相手がつい微笑んでしまうような笑顔に人は自然と惹かれてしまいます。とにかく一緒にいて楽しい人なのです！

プロジェクトについて：

Michiがニューヨークそしてバンクーバーに滞在しボーカルトレーニングを受けている時に彼女と同じ情熱や想いを持つミュージシャン達と巡り会い、このプロジェクトを共に始動させました。彼らはアップテンポな曲からダンスソングそしてバラードなどさまざまな曲が盛り込まれた７曲のJ-popソングを作りレコーディングしました。そしてこれらの曲をCDにしたいと考えています。

情熱：

音楽やパフォーマンスを通して観客の人達に楽しく前向きになってもらえる事が彼女の喜びです。日本人は社会の中で沢山のプレッシャーを背負っていますそれは若い世代にも例外ではありません。ですから希望の言葉や音楽を聴き励まされる事が日本の人達の日々の生活にとって必要だと思っています。

東日本を襲った津波や原発災害の後、日本のニュースが引き続き取り上げられみなさんもそれはご存知だと思います。この災害後、更なるプレッシャーが日本の人達に圧し掛かりました。Michiはそんな日本の人達そして世界中の人達を少しでも励ましたいと願っています。

これまでの進行状況：

作業の大半は終わっています。終了している作業：

  • 全ての曲のレコーディング
  • 写真撮影
  • CDジャケットのグラフィックデザイン
  • 大まかなミキシング、編曲作業

これからの作業：

  • ミキシング
  • マスタリング
  • CDプレス、製造
  • 流通、マーケティング-　楽曲を広める事！

サポートに関して：

みなさんが実際どのようにこのプロジェクトにご協力して頂けるのかをご紹介します。それには２つの方法があります。

   1]  資金的な援助

MichiがCDを完成させる為には＄7,500 の資金を募らなければなりません。

こちらがその内訳です。

  • ミキシング = $5,500
  • マスタリング = $1,000
  • CDプレス = $1,000

これは音源及びCD製作に必要な費用ですがもし目標額である$7,500以上の資金を募る事ができた場合にはマーケティング、プロモーション費用の為にあてられます。

寄付をして下さった方にMichiからのThank youギフトをご用意しております。詳細は当ページ右手の一覧をごらん下さい。貢献して下さる全ての皆様に感謝します。

     2]  周りの人への宣伝

あなたの周りの人達にこのプロジェクトを宣伝して下さい。一人でも多くの方にこのプロジェクトを広めて頂く事がみちにとって非常に大きな手助けとなります。

  • フェイスブックにリンクを貼る
  • ツイッターでつぶやく
  • 友達に宣伝する
  • あなたが思いつく方法で伝えて下さい

 

皆さんへの感謝！

このプロジェクトに関わって下さった全ての方々に感謝します。沢山の方々が時間と労力をさまざまな形で注いで下さいました。関わりの大小に関わらず全てが重要です。どのような形であれ携わって下さる事に感謝します！

本当にありがとうございます！

サポートに関して：
みなさんが実際どのようにこのプロジェクトにご協力して頂けるのかをご紹介します。それには２つの方法があります。
   1]  資金的な援助
MichiがCDを完成させる為には＄7,500 の資金を募らなければなりません。
こちらがその内訳です。

ミキシング = $5,500
マスタリング = $1,000
CDプレス = $1,000

これは音源及びCD製作に必要な費用ですがもし目標額である$7,500以上の資金を募る事ができた場合にはマーケティング、プロモーション費用の為にあてられます。
寄付をして下さった方にMichiからのThank youギフトをご用意しております。詳細は当ページ右手の一覧をごらん下さい。貢献して下さる全ての皆様に感謝します。
     2]  周りの人への宣伝
あなたの周りの人達にこのプロジェクトを宣伝して下さい。一人でも多くの方にこのプロジェクトを広めて頂く事がみちにとって非常に大きな手助けとなります。

フェイスブックにリンクを貼る
ツイッターでつぶやく
友達に宣伝する
あなたが思いつく方法で伝えて下さい

 
皆さんへの感謝！
このプロジェクトに関わって下さった全ての方々に感謝します。沢山の方々が時間と労力をさまざまな形で注いで下さいました。関わりの大小に関わらず全てが重要です。どのような形であれ携わって下さる事に感謝します！
本当にありがとうございます！

story:
***I CANNOT EDIT THE PERKS, BUT A $10 DONATION WILL GET YOU THE DIGITAL DOWNLOAD, AND $25 DONATION WILL GET YOU AN AS OF YET UNDETERMINED SURPRISE PERK IN ADDITION TO THE DOWNLOAD, LET THE MYSTERY WHISK YOU AWAY AND DARE TO DONATE***

RF SHANNON, COMMUNITAS RNB

RF SHANNON's music gets to the Spirit of a people, a place, a thing, and an idea that has happened, is happening, and will happen again.

We have been playing together in this incarnation since February 2013, and we believe that good things happen very quickly. Help us move it up and shake it down.

'Communitas' is the nitty gritty feeling of what it is like to live here with other people, and we want to create a feeling through music that engages an exchange of real things and true senses. We have been told that our songs conjure images of the southwest and the deep south, which is the crossroads of where we're from. We know this place and want to tell its story. The deserts, the dustbowls, the woods, the water... the streets.

Our talented friend Daniel Hill came over and shot video of our normal Sunday ritual: fishing and rehearsal. This is basically all that exists of our work, and we're hoping to expand upon it exponentially. You're donation is much appreciated.

 

HUNTING SONGS EP

We are asking for $1,500 to pay for studio time and a limited number of pressings. We will offer the recording as freely and easily as possible through downloads and handmade packages that you will receive just from being around or letting us know you want it.

This is intended as a first step for us and a first sip for you.

 

IN THE LONG RANGE


By recording this EP, we will have captured the essence of our intentions and thus have a solid foundation to begin sharing these sounds and ideas in meaningful settings via touring and happenings. We have enough material to keep us busy for a while, and we're curious to see if you're curious to see what could happen.

Music is a force that sustains us in subtle and profound ways, and we want to explore it. Since NASA is no more, LET US TAKE YOU TO THE FINAL FRONTIER!

story:
Few years ago two young Italian musicians, Francesco Lombardo and Michele Panepinto, decided to undertake a path of musical growth which would soon bring them to their first self-production. The result of this decision is Vitriol, which soon involved Gianluca Pappalardo, Pierangelo Carvello and Alessandro Sanfilippo. These musicians contributed to enrich the style of the new band with their professional influences, inspired by the modern Progressive Rock & Metal genres and by the musical experiences of the historical bands of the 70’s.


Alcuni anni fa 2 giovani musicisti italiani, Francesco Lombardo e Michele Panepinto, decisero di intraprendere insieme un percorso musicale che li avrebbe portati presto alla loro prima autoproduzione. Il risultato di questa decisione è stata la nascita della band Vitriol, che presto coinvolse Gianluca Pappalardo, Pierangelo Carvello e Alessandro Sanfilippo. Questi musicisti contribuirono con le loro influenze professionale ad arricchire lo stile della band, ispirato da un moderno genere Progressive Rock e Metal e dalle esperienze musicali delle storiche band degli anni '70.

--------------------------------------------------

As soon as the first work of the band was collected, it was distributed to media and immediately got lots of good reviews by the alternative rock and metal magazines in both paper and digital media: The EP scored 15.5/16 in issue #59 of the prestigious Progression Magazine, the best score as “independent release” and one of the best scores among 200 albums supported by labels.


Una volta che venne raccolto il primo lavoro della band, venne distribuito immediatamente ai media e seguirono numerose buone recensioni dalle riviste alternative rock e metal sia cartacee sia digitali: l' EP ha ricevuto 15.5/16 nel numero 59 della prestigiosa rivista Progression, il miglior punteggio come "release indipendente" e uno dei migliori punteggi tra 200 album supportati da etichetta discografica.

--------------------------------------------------

"Vitriol EP" was considered the Best Demo of the Month in the November issue of Metal Maniac (one of the most important magazines in Italy) and received 8 out of 10 in plenty of the most famous Italian and international webzines, such as Progressive Ears, MetalWave, UsaProgressiveMusic, Unprogged, Rock Hard, TrueMetal, Metallo Italiano, Eutk, Nova Muzique and many others.


E ' stato considerato il miglior demo del mese nel numero di Novembre di Metal Maniac (una delle riviste più importanti in Italia) e ha ricevuto 8 su 10 nella maggior parte delle più famose webzine italiane e internazionali, come ad esempio Progressive Ears, Metalwave , UsaProgressiveMusic, Unprogged, Rock Hard, Truemetal, Metallo Italiano, Eutk, Nova Muzique così come molte altre.

--------------------------------------------------

​In 2010, guitar player Tommaso Semrov joined the band and Vitriol started pre-producing their first full-length album called "Into The Silence I Sink" which was released in November 2012.


2010 - Il loro attuale chitarrista Tommaso Semrov si unì alla band ed i Vitriol iniziarono la pre-produzione del loro primo full-length album "Into The Silence I Sink", che è stato rilasciato nel novembre 2012.

--------------------------------------------------

"Into the Silence I Sink" is a concept album revolving around the theme of Silence, metaphorically approached as "deep lack of communication".
The album features 10 songs,  which allow to make an analysis of the different causes of this lack of communication.


E' un concept album che ruota intorno al tema del silenzio, metaforicamente affrontato come "profonda mancanza di comunicazione". 10 canzoni, che favoriscono l'analisi delle diverse cause di tale assenza di comunicazione.

--------------------------------------------------

This is only a part of our history and about what we want to communicate to our listeners.

 We are currently promoting our album with a strong web presence, press releases, radio interviews, social networks, numerous newsletters and it would be so important for us to make the first video of our brand new single called "The Frozen Wind". 


Questa è solo una parte della nostra storia e di ciò che vogliamo comunicare ai nostri ascoltatori.

Attualmente stiamo promuovendo il nostro album con una forte presenza sul web, comunicati stampa, la radio, le interviste, i social network, numerose newsletter e sarebbe davvero molto importante per noi realizzare il primo video del nostro nuovo singolo intitolato "The Frozen Wind".

--------------------------------------------------

It is very difficult for us to raise funds for an artistic work like ours, especially in Italy, a country where it's hard to succeed for our music style.

We are in touch with some video makers who can work with us, but unfortunately we ran out of money. We would like so much the promotion of our album to keep on, but now we are stuck.


E' molto difficile per noi raccogliere fondi per un lavoro artistico di questo tipo soprattutto in Italia, un paese dove è difficile emergere per il nostro genere musicale.

Siamo in contatto con alcuni professionisti nell'ambito del video making che possono lavorare con noi, ma purtroppo mancano i fondi al momento. Ci piacerebbe tanto che la promozione del nostro album continuasse, ma purtroppo, al momento, siamo bloccati a causa della mancanza di un video musicale.

--------------------------------------------------

Costs for this video are:

- 250€ in total, to borrow video equipments (lights, cameras, struts);

- 750€ in total, for cameramen, light technicians, transports, video editing and location rental;

These are the lowest prices we have found, but we can't afford them. So our last chance is to share with you our great desire thanks to this site.


I nostri costi per questo video sono:

- 250 € in totale per prendere a noleggio le apparecchiature video (luci, telecamere, supporti);

- 750 € in totale per i cameraman, tecnici luci, trasporti, video editing e locations;

Questi sono i prezzi i più bassi che ci hanno preventivato, ma non ce li possiamo permettere al momento. Così, la nostra ultima possibilità è di condividere con voi il nostro grande desiderio grazie a questo sito.

------------------------------------------------------------

As you can see in "perks" your support won't be forgotten. We are sure you will really appreciate this work, because you will be part of it. Our promise is to make you part of a very passionate and beautiful work, where your musical tastes can finally find us playing in front of your monitors. We are not telling you the same old story of boring and snooty musicians. We really believe in what we do, we studied for so many years, we are studying so much and constantly working on improving our capabilities. We are sure that if you like what we do you'll be glad to be part of us, a part of our dream.


Come si può vedere nei "perks (vantaggi al contribuente)", il vostro sostegno non sarà dimenticato. Il vostro aiuto sarà parte di un lavoro che siamo sicuri apprezzerete, anche perché voi sarete direttamente una parte di esso. La nostra promessa è quella di farvi partecipi di un lavoro non solo ricco di bellezza, ma creato ed ottenuto con grande passione, dove i vostri gusti musicali possono incontrare finalmente noi stessi mentre suoniamo davanti ai vostri monitor. Noi non siamo la solita vecchia storia di musicisti noiosi e altezzosi. Crediamo molto in quello che facciamo, non solo abbiamo studiato per tanti anni, ma tutt'ora stiamo studiando tanto e lavoriamo continuamente per migliorare le nostre capacità. Siamo sicuri che se vi piacerà quello che facciamo sarete felici di essere parte di noi, parte del nostro sogno.

Vitriol

story:
Hello Everyone!!!

My name is Miguel Atwood-Ferguson and I am a multi-instrumentalist, composer, arranger, music director, producer, DJ, and educator.  I am raising money to finish recording my first solo album (working title: Les Jardins Mystiques) as well as a string quartet record of cinematic improvisations with my string quartet, Quartetto Fantastico. I am unbelievably excited to share the love in my heart with the world through music! I appreciate your help in bringing this dream and vision to life!

Les Jardins Mystiques Special Guests: 

Austin Peralta, Bilal, Chris 'Daddy' Dave, Coco (Quadron), Deantoni Parks, Georgia Anne Muldrow, Herbie Hancock, James Gadson, JRocc, Karriem Riggins, Leon Ware, Madlib, Marie Daulne (Zap Mama), Mia Doi Todd, Nai Palm (Hiatus Kaiyote), and Seu Jorge to name a few.

Quartetto Fantastico:

Chris Woods (violin)

Paul Cartwright (violin)

Miguel Atwood-Ferguson (viola)

Peter Jacobson (cello)

Backstory:

I grew up in beautiful Topanga Canyon, tucked away in the hills of Los Angeles County, to a diverse and artistic family of musicians and educators. Despite playing music my entire life, performing thousands of concerts and recording on well over 500 records, films/tv shows and commercials, I have not been able to afford the time and money needed to record my own albums. Even though my path as a musician has been an awesome and emotionally fulfilling journey, most of my gigs don’t pay enough for me to make ends meet, let alone build a sustainable foundation to one day raise my own family.

Currently, as a freelance artist between unpaid gigs, I have no money and have not even been able to pay my own rent the last two months… In my experience, in most cases, the gigs that pay the best are often the least creatively fulfilling, and the most fulfilling gigs from a creative and emotional perspective pay either nothing, or an extremely small amount.

This is the most critical time so far in my entire life and with your help, I will be able to seriously break through with the production of my own recorded work!!!

Surviving as a Creative artist:

The one thing I love most in life is creating and performing music that touches people’s souls. As a musician focused on making incredibly well-crafted, soulful, diverse and inspiring music, I’ve given my life towards this cause by working on average 12-20 hrs everyday. I absolutely LOVE what I do, but would like to finally focus on and be able to sustainably create my own music with your help!

As human beings, we all love music so much! But, unfortunately, it is very difficult for many creative musicians like myself to survive in the world. I have done my very best to utilize as much heart and wisdom possible as I continue to grow as a human being and artist, and have now come to a place where I’m humbly looking to the support of you- new and old friends around the world who will join me in launching the next step of my music.

This all is what has led me to being here with you now!

This Indie Gogo campaign will allow me to:

*Finish my first solo album (a double album on the LA-based indie record label Brainfeeder). The working title is ‘Les Jardins Mystiques’ (The Mystical Gardens).

*Finish my first record with my string quartet Quartetto Fantastico (this will also be a double album and will be released independently by us and is 100% comprised of sublime and diverse cinematic improvisations).

*Have living expenses needed to complete these albums.

*Hire a small documentation crew that will document aspects of the making of both of these historic albums. This will be a huge help towards creating more future opportunities for myself and my string quartet.

*Pay for food at my Brainfeeder recording sessions to feed the multitude of musicians that I will be hiring to record with me.

*Purchase/fix gear that is needed to complete these albums and tour around the world.

*Emerge as the solo musician doing the work that I feel I was born to do.

*Be used as an example to other creative musicians that are also struggling to manifest their dreams.

*Donate 10% of my earnings from my solo Brainfeeder album as well as donate 10% of Quartetto Fantastico’s earnings to worthy charities for the rest of our lives.

 

Some of the charities that we will be donating to initially are:

http://www.hearmehub.com/

http://www.kiva.org/

http://www.donorschoose.org/

http://www.cff.org/

http://www.iapf.org/en/

http://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/

 

Follow me on Twitter or like me on Facebook for a free digital download of my very first Mixtape (expected release: late summer)!

 

**** I greatly appreciate you considering donating through Paypal which will allow me to immediately start receiving and applying your generous contributions instead of having to wait 6 weeks from now once all payments are processed through Indie Gogo. ****

 

THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART FOR YOUR INCREDIBLE KINDNESS, GENEROISTY AND LOVE!!!!!!! YOU HAVE MY ETERNAL PLEDGE AND PROMISE TO STRIVE TO CREATE SOMETHING OF LASTING BEAUTY, HONESTY, RELEVANCE AND INSPIRATION!

Sincerely,

Miguel Atwood-Ferguson

 

 

Breakdown of Budget:

 

Living Expenses:

In order to have the free time needed to work on my Mixtape, Brainfeeder + Quartetto albums.

$25,000

 

Brainfeeder Double Album:

 

Brainfeeder Rhythm Section Recordings

Musicians: $16,000

Studio: $4,000

$20,000      

 

String Orchestra:

Musicians: $7,200

Studio: $900

$8,100                    

 

Woodwind/Brass/Sax/Misc. Overdubs:

Musicians: $3,600

$5,100

$20,000

 

Session at A Place Called Home:

Kids Performance Fee: $1,250

Food:  $100

Musicians (Pros): $1,600

Chris Woods (violin)
Paul Cartwright (violin)
Miguel Atwood-Ferguson (viola)
Peter Jacobson (cello)
Backstory:
I grew up in beautiful Topanga Canyon, tucked away in the hills of Los Angeles County, to a diverse and artistic family of musicians and educators. Despite playing music my entire life, performing thousands of concerts and recording on well over 500 records, films/tv shows and commercials, I have not been able to afford the time and money needed to record my own albums. Even though my path as a musician has been an awesome and emotionally fulfilling journey, most of my gigs don’t pay enough for me to make ends meet, let alone build a sustainable foundation to one day raise my own family.
Currently, as a freelance artist between unpaid gigs, I have no money and have not even been able to pay my own rent the last two months… In my experience, in most cases, the gigs that pay the best are often the least creatively fulfilling, and the most fulfilling gigs from a creative and emotional perspective pay either nothing, or an extremely small amount.
This is the most critical time so far in my entire life and with your help, I will be able to seriously break through with the production of my own recorded work!!!
Surviving as a Creative artist:
The one thing I love most in life is creating and performing music that touches people’s souls. As a musician focused on making incredibly well-crafted, soulful, diverse and inspiring music, I’ve given my life towards this cause by working on average 12-20 hrs everyday. I absolutely LOVE what I do, but would like to finally focus on and be able to sustainably create my own music with your help!
As human beings, we all love music so much! But, unfortunately, it is very difficult for many creative musicians like myself to survive in the world. I have done my very best to utilize as much heart and wisdom possible as I continue to grow as a human being and artist, and have now come to a place where I’m humbly looking to the support of you- new and old friends around the world who will join me in launching the next step of my music.
This all is what has led me to being here with you now!
This Indie Gogo campaign will allow me to:
*Finish my first solo album (a double album on the LA-based indie record label Brainfeeder). The working title is ‘Les Jardins Mystiques’ (The Mystical Gardens).
*Finish my first record with my string quartet Quartetto Fantastico (this will also be a double album and will be released independently by us and is 100% comprised of sublime and diverse cinematic improvisations).
*Have living expenses needed to complete these albums.
*Hire a small documentation crew that will document aspects of the making of both of these historic albums. This will be a huge help towards creating more future opportunities for myself and my string quartet.
*Pay for food at my Brainfeeder recording sessions to feed the multitude of musicians that I will be hiring to record with me.
*Purchase/fix gear that is needed to complete these albums and tour around the world.
*Emerge as the solo musician doing the work that I feel I was born to do.
*Be used as an example to other creative musicians that are also struggling to manifest their dreams.
*Donate 10% of my earnings from my solo Brainfeeder album as well as donate 10% of Quartetto Fantastico’s earnings to worthy charities for the rest of our lives.
 
Some of the charities that we will be donating to initially are:
http://www.hearmehub.com/
http://www.kiva.org/
http://www.donorschoose.org/
http://www.cff.org/
http://www.iapf.org/en/
http://www.doctorswithoutborders.org/
 
Follow me on Twitter or like me on Facebook for a free digital download of my very first Mixtape (expected release: late summer)!
 
**** I greatly appreciate you considering donating through Paypal which will allow me to immediately start receiving and applying your generous contributions instead of having to wait 6 weeks from now once all payments are processed through Indie Gogo. ****
 
THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART FOR YOUR INCREDIBLE KINDNESS, GENEROISTY AND LOVE!!!!!!! YOU HAVE MY ETERNAL PLEDGE AND PROMISE TO STRIVE TO CREATE SOMETHING OF LASTING BEAUTY, HONESTY, RELEVANCE AND INSPIRATION!
Sincerely,
Miguel Atwood-Ferguson
 
 
Breakdown of Budget:
 
Living Expenses:
In order to have the free time needed to work on my Mixtape, Brainfeeder + Quartetto albums.

All of the $500 is going to the recording process. By donating, I've made perks! I will be printing this CD so by donating now you get it for free. I'm just so excited for you guys to hear this side of me again.

story:
Short Summary

Motif is looking to expand our audience and share our music. We are six passionate musicians looking for YOUR help. Your pledge will help us travel to cities like Chicago, Grand Rapids, Traverse City, and Mackicaw! With bookings and opportunities in each city, these stops will help us grow as musicians and performers. Please help us reach our goal.

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is simple, $1500. This amount helps to fill in the rest of our need in the ways of hotel and gas money. 

You can pledge at various levels and get cool rewards in exchange!!!!!!

$10+, you will get an official photo signed with love from all of us in Motif.

25+, you will get our official photo signed with love PLUS a new, recently recorded, track featuring Motif emailed directly to you. 

100+, you will get our official photo signed with love PLUS ALL SIX of our recorded vocal tracks featuring our new mash ups. You will also get a link to our private YouTube music video and watch it before everyone else gets to!

250+, you will get our official photo signed with love PLUS a ALL SIX of our recorded vocal tracks featuring our new mash ups. You will also get a link to our private YouTube music video and watch it before everyone else gets to! At this level of pledging, you will also get to come the rehearsal of your choice and hang with us, PLUS you will be the first to get a copy of our first ORIGINAL song when it is ready for release this Winter!

500+, not only will you get all the awards listed above, but you will get Motif all to yourself for a private event. We will come to YOU and play your holiday party, birthday bash, or corporate event with sincere thanks for your sponsorship! 

The Impact

Motif has begun to write our own music. This journey on the road together will allow us time to pull inspiration from the roads we travel. Additionally, we get to expand our brand and fan base by touring these amazing cities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to pledge, there are many other ways to help us! You can share this video and help us get the word out. We only have 30 days to try and hit our goal!!! You can also help share our facebook fanpage at www.facebook.com/musicofmotif.

story:
Do you see those horns?....We need to replace them! 

Who we are: Shenandoah Sound is a competitive all-age drum & bugle corps from Northern Virginia. The corps exists to provide its membership with education and performance opportunities in the drum corps tradition of marching music. Shenandoah Sound is the only drum corps in Virginia and consists of members from Virginia and Maryland.

To see us in action and meet our members, cick here!

Why we need your help: We are in the process of upgrading our brass instruments. For many years, the corps has performed using old 2-valve G bugles. While we enjoy the bugles, the time has come for us to upgrade to a full line of King Bb Ultimate Marching Brass. The corps recently purchased some King horns, but we need your help to complete our line!

The most expensive brass horn is the contra (tuba). At over $2,500 each, these horns don’t come cheap! Your pledge will help us purchase two contras.

 

Everyone who helps us will receive special recognition on our website and Facebook page. In addition, everyone who contributes by July 5 will also get special recognition in our program book for our drum corps competition: "Sound of the South" on July 7. 


All donors who contribute $150 or more can have their company/business logo placed on our website as an extra-special thank you! 

 

Offical info: Shenandoah Sound is a non-profit 501[c]3 drum and bugle corps and affiliated Boy Scouts of America Venture Crew 1196 based in Prince William County, Virginia and a member of Drum Corps Associates (DCA) South. Your financial contribution will help supply us with high-quality horns which will last us for years. We invite you to see your contribution in action this summer one of our competitions or parades.

For more information about the corps, or to support us, please visit our homepage at www.shenandoahsound.org

story:
REMEMBERING FRANK SINATRA: THE CAPITOL YEARS

                                       STARRING TIMOTHY O'KEEFE

         TV PERSONALITY AND INTERNATIONAL RECORDING ARTIST

Hi, my name is Timothy O'Keefe.  I need your help.  I have had this dream of doing this show for more than 15 years.  It's time!  But I can't do it without your help.

I fell in love with this music when I was young like many of you.  Nobody does this music better than Frank Sinatra.  I chose this period while at Capitol Records from 1953 to 1961 because this was the most powerful time in his career.  Full of great stories and magnificent music with the help of iconic music men like Nelson Riddle, Rodgers and Hart, Cole Porter, Sammy Cahn and many more.

I will be accompanied by a 17 piece BIG BAND and lots of images to tell the story.

We will design, stage and premier the production in my home town of Asheville, NC before we take it across the country.  With your help we will be coming to a Performing Arts Theatre near you.

And we are currently in the studio working on a companion CD for the show with the same title.

Thank you for your support and God Bless you.

Timothy

                                                                BIO

From Alan Sewell on The Young and the Restless and Doctor Erickson on  Days Of Our Lives, Timothy O’Keefe’s varied and exciting career has led him down a trail as Television and Film actor, recording artist, musical entertainer, director, stage actor and cruise ship headliner.

Along with his soap opera roles, he was seen as Foster Wolfe with Chad Everett on ABC’s McKenna. He has guest-starred in numerous TV series such as Fantasy Island, Quincy, Battle Star Galactica, CHiPS, Buck Rogers, McClain’s Lawwith James Arness, and numerous others. 

As a singer and entertainer, his nightclub dates include Las Vegas and Reno.  O’Keefe was a frequent guest on the Tonight Show and the popular Merv Griffin Show.  He received rave reviews for his CD, "The Best Is Yet To Come".

                                        

                                          DESCRIPTION OF SHOW

Here, in a special tribute, Timothy O’Keefe offers a fascinating and entertaining look at the life of Frank Sinatra - the singer, the actor, and the man.

You’ll take a voyage through Frank’s life; his fall from grace --- his amazing recovery in FROM HERE TO ETERNITY --- the beginning of Las Vegas --- the birth of an artistic union with Nelson Riddle that survived over four decades --- the making of a major film star --- the Rat Pack --- superstardom and, of course, we can’t forget Ava.

This is not an impersonator or lookalike show, but an affectionate musical and biographical tribute to one of the greatest entertainers of the 20th Century by what the CHICAGO TRIBUNE labeled, “…A WORLD CLASS SINGER.”

The LA TIMES had this to say about Mr. O’Keefe , "... follows in the footsteps of great singers like Tony Bennett."

The SAN FRANCISCO CHRONICLE said, "O'Keefe has the ability to connect with his audience in a way that escapes many singers...not  just a great voice."

Timothy will take you through works of Cole Porter, the Gershwins, Sammy Cahn, Rodgers and Hart, Jimmy Van Huesen and many others --- Musical giants who helped shape the body of work that made Francis Albert Sinatra so popular.

 Sample tracks from new CD here.

What We Need & What You Get

Timothy has a goal of performing his loving tribute of Frank Sinatra nation-wide and Internationally

  • The total goal to fund Timothy's show is roughly $26,500. We are currently exploring all avenues to help make this dream a reality
  • We are  looking for "Angels" that enjoy the arts and have a fondness for Frank and a special time when BIG BANDS and the American Song Book were supreme.  We need donations small and large that will help us reach our total goal. 
  •  Depending on the donated amounts, Angels will receive special signed merchandise from Timothy O'Keefe, including his highly acclaimed CD "Come Rain or Come Shine",  the new companion CD,  "Remembering Frank Sinatra: the Capitol Years", and complimentary tickets to Timothy's show when it visits your area. 
  • All funds donated will go directly toward funding music production,  planning, musicians, lighting, stage design, venue, scheduling, promotion, etc. Our goal is to share this show with those who want to revisit the joy we all received from Ol' Blue Eye's music.

Other Ways You Can Help

Though we are accepting any donations possible we understand that some people just can't contribute through monetary means. Here are some other ways to help us reach our goal. 

  • In addition to donations we welcome your Word of Mouth as a particularly compelling tool. 
  • Social networking is very powerful , please feel free to use Indiegogo's sharing tools to really get the word out to people that may be interested in our campaign.
  • Get on your Facebook to like and share our fan page (www.facebook.com/rememberingfranksinatra) to share this opportunity with your friends, family, etc.
  • Visit Timothy's website at www.timothyokeefe.net to learn more about him

story:
CRISTY KESSLER is alive because she became an effective patient advocate for herself. Her 5 STEPS Principles* along with the strategies she developed can make a difference for you or your loved ones. Inspired by her personal medical journey, our mission is to empower others to speak and act for themselves and loved ones when medical needs arise. 

She is alive only because on March 21, 2011, after years of pain, fatigue, frustration, and a steadfast fight for a cure that had been denied by her insurance and which was prohibited in the United States by the FDA, she was the recipient of an autologous stem cell transplant. This treatment eliminated three concurrent autoimmune diseases which she had been told would end her life within months.

Through her own self-advocacy strategies and the support of a powerful team of physicians, she found the treatment that could save her life. But because it was extremely expensive and had to be done outside of the United States, fund-raising efforts by her family and friends helped make it possible.  Cristy determined that the best way to thank those who helped her was to pay it forward by sharing her successful strategies with others who face difficult medical challenges.

As a first step in meeting that goal, Cristy published 5 S.T.E.P.S. to Being Your Own Patient Advocate, a book that tells the powerful story of her medical journey—a journey which took her from certain death to recovery and restoration, from waiting to die to learning to live.

Whether you, someone you love, or a perfect stranger is struggling with medical challenges and finding no answers, Cristy's Five STEPS can provide the strategies to build an effective team to find and fund needed diagnoses and treatment.  With your support, she will make a difference for those who find themselves navigating a complex and often confusing medical maze for themselves or for someone they love.

In pursuing her passion for paying it forward, Cristy urges everyone, whether healthy or ill, to adopt this mantra, My Health. My Body. My Voice. You are the expert on you, and you owe it to yourself to take charge of your health care. 

In the gallery are videos and pictures that not only chronicle Cristy's story, but there are video interviews with a young couple who are just beginning their medical journey together with Cristy's guidance and the strategies described in the book.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign will fund a book tour from July 4-July 16 in four states (Confirmed for Illinois, Tennessee, South Carolina and Georgia.) The following is our plan of action and projected budget:

  • book talks and signings at independent bookstores and public libraries (see current tour dates and locations here)
  • workshops on behalf of assisted living and care facilities
  • radio and tv interviews on local public radio and commercial stations in the cities where appearances are scheduled
  • purchase of print books and handouts/gifts for participants in book signings and workshops (est. $3,200.00)
  • airfare for the authors and manager (est. $3,297.00)
  • car rental and fuel for the majority of the tour (est. $1,532.00)
  • meals and accommodations for 14 days (est. $5,250.00)
As contributors, you will help patients and their caregivers learn how to take charge of their own health care issues and those of their loved ones, and you just might save a life.

Our plan is not only to publish additional books (with workbooks) to serve a broader community of patients, caregivers, and medical professionals, but also to provide personalized service through workshops and one-on-one consultations, teaching patients and their caregivers how to open doors that have been shut by conventional healthcare systems.

Cristy Kessler is an experienced motivational speaker and conference presenter.

*The Five STEPS and their Guiding Principles

The 5 S.T.E.P.S.are Sensibility, Teamwork, Education, Patience/Perseverance, Sustainability. They are based on the following principles:

  • We know what our bodies are telling us about our well being and we need the tools to communicate that clearly to our physicians.
  • We, along with our doctors and our network of family and friends, collaborate and work as a team for the most effective medical outcomes.
  • We do our own research regarding our medical issues and share our learning with team members who reciprocate with support and the sharing of knowledge.
  • We are patient with our bodies, ourselves, and others; we persevere regardless of setbacks and obstacles we encounter.
  • We recognize that our overall well being depends on sustaining not only the body, but also the mind and spirit.

If we do not reach our fundraising goal with this campaign, our priority will be to use the funds  to pay (1) for the books, handouts, and gifts for attendees at our events, and (2) to repay the authors and manager for out-of-pocket expenses during the tour, which we are obligated to complete.

The Impact

Your participation in this campaign can make a difference for you or someone you love or even for a perfect stranger. Being sick stinks. It saps your strength and your spirit.

  • Help us show others how to listen to what their body is telling them so they can communicate clearly with their doctors. (Sensibility)
  • Help us show others how to build a medical team that can reach effective medical solutions. (Teamwork)
  • Help us show others how to create a network of family and friends for encouragement and support when it is most needed. (Teamwork)
  • Help us show others how to find the most accurate, most recent information available that will lead to positive outcomes. (Education)
  • Help us show others when to accept the need to wait and when to push for more action. (Patience/Perseverance)
  • Help us give hope to those who feel hopeless. (Sustainability) 
  • Help us show others how to dare their souls to go beyond what their eyes can see. (Sustainability)
Your help may even save a life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, you can use your voice and the Internet to help spread the word.

  • Join us at our book tour appearances (see current tour dates and locations here).
  • Tell your friends and neighbors about the book and our goals
  • Send emails and tweets.
  • Use Facebook to let your friends and followers know.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for helping out and God Bless You.

CRISTY KESSLER is alive because she became an effective patient 
advocate for herself. Her 5 STEPS Principles* along with the strategies 
she developed can make a difference for you or your loved ones. Inspired by her personal medical journey, our mission is to empower others to speak and act for themselves and loved ones when medical needs arise. 
She is alive only because on March 21, 2011,  after years of pain, fatigue, frustration, and a steadfast fight for a cure that had been denied by her insurance and which was prohibited in the United States by the FDA, she was the recipient of an autologous stem cell transplant. This treatment eliminated three concurrent autoimmune diseases which she had been told would end her life within months. Through her own self-advocacy strategies and the support of a powerful team of physicians, she found the treatment that could save her life. But because it was extremely expensive and had to be done outside of the United States, fund-raising efforts by her family and friends helped make it possible.  Cristy determined that the best way to thank those who 
helped her was to pay it forward by sharing her successful strategies with others 
who face difficult medical challenges. As a first step in meeting that goal, Cristy published 5 S.T.E.P.S. to Being Your Own Patient Advocate, a book that tells the powerful story of her medical journey—a journey 
which took her from certain death to recovery and restoration, from 
waiting to die to learning to live. Whether you, someone you love, or a perfect stranger is struggling with medical challenges and finding no answers, Cristy's Five STEPS can provide the strategies to build an effective team to find and fund needed diagnoses and treatment.  With your support, she will make a difference for those who find themselves navigating a complex and often confusing medical maze for themselves or for someone they love. In pursuing her passion for paying it forward, Cristy urges everyone, whether healthy or ill, to adopt this mantra, My Health. My Body. My Voice. You are the expert on you, and you owe it to yourself to take charge of your health care.  In the gallery are videos and pictures that not only chronicle Cristy's story, but there are video interviews with a young couple who are just beginning their medical journey together with Cristy's guidance and the strategies described in the book. What We Need & What You GetThis campaign will fund a book tour from July 4-July 16 in four states (Confirmed for Illinois, Tennessee, South Carolina and Georgia.) The following is our plan of action and projected budget:
book talks and signings at independent bookstores and public libraries (see current tour dates and locations here)

workshops on behalf of assisted living and care facilities 
radio and tv interviews on local public radio and commercial stations in the cities where appearances are scheduled 
purchase of print books and handouts/gifts for participants in book signings and workshops (est. $3,200.00) 
airfare for the authors and manager (est. $3,297.00)
car rental and fuel for the majority of the tour (est. $1,532.00)
meals and accommodations for 14 days (est. $5,250.00)

As contributors, you will help patients and their caregivers learn how to take charge of their own health care issues and those of their loved ones, and you just might save a life. Our plan is not only to publish additional books (with workbooks) to 
serve a broader community of patients, caregivers, and medical 
professionals, but also to provide personalized service through 
workshops and one-on-one consultations, teaching patients and their caregivers how to open doors that have been shut by conventional healthcare systems. Cristy Kessler
 is an experienced motivational speaker and conference presenter.*The Five STEPS and their Guiding PrinciplesThe 5 S.T.E.P.S.are Sensibility, Teamwork, Education, Patience/Perseverance, Sustainability. They are based on the following principles:
We know what our bodies are telling us about our well being and we need the tools to communicate that clearly to our physicians.
We, along with our doctors and our network of family and friends, collaborate and work as a team for the most effective medical outcomes.
We do our own research regarding our medical issues and share our learning with team members who reciprocate with support and the sharing of knowledge.
We are patient with our bodies, ourselves, and others; we persevere regardless of setbacks and obstacles we encounter.
We recognize that our overall well being depends on sustaining not only the body, but also the mind and spirit.
If we do not reach our fundraising goal with this campaign, our priority will be to use the funds  to pay (1) for the books, handouts, and gifts for attendees at our events, and (2) to repay the authors and manager for out-of-pocket expenses during the tour, which we are obligated to complete.The ImpactYour participation in this campaign can make a difference for you or someone you love or even for a perfect stranger. Being sick stinks. It saps your strength and your spirit. 
Help us show others how to listen to what their body is telling them so they can communicate clearly with their doctors. (Sensibility)

Help us show others how to build a medical team that can reach effective medical solutions. (Teamwork)

Help us show others how to create a network of family and friends for encouragement and support when it is most needed. (Teamwork)

Help us show others how to find the most accurate, most recent information available that will lead to positive outcomes. (Education)

Help us show others when to accept the need to wait and when to push for more action. (Patience/Perseverance)

Help us give hope to those who feel hopeless. (Sustainability) 
Help us show others how to dare their souls to go beyond what their eyes can see. (Sustainability)
Your help may even save a life. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't help financially, you can use your voice and the Internet to help spread the word.
Join us at our book tour appearances (see current tour dates and locations here).

Tell your friends and neighbors about the book and our goals
Send emails and tweets.
Use Facebook to let your friends and followers know.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thanks for helping out and God Bless You.

story:
Hello!

 

My name is Mark Di Claudio and I am a husband, father and professional drummer based in Ste.Adèle, just north of Montreal. I have been playing drums for over 30 years and hold a Bachelor's degree in Music from Concordia University in Montreal.

 

My goal is to help kids learn to express themselves and discover their own personalities though the universal language of music. I play several instruments, can sing, read and write music. I am an excellent, experienced teacher but It's been 5 years since I've had a room in which to teach music!

 

You see, two years ago I bought a home in Ste.Adèle. I chose this house in particular for its huge garage space in which I could build a studio. My plan was set and seemed perfect until I was hit with a "hidden vice" : MOULD in the basement... it was EVERYWHERE. We had uncovered it after removing the wallpaper and carpet that had covered ALL the walls and floors...

 

Since then (two years!), I've been "negotiating" with the previous owners who have been completely uncooperative (even though they are legally responsible for making the necessary corrections!) so I now have no choice but to take the matter to court.

 

Because of all this (and the incurred lawyer's fees) I've completely depleted any savings set aside for building my soundproof studio. As a drum teacher, I absolutely need the room to be 100% soundproof and though I am able to build it myself, I now lack the funds to buy the materials needed.

 

Your help in funding this project will greatly help me pay for the basic building materials of the walls of my practice space: wood, gyproc, sonopan, insulation etc. and to get me back to teaching.  I'm planning to put together an after-school curriculum (individual lessons as well as "band" formations) for elementary and high school kids who don't have the money or the resources to learn music on their own!

 

I hope to reach my goal, but even if I don't, every penny will help and will help and be greatly appreciated!

 

Please help me to help the kids!

 

Thank you all so much,

 

Mark

 

(Please share this post)

story:
What's Up!

Hey Indiegogo! We're Save The Radio or STR, whichever you prefer! Our new album, "Calculating The Sum of Your Life" will be coming out March, 2014 on TaBull Records. We just released our first single called "Add It Up" to national radio a couple of weeks ago and it's been getting a really good response. We're thrilled & psyched a lot more people are starting to hear and dig our music! 

We are trying to finish the music video for the first single and we hope you can help us out. We want to make the video fun, spirited and a celebration of life and we want you guys to be a part of it! Below you can read what we're planning and some back ground on us. We hope you'll want to join us on this journey!! Much Love, STR

To hear "Add It Up" visit the band's website…www.savetheradiomusic.com


Help Us Cross The Finish Line!

We shot the first part of the music video at the "5K Color Run" in Clearwater, FL this past weekend. It was a Powdery Blast!! : ) The energy, camaraderie and spirit from the 4000 people that attended was incredible and exactly what we were looking to capture!  

And now we need YOUR HELP to cross the finish line!! The money raised from this campaign will go toward the second part of the music video which is the FULL BAND performance of the song. And YES, it will once again rain down all of that BRIGHT COLORFUL POWDER!! 

We have director Rob Reilly & Producer Lou Farragher from cineMOOK on-board. We also have some cool perks for you, including getting YOUR celebration photo/video in our music video!! But like the rest of us, you need to GET POWDERED as well! : )

The powder is cheap and easy to purchase online from places like Amazon (where we bought ours). Just do a search for "festival color powder". 

Then gather the people you love, "get powdered" and send us your photo or video!!

The Song...

The song "Add It Up" is a Celebration of Life and Love! Written by lead singer Shawn Scheller, the song was inspired by a real life event when a man tragically loses his wife in a auto accident, leaving behind 3 small children, then suddenly is diagnosed with cancer. The song's message is about what is important in life and how love can cross all barriers, even the here-after. 

And don't we all need to keep spreading the message of love?

Other Ways You Can Help

If cash is tight right now we understand, so if you still wanna help out, that's awesome!  Tell your friends! Post this page on your Facebook, Twitter and other social media sites.  And follow us on Facebook and Twitter to keep up-to-date with this project.


STR…Who we are!

Based in Tampa/Clearwater, FL. this hard-working, semi electric/semi acoustic band has been rocking the west coast of the sunshine state with their upbeat, good time, pop-rock sound for more than a half decade. Formed in Jan. 2008, "Save The Radio" has been drawing industry comparisons to such adult contemporary acts as Goo Goo Dolls and Matchbox Twenty. 

Whether they are opening up for bands such as Saigon Kick, Neon Trees, Soul Asylum, Eddie Money or Collective Soul, giving local support to Coldplay, MUSE, Daughtry or Duran Duran or helping the fans tail-gate to the Superbowl or World Series, STR has been paying their dues, growing their sound and building their fan base!

STR is...

  • Shawn Scheller - lead vocals/guitar/bass
  • Michael Mackewice - vocals/lead guitarist
  • TL Jentgens - drums/percussion
  • Joe Cosas - piano/bass/cello/mandolin/violin

    Signed to TazBull Records in May, 2013, "Save The Radio" is currently recording their NEW 5 song EP "Calculating The Sum of Your Life" @Clear Track Studios, in Clearwater, FL and mastering @Sterling Sound, NYC. The NEW EP is set to be released March, 2014.

    "Add It Up" hit national radio in Jan. 2014 and is currently 55 on the Mediabase Top 40 Chart!

    LA Radio Promotor Howard Rosen, who is handling the radio promotion side of things, has worked with such bands as Green Day, Hilary Duff, Nickelback, Bon Jovi, Norah Jones, Janet Jackson, Jason Mraz, Theory of a Deadman and many more. 

    Additional Links:

    • Clear Track Studios 
    • Sterling Sound 
    • Howard Rosen

story:
HELP US LAUNCH THE WOOL&GRANT DEBUT CD!  

(Watch the video above to hear us tell our story and to get a taste of the music.)

“WOOL&GRANT is the fresh new musical partnership of Ina May Wool and Bev Grant.They’ve both been gigging since childhood - solo and with master musicians all over the U.S. and in other countries from Scotland to El Salvador. Ina May barnstormed New England with The Ina May Wool Band and went on to record two award-winning, internationally released solo CD’s.  Bev was the founder and passionate out-front voice of the legendary political band, The Human Condition. Lots of other artists have covered Bev and Ina May’s songs.”

When we met a few years ago we found out we really liked singing with each other, so we wrote some new songs, rearranged some others, and played a bunch of shows. After every one somebody would come up to us and say, “I like that song. Is that on your CD?” We’d have to tell them we didn’t have a WOOL&GRANT CD. But now we do!

What We Need & What You Get

The CD’s all recorded and mixed.  Some of the best players in the world are on this recording: Tony Levin (bass) (Peter Gabriel, Paul Simon), Jerry Marotta (drums) (Orleans, Indigo Girls,Stevie Nicks), Ann Klein (guitars, mandolin, slide banjo)(Joan Osborne, Kate Pierson, Ani Difranco)

We co-produced the CD with Daniel A. Weiss (Broadway veteran of the original band of RENT, musical director around the world of Without You (Anthony Rapp). Daniel plays accordion, mandolin, bass and other instruments on the CD.

The cover is done, and it looks great!

We want you to hear this music. We want the world to hear it!

“The WOOL&GRANT debut CD has all the songs people ask for -- inspiring, heart rending, rollicking.”

All that’s left is getting the CD to you. The recording’s done. Now we need to pay for manufacturing, promotion, and shipping -- all ferociously expensive.

Contribute to this campaign, and you can be part of the WOOL&GRANT team. When you hear us on the radio or in concert, you’ll know you’ve helped make it happen. 

If you like, there are also other rewards for donating.  A concert in your home. Signed CD’s.  Ina May will write a song for you.  Bev will bring her We Were There show (about women in labor history) to your organization.  There are more.  Check ‘em out.

We’ve had terrific feedback from our audiences. They tell us they’re glad someone is getting the word out about the South African granny soccer team, about mountaintop removal and immigration and the dangers of fracking, and about how it is to be alive now with stories of love and loss and defiance and connection. There’s a community of people who want to hear this music and these stories. You can help us reach those who’ve asked for these songs and those who’ll be glad to discover them. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don’t have spare cash to contribute, Ina May and Bev know all about that. Tell people about this campaign. If you help spread the word, we’ll be extremely grateful.  Indiegogo has some share tools directly below the video above.

story:
Intro

After a year of stage electro-house at clubs and festivals, a first album and a constant demand from our fans, we are ready to record a new album "OXO-ONE".

Why this project?

It was a little difficult to relax during the period that followed the first album, but now we are eager to start the next one. The search for new ideas and new sounds begin to sparkle and rekindle the sacred fire within us :) After this first Album experience, we have refined our references and choice in the color we want to give to this new album, we really believe in it and we want to share with you. While labels are increasingly lost in the world of music, we have decided to no longer be constrained by the blinders of a record. And we always wanted to make music for clubbing fans. Our philosophy is a free music reaching as many people as possible through clubs and festivals. Make people dance and dream has always been our motivation. Fundraising with INDIEGOGO allow us to fully invest ourselves in this new album without any constraints or other artistic director or producer. We can work on our own productions as we understand it, work with people we want, reserve the studio we love and entirety supervise the work: from composition, mixing, mastering, graphic, manufacturing, to promoting and communication. You have the chance to create with us a memorable album reflecting our electro-house universe.

Who are we?

We are both passionate about music since our childhood. Growing up, we had many influences such as Hip-Hop U.S., Rock, Reggae, House music, Electro and everything that make people dance . Our experiences of our eclectic DJ and producer led us to work with people prestigious world music.

Your donations?

Your pledges will help ensure the quality of the album and the visual of our shows. Anyone who contributes to financing receives news of the progress of the project by e-mails, photos and of video clips. Your funding will also allow us to make physical copies to distribute, promote and distribute our music to a largest audience. Ultimately, your support is essential to the smooth running of the project and the creation of this album. We could not be more grateful than by providing music and shows of quality.

 

In the end?

Our greatest wish, is to make this album and play in an international tour in front of an enthusiastic audience of electronic music. Your participation will foster the creation of a great album as well as the best shows in the world of clubbing.

Contributions?

Discover below the benefits you will receive from contributing to this album, whatever your contribution, it will give you access to project development with proprietary information reserved for donors. Therefore, share around you this event can bring us a lot.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR EVERYTHING AND STAY TUNE !

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
My Idea & Dream

I am 29 years old from Manchester, UK. My story isn't exactly a straightforward one. I am a Struggling Musician who has so much to say and do with my material if only had the kickstart to do so. Obviously to ask you guys to fund my project it is only fair you recieve my upmost honesty so although this might hinder my chances of a great kickstart I will tell you about my self, for anymore details please don't hesitate to contact me. Here goes, In August 2012 I was released from prison after serving an 8 year sentence for possessing a firearm and supplying drugs. Whilst in prison I made huge changes to my life, I educated myself and built up a great relationship again with all my family which continues to flourish. Whilst in prison I found the real music in me. I have always played guitar and sang but was unaware unitill I had the time to practise, that I could write. After years of proving I had turned my life in a completely different direction, I was sent to an open prison where I formed a band with other musicians, we played gigs in the prison and all around the surrounding community to raise funds for local charities, mainly drug rehabilitation charities etc, connected to anti-reoffending. 

At Present I (for obvious reasons) am struggling more than most in this economy to find a job. Music is my passion and something I don't just want to do for a living but feel that I 'have to' do. I am currently playing small venues all over Manchester but struggling to get together enough money for a demo recording. I have arranged a studio, promotion, suport gigs and much larger venues and publicity, all of which cannot go ahead without a demo (promo) recording of my material.

With the funding I am asking for, there is no two ways about it, A fantastic career will be kickstarted, I can put the promo out to the powers who can get me into the music world and I can finally put my dream into reality. I don't want it handed to me on a plate, I work very very hard at it and just need a kickstart, With this promo I will 100% get the gigs and recognition I need to Fund an Album which will be a major major shot at a fantastic career.

 

The Funding & its use

I need £500. There is no complex explanation. The studio in Manchester I intend to use are ready for me, It will cost me £300 for the 2 days I need to record, edit and produce a 3 track CD with £200 to make copies for promotion. It really is as simple as that. I'll even be getting a buss with my guitars etc to the studio to save money. :)

Perks, As you can see, At this moment I have nothing Major to offer, However, I promise this, Every funder for my project will get full mention in My promo sleeve, They will also get a hard copy of the CD mailed to them. And I My main sleeve in the upcoming Album will consist of the funders own projects and details. And the person I am, I will never EVER forget you. Even if I make it to the top which I intend to, My amateur recording of my demo received over 12,000 views in the first 24 hours. :) My material is good enough and being recognised in the songwriting circles.

 

The Future Plan

 

Regardless, I WILL end up recording my Album and Coming from the life experiences I've had, I 100% will always dedicate a lot of time to anti-drug and gun crime charities. Percentages of my earnings from my music will ALWAYS go to these causes as it really does help with youth projects and many more intervention and aftercare projects and It also is a way for me to give back to the communities I once let down.

If you can't donate, please at least have a look at my music and pages. They are in their infancy but WILL amount to something. I work too hard for it not too. Bless anyone who is or is even thinking of contributing. I have only just been introduced to this sort of funding method and I fully intend in the future to give a lot back on here myself. Please feel free to contact me all call me regarding any queries you may have 07432084745. I am just an average guy from an average family persuing his dream, please be the person to help me. :)

story:
The Story behind Letters Home

 

Back by patriotic demand, “Letters Home: A Memorial Day Remembrance Concert” was uniquely created in 2011 for the community to remember soldiers of the past, present and future by reciting actual letters written home from local servicemen and women of the Fox Valley area. With beautiful musical tapestry by select members of the Fox Valley Concert Band, Fox Valley Rep actors will weave in soldier’s letters written to friends and family during their time of service in two performances over Memorial day weekend.

 

Last year’s concert featured World War II love letters from the parents of Sarah Giachino, co-founder of Fox Valley Troop Support Inc. Sarah's father, Purple Heart recipient Charles Hardman, was a Lieutenant in the Army, 117th Infantry, 30th Division.  The reciting of these letters, together with music, formed a powerful event of remembrance and celebration.


“This year, we’ve already been in contact with a contract officer named Luke, First Lieutenant in Chaos Troop of the First Squadron of the 40th Cavalry Regiment. Luke’s letters home to wife Ariel, a Naperville native, will be featured in this memorable concert,”says Fox Valley Rep Artistic Director John Gawlik. “This year’s program will also include letters representing Vietnam and the Korean conflicts.”


The Impact Locally and Abroad
Letters Home is a way to bridge generations between soldiers and loved ones, and share their stories. This project intimately shares insight into the relationships between soldiers and loved ones separated by distance and worldly conflict. By bringing these stories to life, we hope to share a glimpse of the true sacrifice made by Veterans now and long ago. People today can help support our troops by writing letters to our soldiers and sending care packages through the work of the local Fox Valley Troop Support - a beneficiary of this project. 


What We Need & How Your Support Helps!
As Fox Valley Rep and select members of the Fox Valley Concert Band unite in 2012, the need is to raise awareness for our troops and the sacrifices they have made. To put on this concert, showcase these stories, and raise awareness for the cause, we need your help! Ticket sales will only cover a portion of the costs and a generous portion of ticket proceeds benefit both Fox Valley Concert Band and Fox Valley Troop Support! Funds raised through this campaign will help support the overall project with a goal of reaching over 600 attendees and writing over 100 letters to deployed service men and women.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you donate, we hope you will also come to the show on Friday, May 25 at 8pm or Saturday, May 26 at 8pm! Please also spread the word about this project by sharing the website with friends and family. http://foxvalleyrep.org/LettersHome/

story:
We are trying to raise money for our son Carson.  He will be a junior in the fall at Fargo North High School.  He has recently been selected by his band director, Mr. Tessman, to participate in a music performance tour of Europe during the summer of 2013.

The Northern Ambassadors of Music is a select honor group composed of students from North Dakota and Montana, chosen through director nominations. 

Those unable to afford the cost of the tour have been encouraged to seek sponsors.

Carson is on the honor roll at North High.  He is a member of the varsity football team and he lettered in the sport last fall.  He also lettered in Band and Pep Band.  Carson plays the guitar and the trombone (he will be playing trombone on the tour).

Carson is an active member of Hope Lutheran Church where he was confirmed last fall and now participates in the Real Life Youth Group.  Carson also works part time at Hornbacher's Grocery Store.

The group will perform in England, France, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Austria, Italy, and Germany during July 9 - July 24, 2013.

We consider this a life changing opportunity for Carson and greatly appreciate the generosity of Carson's sponsors.

story:
The Grand Rapids Symphonic Band  is a non-profit adult community band based in Grand Rapids, Michigan USA. We perform 5 - 6 concerts per season and rehearse every Thursday night from 7:30 - 9:45 pm.  There are lots of music professionals in our band but also just regular folks who still want to perform challenging music in a high level concert band.

We are hoping to raise $3,000 to help fund our Authentic Sousa Concert concert and make it a GREAT nostalgic experience for everyone! There will be at least 3 soloists, and some great surprises along the way. The concert will be held Saturday May 4, 2013 at 7:00 pm in the Fine Arts Center of Grandville High School, 4700 Canal Ave. SW · Grandville, MI 49418

 

All of our perks include either a digital download of the concert OR a professionally recorded CD. At the $500 level you would have the opportunity to CONDUCT THE BAND during the Sousa concert.  The funds will go to pay our soloists, to purchase music, to buy goodies for the fun reception, for advertising, props and costumes. Any extra money we may get will go toward purchasing more new band music as well as some new instruments (specialty instruments, percussion) to replace some of our very old and worn equipment. 

This is our conductor, Barry Martin, in the John Philip Sousa costume. We also have him wear a fake beard and moustache for the concert :-)

This year we are hoping to embellish the costume even more to make Barry more uncomfortable AND to more closely match the one that Sousa wore.

 

 NOTE: Because we are a non-profit organization, this campaign can only accept Credit Card payments and not paypal.

John Philip Sousa (November 6, 1854 – March 6, 1932) was an American composer and conductor of the late Romantic era, known primarily for American military and patrioticmarches. Because of his mastery of march composition, he is known as "The March King" or the "American March King" due to his British counterpart Kenneth J. Alford also being known as "The March King". Among his best-known marches are "The Washington Post", "Semper Fidelis" (Official March of the United States Marine Corps), and "The Stars and Stripes Forever" (National March of the United States of America)
