story:
Send Grace of the Satin Dollz to the UK!

Support the Dollz in our effort to go on a UK tour with our pals the Jive Aces 

Support me, Gracie, in getting across the pond! Your funds will get me there so I can Sing and Swing this summer with the Jives.

The Satin Dollz will be performing at the War and Peace Revial and a number of other locations.

We're also recording a new single with the Jive Aces that you can receive, hot off the presses, for contributing to our travel fund!

Fund our flights!

Let's be honest, Air Travel is expensive these days! I need to raise $1500 for my ticket so I can charm audiences all over Great Britain!

Hey, What's in it for me?

See to the right for a range of perks! From our new EP to the Dollz performing at your next event any contribution will get you a piece of the Dollz! Don't let our options limit you though, click on through to contribute any denomination of your choosing!

xoxoxo

Grace Lamour

story:
Short Summary

We are a legitimate 501(c)(3) nonprofit and run the Marching Cobras as an open after school program for pre-teens and teens to have constructive to do  after school/

Our band director 's passion for kids and music helped him start the Marching Cobras in 2009 and he runs a structured and disciplined program where kids have expectations and learn a skill. We partner with parents so that they have a 2nd set of eyes making sure their kids stay on the right track and keep their grades up.

This campaign is so very important for us because our equipment is old and worn.  At one of our parades in March, a leg rest fell off, but our kids never miss a beat and just kept on drumming while a staff member scooped up the piece. Another one has no more cushion in his leg rest so it is bothersome on his thigh, but he does his job and keeps up with the band. THESE KIDS ARE EXTREMELY DEDICATED TO THE BAND!  In another parade in March, a doctor noticed that the skin on one of our bass drums was broken but he loved our sound. He offered to puchase for us a new bass drum and told us to order it and send him the invoice! We are so grateful to him! Thanks Dr. Sullivan!

By donors offering even $1, every dollar goes directly to the purchase of quality equipment for our bandmembers so that they can deliver great a great sound to the crowds.

What We Need 

We need about $3500 as a start to get a few new snares and bass drums for the kids that don't hurt their legs to play. We always have to carry bandaids to parades.  : (

Even if we don't meet our goal, which we hope we will, every penny collected will buy whatever drum(s) we can afford.

The Impact On The Kids

No amount is too little to contribute. We appreciate EVERY donation big and small because it puts us one step closer to purchasing decent equipment where the kids will be more comfortable walking those long parades, playing and doing the choreography without discomfort.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't afford to donate money, that's ok. We ask if you could please help us by sharing our campaign with others who may want to help.
  • Please remember that you can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • We thank you all so very much for your help!

story:
Hi from Oakland CA’s Felsen.  We’ve got big plans and dreams and we need your help!  

First and foremost, we have just made our finest recording. Done. Yup.  We wrote 12 brand new songs--easily our best stuff.  We recorded it and mixed it at our bass player Cristian’s house in the east bay.  And now it’s time to take it to the people.  We’re planning our biggest tour ever right now.  On his desk right now, Arthur has his big map of the US out and he’s ready to stick a push pin in your city.  This will be a 16 city tour of the US--about 7000 miles of driving.  We’ll be going to a bunch of the cities we hit last summer and hitting a few new ones too.  We’re also hiring a proper PR firm from NEW YORK CITY to help us finally get the amount of good press we deserve. But we need your help and support to help us pay for gas, food, vehicle rental, postage, motels, printing up the CDs....

Here’s a breakdown of what we’ll need:

postage 500

PR 1500

gas 1000

cd duplication 1500

minivan 1300

motels 500

Tshirts 400

incidentals 300

total $7000

 

We’re really amped up about going on tour, as of today, we have about half of the tour booked.  So far we’ll be playing in Reno, Denver, Wichita, Sioux City, Minneapolis, Chicago, Valparaiso IN (AG’s hometown), Aberdeen SD, Missoula MT and more dates are being added every day. Get your couch ready and your fridge stocked. We’re gonna be tired and hungry.  

This will be the first time we’ve enlisted outside help in getting us press (hopefully favorable press) for this album.  But ouch, that’s expensive!  We’re putting 250 CDs in the mail for journalists at Rolling Stone Magazine, Spin, Magnet, NPR, Village Voice, USA Today, San Fran Chronicle, LA Times...

Preview one of our new tunes here.

What, helping us keep rock and roll alive not enough of a reward in and of itself?  Well then, to sweeten the deal, we’re offering some great rewards. Please check it out AND most importantly, Thank You for your help and support.  We really do love you!

Dylan, Andrew, Art & Cristian.

story:
Welcome!

Hello everyone! Thanks for visiting my campaign.  My name is Cluny Macpherson.  I am a singer, songwriter and multi-instrumentalist based in Victoria, BC, Canada.  In the last ten years, I’ve been involved in numerous projects and I’m a well-known figure in the Victoria music scene.  My current project is a band called the Mighty Moonshiners.  Our repertoire draws heavily from bluegrass, blues, jazz and folk traditions.  We’re in the fourth year of our residency at Swans Brewpub in Victoria.  Please take a minute to visit our website at: www.moonshinersbluegrass.ca

Now, I’m poised to begin a recording project with award winning producer, Adrian Dolan (Ruth Moody Band, The Wailin’ Jennys, The Bills, Outlaw Social, Jenny Ritter Band, The Sweet Lowdown).  I’m so excited! The project will consist of seven songs composed by myself and feature Adrian’s instrumental and producing talents as well as those of Oliver Swain (Outlaw Social, Red Stick Ramblers, The Bills) on bass and Mick Baker (The Fairmonts) on mandolin.  It will be recorded at Baker Studios in Victoria, which has been the venue for numerous award-winning albums.  This project is the culmination of all of my efforts thus far as a musician.  It represents my life’s work up to this point and its success depends in part on your support.

Let me break it down:

The approximate projected cost of this recording is as follows as per the budget drafted by my producer:

3000.00 for engineering and mixing

2100.00 for studio rental

420.00 for mastering

450.00 for equipment rental

I’ve also budgeted 1200.00 for graphic design of the album cover and manufacture of the album.

I’ve managed to put together enough for a deposit of 1200.00 in order to secure my time in the studio and secure the services of my producer.  I will personally cover some additional costs such as paying the musicians for their work on the sessions and am applying for a recording grant in order to help fund the project. 

The rewards for your contribution are varied.  Like most other crowdfunding campaigns for recording projects, I’m offering pre-sales of the album.  This is a good, low commitment way to help it along.  I also want to mention, however, that cooking is one of my stronger suits.  Think how great it would be to have me come and make you brunch.  Mmmm.  Hollandaise.

One final note

The material I’m recording is very dear to me and also holds some meaning for the folks in the Victoria area who have heard it.  People seem to think it’s pretty good! I’m hoping that this recording will find its way to a wider audience and you can help make that happen! Who knows, maybe one of my songs is your favourite song and you just don’t know it yet. Probably.

We live in tough times and I recognize that some of you are keen to help, yet unable to make a financial contribution.  That’s okay! I appreciate all forms of support including sharing the campaign with your friends.  Kind words are also nice.

Please stay tuned for updates! I'll be releasing a video of one of my songs before the campaign ends so you can check in on our progress.  I think this whole endeavour is going to be pretty great and I’d be really grateful for your participation.  Thanks again for visiting!

Best,

Cluny
story_txt:
Welcome!
Hello everyone! Thanks for visiting my
campaign.  My name is Cluny Macpherson.  I am a singer, songwriter and
multi-instrumentalist based in Victoria, BC, Canada.  In the last ten years, I’ve been involved in
numerous projects and I’m a well-known figure in the Victoria music scene.  My current project is a band called the
Mighty Moonshiners.  Our repertoire draws
heavily from bluegrass, blues, jazz and folk traditions.  We’re in the fourth year of our residency at
Swans Brewpub in Victoria.  Please take a
minute to visit our website at: www.moonshinersbluegrass.ca
Now, I’m poised to begin a recording
project with award winning producer, Adrian Dolan (Ruth Moody Band, The Wailin’
Jennys, The Bills, Outlaw Social, Jenny Ritter Band, The Sweet Lowdown).  I’m so excited! The project will consist of
seven songs composed by myself and feature Adrian’s instrumental and producing
talents as well as those of Oliver Swain (Outlaw Social, Red Stick Ramblers,
The Bills) on bass and Mick Baker (The Fairmonts) on mandolin.  It will be recorded at Baker Studios in
Victoria, which has been the venue for numerous award-winning albums.  This project is the culmination of all of my
efforts thus far as a musician.  It
represents my life’s work up to this point and its success depends in part on
your support.
Let me
break it down:
The approximate projected cost of this
recording is as follows as per the budget drafted by my producer:
3000.00 for engineering and mixing
2100.00 for studio rental
420.00 for mastering
450.00 for equipment rental
I’ve also budgeted 1200.00 for graphic design of the album cover and
manufacture of the album.
I’ve managed to put together enough for a
deposit of 1200.00 in order to secure my time in the studio and secure the
services of my producer.  I will
personally cover some additional costs such as paying the musicians for their
work on the sessions and am applying for a recording grant in order to help
fund the project.  
The rewards for your contribution are
varied.  Like most other crowdfunding
campaigns for recording projects, I’m offering pre-sales of the album.  This is a good, low commitment way to help it
along.  I also want to mention, however,
that cooking is one of my stronger suits. 
Think how great it would be to have me come and make you brunch.  Mmmm. 
Hollandaise.
One
final note
The material I’m recording is very dear to
me and also holds some meaning for the folks in the Victoria area who have
heard it.  People seem to think it’s
pretty good! I’m hoping that this recording will find its way to a wider
audience and you can help make that happen! Who knows, maybe one of my songs is
your favourite song and you just don’t know it yet. Probably.
We live in tough times and I recognize that some of you are keen to help,
yet unable to make a financial contribution. 
That’s okay! I appreciate all forms of support including sharing the
campaign with your friends.  Kind words
are also nice.Please stay tuned for updates! I'll be releasing a video of one of my songs before the campaign ends so you can check in on our progress.  I think this whole
endeavour is going to be pretty great and I’d be really grateful for your
participation.  Thanks again for visiting!
Best,
Cluny

story:
The Beginning

Hey ya'll, this is Gabriel Rodreick here. I'm the lead man out of Treading North. Almost 6 years ago on July 6th 2008, I was in a diving accident that rendered me a C5 Quadriplegic, meaning I've spent that time in a wheelchair. Before the accident, I was a Pianist with the hopes of making music for the rest of my days. My injury put those dreams on hold, because I lost the ability to use my hands. So for the first 3 years out of my injury I figured I wouldn't be able to make music my career since I had lost the most essential part of my ability to create music. 

It wasn't until December 2011 that I discovered a new instrument, my voice. I've always sang, even after my accident. But I never felt attached to the sound that came out of my mouth. On the day I found my voice I was singing along to Ray LaMontagne and Tom Waits, and I found a sound that I loved and felt a connection to. So I started writing a song, our first track on the album, "This". Once I finished the song I hit up some friends of mine who I knew not only played instruments, but played them well. 

The Project

After almost 2 years of working together, we are working on our debut full-length album called Beautiful Gone Wrong. Most of these songs started out on my computer. Some of the songs were entirely written by me, and some of the songs I came up with a simple structure and chord progression then brought it to the band who put their own flavor on it. Like butter or hot sauce or something like that.

Personally, this is my dream. It's my dream to write music with some cool people for the rest of my days. Maybe along the way do some traveling and play my music for the people who need to hear it. But this isn't just my dream anymore, this is 6 other people's dream who are as much a part of this as I am. But we can't do it on our own.

The Money

This is where you guys come in. If you love us give us  money!
No, but in all seriousness if you have even a dollar to spare that can help. If we get 100 of those 1 dollar donations, that's enough for us to get 1 song recorded! So literally anything you can spare, we will be eternally grateful!

The money we're raising will go to a few different things.

First, to the actual recording process. Laying down tracks, the mixing of those tracks to make everything sound all sparkly and fun and then to the mastering of the tracks, which will make everything radio ready!

Second, to the production of CDs and band merchandise. If you've ever been to a Treading North show, we never have anything to give our fans. No music, no shirts, nothing for you guys to remember us by. And we don't want you to be sad!

Third, whatever is left will go to one of three things. More merch, band equipment, or we're gonna convert it all into dollar bills and throw it off the Lightrail bridge that goes over Lake St. We probably won't do the latter, but we will definitely do one of the first 2. I'm just trying to be interesting.

So, if you have some money to spare and you didn't become bored or offended by my ramblings about my band and our project, we will gushingly welcome your donations. If you have no money to spare and are excited about our project, please share the link to this page on your Facebook, Twitter, Email or any other weird Social Network you're a part of. Like Tumblr, what is that? If you hate the idea of giving us money because I offended you or you just hate me or one of my band members. Or maybe you just downright don't enjoy our music. That's okay we can internet high five instead!

Check out all the things you can get if you give us some money!

The People

First off we have Nick "Choker" Meza, drummer. Despite having a cliche drummer's name, Nick is no ordinary drummer. He was also part of a slight mishap when he was younger. He was accidentally brought to a garbage dump, and ended up in a highly radioactive section of the dump and lived there for 3 days. No one knows how he survived, but he did and now has forearms of steel and a superhuman reaction time (unless he's been taking muscle relaxants), which make him one of the most melodic drummers I've ever heard.

Second, we have Miles Jamison. The coolest mother f**** on the planet (sorry Carol). But maybe that's because he's not from this planet. I won't go into detail because of legal restrictions, but ever since Miles picked up a guitar he's been miles (i like puns shut up) ahead of any guitar player on this earth. His rhythm is always on, the chords he plays are far better than any drug you've tried. Therefore he's out of this world. 

Third and fourth are Jack Stanek and Elena "Average Listener" Hansen. These two are a curious pair. There was a short time that the rest of us thought they were dating. They were always showing up at practice together, then leaving together. They're always looking at each other and sharing some sort of non-verbal communication. But then one day we walked in on them doing something and they frantically started covering their bodies trying to hide something from us. Then it hit me, they're superheroes! They were trying to cover their costumes! Which also explains their outlandish musical abilities.

Fifth is Tyler "Frosty" Croat. Tyler is probably the most normal person in the band. Sure he's had his run ins with the law (ask him about the Octopus and the Canine Unit at the Red Lobster sometime, it's a great story), the occasional "trip up north to visit the fam" and despite being regularly dipped in bleach throughout his childhood. He somehow, despite all of his normalities, PLAYS SOME OF THE SEXIEST SAXOPHONE YOU WILL EVER HEAR.

Last but the furthest thing from the least, is "Licker/Liqour" Doug Loll, the BBQ Sauce, the sugar on top, the whipped cream of our music. He plays guitar on the same level that Miles does. Though Miles has always had his rare musical talent because of where he came from, we believe Doug's talent was actually given to him. He's only able to describe it in small detail, but Doug believes he was abducted by aliens a few years ago and thinks aliens programmed his brain with insane musical abilities. It would also explain why he's so nervous at shows. All those lights!

And here is me.

That's all.


Shout-out to Tony Schurbon and Adam Paulus.

They recorded us, and would be done mixing us but we are being extremely picky and probably driving them crazy...we love them for putting up with us and making our music possible!!! If you ever see them, please give them a hug.

story:
Background

First off, THANK YOU for taking the time to read this :)

With so much clutter, clunk, detritus, and distractions on the internet, we don’t want to take up more of your time staring at a screen than is necessary, so we’ll keep this as brief as possible.

We’ve been putting this album together for close to a year now, but the underlying motivations and reasons for making it have been fomenting for most of our lives - and this is when it’s all coming together. Bear’s been traveling the world as Burning Man’s roving Social Alchemist, working to connect communities in new and novel ways... but as much as he loves organizing through network and hands-on “pitching,” he’s also been deeply honing his craft as a musician -- and for him, this album is the essence of the storytelling that has permeated from his global experiences.

Music has always been a huge part of Bear’s life -- he sung opera as a child, was bugle boy at camp, and picked up the guitar at 13 on a childhood expedition from Scarsdale, New York to the Utah Desert. His study of music has been through deeply immersive experiences, studying North Indian Classical music at Oberlin from his teacher, or “guruji,” Hasu Patel, and studying diverse ethnomusical traditions in his travels.

And now his traveling has brought him to the point of making this album. In June of 2012, Bear reconnected with Doce Luna (the producer of "Radio Beartopia,") a bass player from an Obama benefit he had played in New York City four years earlier, at an Obama benefit . Luna reached out to Bear via Facebook to join him at the Bold Academy - a personal accelerator, “real life school for superheroes,” in Boulder, Colorado. Luna is a deeply steeped and studied musician, having gotten a degree in jazz performance at the Manhattan School of Music, where he performed an eclectic mix of jazz, classical, rock and electronic music, which culminated in a Latin Grammy nomination for his work with the Manhattan School of Music Afro-Cuban Jazz Orchestra. After spending years as a professional bassist - his calling - he tragically, in a freak accident, paralyzed his left hand, a condition that doctors said was likely permanent. This accident put a sudden stop to his performing career, and he reached out to Bear in need of life recalibration.  

Not a day later, Luna arrived in Boulder, and him and Bear began a deep, inventive collaboration, blending analog and digital, melody and production, in unique and novel ways. Luna fully dove into developing his music production skills, as a means of continuing to make music with a paralyzed hand. Subsequently, Bear convinced Luna to move to San Francisco and to come to Burning Man, where Bear was organizing live music experiences. Since his paralysis left him, somewhat paradoxically, with more freedom of movement, Luna happily obliged. And while at the Burning Man event his hand had finally recovered to the point where he was able to pick up the bass once again. Their first performance, a “Cosmic Cruise,” took place on top of a psychedelic double decker art-bus, with the North Mississippi Allstars’ Cody Dickinson on drums. This performance was, in fact, the first time that Luna had played the bass since his accident.

After Burning Man, Cody invited Bear to come down to Zebra Ranch Studios, and lay down some tracks with him and his brother, Luther Dickinson (North Mississippi Allstars, The Black Crowes). Flattered by the invitation, and feeling a desire to update his material, Bear embarked on a songwriting binge, the majority of which took place on a small boat in the Mediterranean, where he and some folks from Burning Man were on a vacation / strategic ideation retreat. It was in the context of philosophical strategy mixed with the ancient ruins and amphitheatres of the Greeks, Mycenaeans, and others, that he rediscovered his muse, writing a “boatload” of new songs, and producing a rough EP of the material, using nothing more than GarageBand and his MacBook Air’s laptop mic. Armed with this material, Bear went to Mississippi to work with the Allstars.

After returning from nearly a week of recording 12+ songs with the North Mississippi Allstars at the Zebra Ranch, he brought the tracks to Luna, with an initial reluctance for much tinkering. Luna, despite Bear’s initial attachment to the “purity” of the Mississippi tracks, immediately began dissecting and re-tooling them, and thus instigated the beginnings of the Radio Beartopia sound - defined by a stark juxtaposition of acoustic and electronic genre stylings, nevertheless unified by theme, mood, and overall style.

With original tracks recorded in Mississippi, Turkey, San Francisco, Malibu, New York and at the legendary Royal Studios in Memphis, where Al Green recorded his oeuvre  - Radio Beartopia is a record with a truly diverse and international sound. Bear & Luna are now working with Jerry Harrison (Talking Heads) and ET Thorngren (who mixed and mastered over 100 legendary records, including Bob Marley’s “Legend”) on the mixing and mastering of the record.

The Record. 

“Radio Beartopia,” as a title, is intended to evoke the central idea of the record - that in terms of concept, it is sort of like switching between different radio stations, between different styles - but having those various styles and concepts be unified by Bear’s lyrical presence, and by the overall mood and arc of the album. And even the classical radio station is represented - several tracks on the album are instrumental works by Luna, that he composed for an eighteen piece electroacoustic ensemble, including a string quartet, woodwinds, horn section, classical percussion, rock percussion, and synthesizers.

Where We’re Currently At.

We’ve recorded an absolute ton of tracks, and explored just about every detail and potential variation in the absolutely metamorphic process that has been birthing this record. We’re about 90% done with the tracking and editing process on 14 tracks, although we are still TBD about our launch timeline, and whether we want to release an EP before the LP, etc. We have several music videos in development and our website, beartopia.com, is launching imminently. We’ve retained Oliver & Sabec LLP (Grateful Dead, Burning Man) as counsel and we have Jim Walsh (Big Hassle) and a couple other friends helping with PR. We’re still making some decisions on the management front, but have a couple of incredible candidates for the role. As of now, we haven’t yet started meeting with potential booking agents.

This record has a diverse array of collaborators musically.

----

Bear Kittay Vocals, Acoustic Guitar, Electric Guitar, Sitar, Electric Sitar, Banjo, Melodica, Kazoo

Doce Luna Producer, Upright Bass, Electric Bass, Guitar, Synththesizers, Percussion

Cody Dickinson Drums, Piano, Percussion, Electric Washboard

Luther Dickinson Slide Guitar, Guitar, Mandolin

Memphis Gospel Singers Background Vocals

 

Give what you can. Spread the word through social networks or by picking up the phone, blogging or word of mouth. Let us know what you think! We do this together.

 

Thank you so much,

Bear Kittay

story:
I am excited to announce that this project has reached its goal 40 days ahead of schedule! That means the drum production can move forward as scheduled and a very special drum will be donated to the Ability Garden program at the Wilmington, NC arboretum.

But why should we stop there?

This project has the potential to reach 200% funding and I've been tipped off to a program here in Asheville called the Dragonfly Forest. These cats do some really cool things like hosting summer camp and after school programs for special needs children FREE OF CHARGE!. Yeah, that's awesome. And they have a rockin music program, so it sounds like we should kick them a drum right?  

check out their website Dragonfly Forest

The story

As many of you know I have a passion to build things, and over the past six years I have been building and designing drums made from recycled propane tanks.These drums have come a long way from the first one I built nearly six years ago...

Since my move to Asheville, North Carolina I have been contacting local machine shops in order to create a small production of drums which are precision cut to my design. After months of visiting machine shops and gathering estimates for their services I have found a shop that is up to the challenge and has supplied me with my first Laser-cut Flow Drum prototypes...

Each Flow drum is made of 211 steel from recycled propane tanks, lap-sized, cut with laser precision for optimal tone, and tunable over the years by the use of high powered magnets installed. Each drum can be tuned to the pentatonic scale of your choice.

The funds raised from this campaign will contribute to the cost of having these drums Laser cut, and will provide the consumables necessary (Blades, sandpaper etc) to make this production a success.


The Way It Works:

Indiegogo is a free online platform where anyone can raise money for important causes or projects that they are passionate about.  If I reach my goal then Indiegogo keeps 4% of my earnings and if I don’t reach my goal Indiegogo keeps 9% of my earnings.  All of my earnings will go towards funding of this drum production.

The Perks are the detail, which I am most excited about!  When you contribute toward my project you can receive one of the drums from this production, Discounts towards a future purchase of your drum or other percussive goodies available on my Etsy shop Flow Drum Percussion, or even have your drum painted by one of our featured artists on this campaign!

Artists include:

Annie Bennet -   Spectrum Geometry



Casey Dupree - Greyscale art



Zack Weaver -  Art Slab


Rob Fogle  -  Art Slab

Once the laser cutting process is complete you will be contacted personally and offered a variety of scales to choose from. Each scale contains 8 notes and cover one and a half octaves of a pentatonic scale.

Currently these are the scales I can offer
There are over 60 scales listed here so if you need help in determining which scale would suit you best feel free to contact me

Please note that all scales are tuned to A 440 Hz which is standard tuning for modern music.
Each scale can also be tuned to Pythagorean tuning which is A 432 Hz. This tuning is thought to resonate with the human body better but does not play well with most instruments today due to the standardization of tuning to A 440 Hz.

The Major Pentatonics
D Major      D E F# A B D E F#
C# Major    C# D# F G# A# C# D# F
C Major      C D E G A C D E
B Major      B C# D# F# G# B C# D#
A# Major    A# C D F G A# C D
A major     A B C# E F# A B C#
G# Major    G# A# C D# F G# A# C
G Major      G A B D E G A B
F# Major     F# G# A# C# D# F# G# A#

The Minor Pentatonics
D Minor       D F G A C D F G
C# Minor     C# E F# G# B C# E F#
C Minor       C D# F G A# C D# F
B Minor       B D E F# A B D E
A# Minor      A# C# D# F G# A# C# D#
A Minor        A C D E G A C D
G# Minor     G# B C# D# F# G# B C#
G Minor       G A# C D F G A# C
F# Minor      F# A B C# E F# A B

The Hijaz (Phygrian) Pentatonics
D Hijaz        D F G A# C D F G
C# Hijaz      C# E F# A B C# E F
C Hijaz        C D# F G# A# C D# F
B Hijaz        B D E G A B D E
A# Hijaz      A# C# D# F# G# A# C# D#
A Hijaz        A C D F G A C D
G# Hijaz     G# B C# E F# G# B C#
G Hijaz       G A# C D# F G A# C
F# Hijaz      F# A B D E F# A B

Integral Scales    (These are Hexatonic or six note scales)
D Integral     D E F A A# C D E
C# Integral   C# D# E G# A B C# D#
C Integral      C D D# G G# A# C D
B Integral      B C# D F# G A B C#
A# Integral    A# C C# F F# G# A# C
A Integral      A B C E F G A B
G# Integral    G# A# B D# E F# G# A#
G Integral      G A A# D D# F G A
F# Integral     F# G# A C# D E F# G#

Egyptian Scales
D  Egyptian    D E G A B D E G A
C# Egyptian   C# D# F# G# A# C# D# F#
C Egyptian     C D F G A C D F
B Egyptian     B C# E F# G# B C# E
A# Egyptian   A# C D# F G A# C D#
A Egyptian     A B D E F# A B D
G# Egyptian   G# A# C# D# F G# A# C#
G Egyptian     G A C D E G A C


Akebono Scales    (A Japanese Pentatonic Variation)
D Akebono    D E F A A# D D E F
C# Akebono  C# D# E G# A C# D# E
C Akebono     C D D# G G# C D D#
B Akebono     B C# D F# G B C# D
A# Akebono   A# C C# F F# A# C C#
A Akebono     A B C E F A B C
G# Akebono   G# A# B D# E G# A# B
G Akebono     G A A# D D# G A A#
F# Akebono    F# G# A C# D F# G# A

Pygmy Scales
D Pygmy    D E F A C D E F
C# Pygmy  C# D# E G# B C# D# E
C Pygmy    C D D# G A# C D D#
B Pygmy     B C# D F# A B C# D
A# Pygmy   A# C C# F G# A# C C#
A Pygmy     A B C E G A B C
G# Pygmy  G# A# B D# F# G# A# B
G Pygmy     G A A# D F G A A#
F# Pygmy    F# G# A C# E F# G# A

Be sure to add the Shipping Fee if you cannot redeem your drum personally from me in Asheville or Wilmington NC.

Here's a preview of our awesome T-shirts. (actual color of the shirt may vary, This preview is intended to display our logo)

Previous works

In the spring of 2012, after seeing some of my drums, The Arboretum at Wilmington, NC commissioned me to create an musical art installation to be featured in their new butterfly garden. After much thought, I designed a sculpture of a butterfly made entirely out of propane tanks incorporating Flow drums into the piece...

The arboretum hosts a program called the Ability Garden which teaches horticultural therapy for group homes, nursing homes, and people with special needs. While this piece was being installed one of the Ability groups full of children walked by and couldn't resist playing the butterfly drums. There's no greater feeling to me than seeing an art piece fully enjoyed. 

If this project reaches full funding, I will personally donate a Flow Drum to the Ability Garden for all to enjoy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • You can share this campaign on you Facebook, Twitter, or other social media networking site.
  • Visit and like our Facebook Flow Drums Page!
story_txt:
I am excited to announce that this project has reached its goal 40 days ahead of schedule! That means the drum production can move forward as scheduled and a very special drum will be donated to the Ability Garden program at the Wilmington, NC arboretum. 
But why should we stop there? 
This project has the potential to reach 200% funding and I've been tipped off to a program here in Asheville called the Dragonfly Forest. These cats do some really cool things like hosting summer camp and after school programs for special needs children FREE OF CHARGE!. Yeah, that's awesome. And they have a rockin music program, so it sounds like we should kick them a drum right?   
check out their website Dragonfly Forest
The story
As many of you know I have a passion to build things, and over the past six years I have been building and designing drums made from recycled propane tanks.These drums have come a long way from the first one I built nearly six years ago...
Since my move to Asheville, North Carolina I have been contacting local machine shops in order to create a small production of drums which are precision cut to my design. After months of visiting machine shops and gathering estimates for their services I have found a shop that is up to the challenge and has supplied me with my first Laser-cut Flow Drum prototypes...

Each Flow drum is made of 211 steel from recycled propane tanks, lap-sized, cut with laser precision for optimal tone, and tunable over the years by the use of high powered magnets installed. Each drum can be tuned to the pentatonic scale of your choice.The funds raised from this campaign will contribute to the cost of having these drums Laser cut, and will provide the consumables necessary (Blades, sandpaper etc) to make this production a success.

story:
Short Summary

 

Art Aguilera, un joven mexicano-americano nacido en California es salmista, compositor, productor y poseedor de un instrumento vocal privilegiado, que brinda a la escena de la música cristiana un nuevo horizonte.

Art es parte del nuevo mover de esta generación que no se conforma con el status quo, sino que se camina hacia una nueva dirección, característica que le distingue en la creciente industria de la música. Recibió su llamado a trabajar a tiempo completo como ministro de alabanza a la temprana edad de veintitrés años y recibe su cobertura del Ministerio NGC (Nueva Generación Cristiana) Global, con base en Weston, Florida.

Su primer álbum "Te Entrego Mi Vida" le abrió las puertas a la industria de la música cristiana y ha impactado las vidas de aquellos que lo han escuchado. Art ha expandido sus horizontes desde entonces y esto se ve reflejado en su nuevo álbum titulado "Asombroso Dios". Las canciones de este nuevo álbum demuestran mayor conocimiento de diferentes técnicas, un aumento en la creatividad, y lo que es más importante, una mayor revelación de quién es Dios.

En este tiempo Dios lo ha levantado con un manto profético para traer el Espíritu de avivamiento a una nueva generación de adoradores, y para trabajar en la unidad que provocará la manifestación de la Gloria de Dios en las naciones. Fluyendo en cántico nuevo que trae sanidad, restauración y avivamiento, Art también está comprometido con la formación de la generación emergente en esta nueva dimensión de adoración.

 

Lo que Necesitamos y Lo que Recibirás 

Nuestro Presupuesto está en $5,000. Esto incluye totalmente todo lo que se requiere para terminar este proyecto. Desde pagarle a los músicos que estarán grabando en vivo en la ciudad de Nashville, Hasta la Mescla y Masterización de 9 canciones. Además, estamos incluyendo la reproducción de los discos, el Arte de la caratula y la duplicación.
Queremos que sepas que al tu aportar cualquier cantidad se te dará de regreso un regalo de parte de nosotros. Ejemplo: Al aportas $5 se te estará mandando una ficha o foto autografiada por Art Aguilera. Si aportar $25 se te manda el nuevo álbum de Art y una foto de él autografiada con dedicación a ti.
Ahora, si tu llegaras a donar $2000 o + Tu nombre se pondrá en los créditos del nuevo álbum como Productor Ejecutivo del proyecto, Recibirás 10 copias de álbum y podrás asistir a un concierto de Art VIP. Al bajar la pagina podrás escoger que donación quisieras dar. Toda información y más esta al bajar la página. 

El Impacto que Tiene Tu Aporte 

Tu donación no solo tendrá un impacto en nuestro ministerio sino también impactara familias, ciudades y naciones alrededor del mundo.
QUEREMOS DEJARTE SABER QUE ESTO ES MAS QUE UN LLAMADO A PARTICIPAR EN UNA DONACION, SINO QUE ES UN LLAMADO A SER PARTE DE LA PRODUCCION DE ART AGUILERA. Al tu aportar no solo serás un aportador sino que te unirás al equipo que hizo realidad este Sueño de Dios en Art. Tu aporte y donación será de mucha bendición a nuestro ministerio y a todas las vidas que este proyecto alcanzara.
Estoy más que convencido que tu aporte no será en vano. Lo que tu aportes, ya sea $5, $25, $1000 será una siembra que producirá fruto al ciento por uno y tus graneros se llenaran y el pan en tu casa no saciara, Tus hijos y tus cosechas serán benditas.
Lo declaro sobre ti y tu familia. 

Otra Forma De Aportar

A lo mejor en este momento no puedes aportar a nuestro proyecto pero si puedes ayudar me en pasando la voz. Comparte este proyecto con tu círculo de influencia para que ellos puedan escuchar de mí y de esta campaña.
Puedes compartir esta campaña desde aquí mismo.
De antemano les doy las gracias por creer en lo que Dios ha depositado en mí y declaro que el favor y la misericordia de Dios te alcanzaran todos los días de tu vida.

Bendiciones, Art Aguilera y Equipo

story:
ABOUT DAYS N' DAZE

"The band's sound has been described as "crust punk", "crack rock folk", "folk punk", "riot folk",..and does have an edge that many folk punk acts suppress. Song themes run the gamut from social (gang violence, consumerism/terrorism, annihilation of the environment for corporate pocket-lining, the mundane and unavoidable anxieties of modern life, et al) to recreational (how the fuck did we end up in jail?).

What DnD is best known for is its live shows, which are energetic to the point of audience members stripping their clothes off in ecstatic, music-induced jubilation (or, too much PBR). Its played a variety of venues, from Houston's Walter's, Warehouse Live, Fitzgerald's, Mango's, Dan Electro's and others, to house shows at stalwarts like Ghetto Blaster, Ponderosa and House of Creeps. Out of town, its played two years on Brootal Sun Fest, at Skatopia's Bowl Bash and in Tompkins Square Park in NYC's Alphabet City. The band was honored to open the second day of performances at the 2011 Houston Free Press Summerfest, which featured headliner Weezer later that night.

Like any band of this millenia, DnD has employed the Internet to reach a broader audience. As of this writing, it has a following of over 2,100 on its Facebook page. A lot from Texas, Louisiana and the southwest, but also many on the west coast and the north east and west. On Reverbnation, the band's songs have been played more than 14,000 times as of this date. DnD lists over 3,400 fans on Reverb, many in the male 25-34 demographic, including abroad in places like Canada, Japan, the Ukraine, Kuala Lampur, Germany, France, and the United Kingdom." (Bio by Jesse Sendejas)

THE THINGS WE NEED HELP GETTING

  • Most importantly a van! Our last tour we had to forfeit all of our merch money we had been saving to rent a vehicle , that meant we had no shirts, stickers, or patches to sell while we we're out on the road (it sucked!)

  • A New CD!! We are releasing our sixth full length album intitled "Rogue Taxidermy" We will still be recording all of our music ourselves but need help getting prepared for our upcoming East Coast tour this fall.

  • We are coming out with two new DND shirts including one from our t-shirt contest that ends July 1st! Also we will spend a portion of anything earned to exclusive tour shirts with the band Dirty Kid Discount (Portland,OR).

  • Other Misc. merch like buttons, stickers, patches, etc.

WHAT WILL HAPPEN?

  • We will be able to tour!!! By helping us purchase a van we will be able to come to your town/city/village and play shows with not only Days N' Daze but with our side projects as well. We will have the funds to have merch at those shows and get there without the threat of canceling a tour or us breaking down on the way!

  • There will be neat prizes including exclusive "dibs" on the new cd, cassette tapes, new shirts, a vinyl split with Potbelly, new patches, and more!!!

  • We will (for once) have some legitimate merch when we go on tour and will still be providing free cds when we play shows!

LINKS!

www.facebook.com/daysndaze
www.daysndaze.com (tumblr)
www.daysndaze.bandcamp.com
www.youtube.com/user/DaysNDaze

THANKS TO EVERYONE!

There will be neat prizes including exclusive "dibs" on the new cd, cassette tapes, new shirts, a vinyl split with Potbelly, new patches, and more!!!

We will (for once) have some legitimate merch when we go on tour and will still be providing free cds when we play shows!



LINKS!
www.facebook.com/daysndaze


www.daysndaze.com (tumblr)
www.daysndaze.bandcamp.com
www.youtube.com/user/DaysNDaze
THANKS TO EVERYONE!

story:
INTRODUCTION

In November of 2009, I was asked a pivotal question during an interview with Culture Bot--the Arts & Culture publication. It was, "What skill, talent or attribute do you MOST  wish you had and why? Part of my response mentioned singing....."Even as a singer, I can actually sing. I could easily develop those skills with hard work and be ...the “would be” recording artist."  A pretty confident  answer (I know) but also one that  has secretly unplugged a dormant desire I've clearly had for many years. I want to PERFORM  as a solo artist!


THE TRANSITION

Like almost everything I've ever been remotely curious about in life... I decided to GO FOR IT! On October 30th I began vocal training. Weekly 45 minute sessions are both challenging and exciting and never take a backseat to my daily fashion and society reporting.  I use my experiences to support my new mindset--Tia Walker, performer. A trusted friend referred me to vocal coach Dana Calitri, a multi-platinum songwriter who has worked with Celine Dion, Mark Anthony and Daughtry among others as well as worked on numerous projects for networks including TV  and HBO. 

Several more months of training and a possible itunes track are in the works.


YOUR SUPPORT CAN MAKE IT HAPPEN!

It's time for the hard work I mentioned in that 2009 article. Quality vocal training takes a LOT of dedication and in all honesty a LOT of money.  I'm ready for the task but I need your help. Take a listen to my video music promo, If you think I have a shot, as a live performer, please do contribute TODAY.  I'd love your feedback and ultimately a donation or two--to defray the cost of weekly instruction and recording.  I never imagined I'd ever ask "support your local artist" in reference to myself...BUT....here I am.  Please support this project...it would mean the world to me!


DONATION AMOUNTS & PERKS

Any amount will help 2.00, 5.00,10.00 what have you.  However, DONATE at the 25.00 level and get a Celebrity Trials DVD. DONATE at the 50.00 level and get a hard cover copy of the society novel Recessionistas


Thank you to the Mid-Town East Venue of Masq for the use of their lovely space for the making of the music promo.

story:
We are Transmedia LA and you're invited to be a part of our very first immersive event production: UNTHINKABLE COMPLEXITY. 

THE EVENT

Transmedia LA has teamed with Wyrd Con 5 and Catmonkey studios to create its first transmedia production: UNTHINKABLE COMPLEXITY - an immersive, cyberpunk, cosplay event on May 24, 2014, in Los Angeles, celebrating the unthinkable complexity of human potential.

This is the first event in a series of annual events that will unite the cyberpunk community, both in Los Angeles and beyond.

  • COSTUMING: Attendees are asked to dress in cyberpunk-inspired attire. As we are currently entering the cyberpunk era, this is easy, but we can't wait to see where your imagination takes this! Cosplay welcome but not required.

  • MUSIC: Expect cyberpunk-inspired electronic dance music and in-world theatrical performances with guest DJ Amanda Jones.

  • DRINK: Alcoholic and non-alcoholic refreshments will quench your thirst and set your frequency for your future path (You must be 18 to enter, 21 to consume alcohol).

  • TECHNOLOGY and TRANSMEDIA: Virtual reality experiences, real-time social media integration, video projection, music, performance artists, and more surprises will keep everyone entertained and celebrating the 'unthinkable complexity' of the future. This event will be experienced across multiple platforms, so this is an opportunity to physically join an evolving narrative experience.

The best part? Even if you cannot physically attend the event, there will be options for you to participate.

WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES &
HOW YOU CAN HELP

We want to make this the best experiential event it can be, and we need your help to make that happen.

Your contributions are vital. Since Transmedia LA is a volunteer network, your contributions will enable us to create a meaningful and unforgettable experience.

We currently have Outerbody Labs flying in from San Francisco, as they're confirmed to run a virtual reality experience for VIP members and other selected individuals.

If we hit our financial goals, then we'll be able to expand in-world activities and increase the overall production value to ensure you the best experience possible.

YOUR FINANCIAL CONTRIBUTIONS WILL SUPPORT OUR PRODUCTION:

FOR A/V (SOUND AND LIGHTING)
WE NEED A MINIMUM OF $2,000 IDEALLY $3000

  • Sound Engineer

  • Light Engineer

  • Lights, Speakers, Mircrophones and other equipment

  • DJ
FOR EVENT PRODUCTION
WE NEED A MINIMUM OF $2,000 IDEALLY $3,000

  • Event design for structural materials such as stages, walls, fabric and other decorative elements to enhance the experience

  • Virtual Reality Experience

  • Staff to create, build and install the experience

  • Additional materials such as printed items, and additional experiential materials to interact with (taste, touch, feel, smell, experience)

IF WE CAN GO BEYOND OUR ESTIMATED $5000 GOAL, THEN WE CAN ADD: 

  • More Virtual reality technology
  • Performance artists
  • Additional staff and theatrical pieces to enhance the experience

In the simplest way possible, to contribute to our cause you can buy a discounted ticket to the event for $20 and join the experience first hand.

JUST ADDED BUY ONE GET ONE FREE!!!!!!!

BUY 1 GET ONE FREE NOW!!! Ticket prices are $25 now on the Wyrd Con Registration page and  will be $30 in May.

Due to the format of the event, there are only a limited number of tickets available. If you cannot attend, have no fear, we have some great perks in exchange for your kindness and support!

TO SEE GATES ONLINE: http://www.gatesthecomic.com

TO SEE GATES ONLINE: http://www.gatesthecomic.com


THE IMPORTANCE OF THE CYBERPUNK
Los Angeles is the “city of angels,” an influential city where entertainment drives innovation, fashion, culture and technology. Ridley Scott’s movie BLADERUNNER, based on Philip K. Dick’s book, DO ANDROIDS DREAM OF ELECTRIC SHEEP, is a groundbreaking work of cyberpunk. Made in 1982, the film took place in the dystopian world of Los Angeles, 2019.

There is no denying that the evolution of technology is bringing about major changes in the social order, i.e. global surveillance, genetic engineering, augmented reality, biomechanical prosthetics and on and on. The world envisioned by men like William Gibson and Philip K. Dick is already upon us.

...and 2019 is still 5 years away.

With UNTHINKABLE COMPLEXITY, we will honor their vision with a celebration that unites the real-world technologies, fashion, and music with the stories that first predicted them.

For fashion, philosophical and other cyberpunk related resources and ideas please see: TUMBLR PAGE: http://cyberpunkevent.tumblr.com/
FACEBOOK PAGE: https://www.facebook.com/cyberpunkevent


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

This is a social celebration involving culture, art and technology.

ART & TECHNOLOGY: WE WANT IT
We welcome all art and technology that relates to the genre. We're happy to speak with any potential technology partners, dancers, artists, performers, etc. that would like to contribute to the event. All cyberpunk-related tech can be demonstrated at the event.

The more technology and art we can bring to this event, the more the experience will be enhanced.

PLEASE, KINDLY TELL OTHERS: Finally, please share this link on your social networks and tell people about UNTHINKABLE COMPLEXITY!

PLEASE SHARE: http://igg.me/at/cyberpunkevent
PLEASE FOLLOW TUMBLR PAGE: http://cyberpunkevent.tumblr.com/
PLEASE LIKE FACEBOOK PAGE: https://www.facebook.com/cyberpunkevent
PLEASE FOLLOW: https://twitter.com/transmediala


ABOUT US

My name is Hal Hefner, Managing Director of Transmedia LA - Los Angeles’ largest group of multi-platform storytelling professionals. Founded in 2009, we feature over 1,100 members and have three main goals: to educate, incubate and innovate experimental and experiential storytelling.

Over the last 5 years we have explored experimental storytelling by sharing ideas, and inviting numerous guest speakers, including the creators of the Lizzie Bennet Diaries, and the Halo web series, Forward Unto Dawn, as well as representatives from Guillermo del Toro’s Mirada studios, Ignition, Fourth Wall Studios, The Alchemists, Disney Imagineering, deviantART, and more.

Education has been the foundation of our group and now we would like to invite you to help us incubate and innovate.

More about Hal Hefner: http://www.halhefner.com

More about Transmedia LA:
Website: http://www.transmediala.org
Meetup Group: http://www.meetup.com/Transmedia-Los-Angeles/


EVENT DISCLAIMER

For those that attend the event: UNTHINKABLE COMPLEXITY is an event produced by, for, and about transmedia and online video enthusiasts. As such, UNTHINKABLE COMPLEXITY may be recorded or reproduced by WYRDCON, TRANSMEDIA LA, CATMONKEY, its designees, and/or attending participants. By registering to be in attendance at UNTHINKABLE COMPLEXITY, you hereby authorize WYRDCON, TRANSMEDIA LA, CATMONKEY, its designees, and/or attending participants to record, transcribe, modify, reproduce, perform, display, transmit and distribute in any form and for any purpose any such recordings of UNTHINKABLE COMPLEXITY and WYRDCON. By registering for the UNTHINKABLE COMPLEXITY event you hereby release  WYRDCON, TRANSMEDIA LA, CATMONKEY, its designees, and/or its attending participants from any and all claims it or its employees or agents may possess, now or in the future, in connection with such activities.

story:
Our Story

The Serenata Chamber Orchestra is a dynamic, vibrant group of adult amateur string players who love to play. Our small core group has recently grown exponentially, and we have a need for more rehearsal space, which will in turn afford us the opportunity to include winds and brass, as well as create opportunities for student involvement. We are a non auditioned ensemble that brings together many people from different walks of life.  We are also a 501(c)3, which means your contribution is tax deductible.  When you invest in Serenata, you are investing in the exciting future of classical music. 

What We Need

1) More rehearsal space. Our current space no longer holds our entire orchestra. New rehearsal space for us will likely need to be rented through a school district. This enables us to partner with the schools, as well as access to percussion equipment. Rehearsal space runs about $50-75 per week. We've run out of low cost options that will meet our needs on a long term basis. $3000 for rehearsal space.

2) Liability insurance. Any new rehearsal space requires this of us. $500-750 per year.

3) Music! Each piece we perform costs about $60. $600 for new music

4) A podium for our music director. She is 5 feet tall, and not likely to get taller.  Currently, she is using a 1980s Aerobic Step bench.  $300

5) Random things that all organizations need, like a big box of paper to make programs, new toner ink, pens, other miscellany. 

Community Involvement

The SCO is an adult amateur orchestra. We perform free concerts throughout the year. We also involve students and partner with other organizations to create vibrant, fun programs. You can find SCO musicians teaching in the schools, tutoring private students, and contributing to the musical tapestry of Idaho and the Northwest on a regular basis. We are Idaho's fastest growing, most exciting, fun and welcoming non professional ensemble. Help us take the next step to solidify our place in the Idaho arts scene.

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE help us get the word out about helping. E mail our link to friends, or Facebook us!

story:
I started Random Chance Records (www.randomchancerecords.com) 15 years ago as a venue for real blues and jazz . I release what I like -- as a lifetime blues and jazz fan -- and what I think others will also like. But, as the corny old joke goes, "this business is non-profit, it's not supposed to be, but it is."  I'm running things on a frayed shoe string and the economics of the music business provides a desolate environment. So, for this special project, I'm asking for help.
As far as my label goes, the words "Random Chance" comes into play because I started this label by accident. In the late 1990s I wrote a biography of blues mandolin player, James "Yank" Rachell (published in 2001 by University Press of Mississippi). In the course of interviewing Yank and some of his blues collaborators (including Honeyboy Edwards, Charlie Musslewhite, Ry Cooder, Howard Armstrong and Bob Koester) I thought about some of the old out-of-print LPs of Yank I tracked down doing the discography for the book.
I looked up who owned the rights and ended up licensing a couple of LPs and inadvertently started a record label.

Martin Lang is a great blues harmonica player. He has that wailing and urgent Chicago blues sound I've always loved. I first heard him when Chicago bluesman Dave Myers produced an album for me, Harmonica Blues Orgy. Four of the 16 tracks of that compilation cd were by Martin Lang.
Martin has been backing up Taildragger in his band for many years and has played and recorded with other notable bluesmakers.
The proposed album I'm trying to fund will, along with Martin, include vocalists Taildragger and Willie Buck; guitarists Rusty Zinn and Billy Flynn; bassist Jimmy Upstairs; and drummer Steve Cushing.

Three thousand dollars is not a lot of money to record, master, pay for studio time, with mixing and mastering, pay musicians, press cds and digitally release an album to web portals.We all know we are doing a low-budget project and my label will also have to put in funds above the $3,000 goal. If we can exceed the goal then we can put some of it into more pay for musicians and/or more sales promotion. All of the production will be done in Chicago.

Your donation can help make this happen. The harp-centered Chicago blues band sound must be nurtured and perpetuated. The great lineup that will be on this album are certain to produce some seriously righteous blues.

We can't offer paid vacations to Tahiti as a dividend for your contribution, but you will certainly get a free copy of the CD.

If you are financially tight, and aren't we all? -- you can help get the word out through email, facebook, your web site or whatever else you can think of.

You can also use the Indigogo share tools to send out information about this project.

story:
Oh hey there, Indiegogo! We're a quirky pop band called Raccoon Jay from St. Louis, MO, and we need your help to make our debut album titled "...At a Rich Kid's Party" possible!

Click Here to listen to our music.

Click Here  to download our EP for free!

We will need about $3500 to fund the recording and mastering of our album. Any extra money we raise past our goal goes to our music video budget!! If we do not reach our funding goal we'll still find a way to record our debut album, even if it means only using studio time for drum and vocal recording! 

And what do you get out of this? To start with: our digital album for $5!! But there are many more awesome incentives we've made to show our appreciation of your support. Check them out on the right! ----> 

    Since 2010 when lead singer Joseph Quinlan first started Raccoon Jay at Holy Cross College in South Bend, Indiana, the music we create has always been about the art of songwriting through storytelling and craftsmanship. From our country roots in storytelling, we incorporate catchy pop hooks and punk riffs that make listening to our music fun, inspiring, and thought-provoking. 

    We don't think music is about celebrities; it is about those among us that need a voice for something beyond the chaos around us. And that is WHY WE WEAR OUR RACCOON MASKS. Because we want to share a musical journey with you. Furthermore, we think music should get you up off your keisters and shaking it with your friends, while at the same time being about something more. Our passion for our craft is what drives us to put out only songs that make us laugh, love, or cry--songs that shake us emotionally and physically


      Our biggest obstacle is a delayed release date. This could result from problems with mixing and mastering, but we've been mixing and mastering our own recordings for years. We have enough expertise in recording and mixing to work through any obstacles on that front.

      We're some tough cookies, so we will fight to overcome any obstacles and make this a reality. We're always in it to win it.


      If you are unable to donate to this project, then perhaps you could donate in some other way! Share this project page with your friends by using the SHARE links! Post on your Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter feed about us! You might reach somebody who is very interested in our music! Spreading the word is a fantastic way to show your support.

If we do not reach our funding goal we'll still find a way to record our debut album, even if it means only using studio time for drum and vocal recording! And what do you get out of this? To start with: our digital album for $5!! But there are many more awesome incentives we've made to show our appreciation of your support. Check them out on the right! ---->   Since 2010 when lead singer Joseph Quinlan first started Raccoon Jay at Holy Cross College in South Bend, Indiana, the music we create has always been about the art of songwriting through storytelling and craftsmanship. From our country roots in storytelling, we incorporate catchy pop hooks and punk riffs that make listening to our music fun, inspiring, and thought-provoking. We don't think music is about celebrities; it is about those among us that need a voice for something beyond the chaos around us. And that is WHY WE WEAR OUR RACCOON MASKS. Because we want to share a musical journey with you. Furthermore, we think music should get you up off your keisters and shaking it with your friends, while at the same time being about something more. Our passion for our craft is what drives us to put out only songs that make us laugh, love, or cry--songs that shake us emotionally and physically  Our biggest obstacle is a delayed release date. This could result from problems with mixing and mastering, but we've been mixing and mastering our own recordings for years. We have enough expertise in recording and mixing to work through any obstacles on that front.We're some tough cookies, so we will fight to overcome any obstacles and make this a reality. We're always in it to win it.If you are unable to donate to this project, then perhaps you could donate in some other way! Share this project page with your friends by using the SHARE links! Post on your Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter feed about us! You might reach somebody who is very interested in our music! Spreading the word is a fantastic way to show your support.

story:
Hello! And thanks for taking the time to help make my first solo studio album a reality! Let me tell you a little about me!


Raised beneath the Swan Mountains of the Flathead Valley in Montana, I was introduced to the ways of the musical life at a young age by my father, a well-known  and highly acclaimed musician in Montana and other parts of the world.

 Over the years I have considered other trades to make my life's work, and yet music keeps calling me back to her warm embrace, taking me to Europe to tour with a choir, singing Mozart's Requiem in Hungary, Polland, and Austria, to the University of Montana, to sing with the UM jazz Chorale, the Jubileers, and even to Rockin' the Rivers, opening main stage for the Doobie Brothers with my rock band, House of Quist.  


Music, for me, is everything. It was sollace as an awkward 15 year old girl, when I wrote my first song to truly face the loss of a loved relative. It is pure rebellion, tearing up my fingers on my first bass, and throwin' my head back in a full bang, to do, to be, something different. It is the best kind of celebration, calling you to move your body, to shake off all burden. But its more than that.

I think Terry Reid said it best when he said,

Amid the turmoil of this world we have created, amid families being thrown from their homes, amid wars raging on over the earths prized resources, the only thing that gets us through the day is a chance to share music, with our companions, with our friends with our fans.

We raise our steel to battle with music, to give the masses the only things they need to survive, hope, laughter, mystery, and a damn good time.


This project means the world to me. I have a great team assembled and I think the work we are doing will truly touch the lives of many. I would love for the chance to be able to share my joy and love of music with you.


If you can not contribute at this time, That's OK! sharing on facebook or email is just as helpful!

story:
Our first EP will showcase what we have encountered while having our heads in the clouds. Help us process the wonder of the galaxies!

For Your Donation:


About This Campaign:

En·tal [ěn'tl] - of or situated on the inside; inner; internal; from within.

Hello! I am Ori Kawa, an independent music maker based in Chicago. Life can throw some extreme seasons at us; sometimes we must meditate on our experiences in our own creative spaces to stay sane. After a period of musical solitude spent scrapping away at the drawing board, it is time for me to broaden my production process. My goal is to make the proper pairings of musicians to my songs and create circular energy within the artistic community.


As a contributor to this project, you will be helping me create high quality output from these pairings. Funds will be directly allocated to the independent artists involved (including singers, photographers, videographers, sound engineers, music producers, composers, etc.). Other expenses will include studio rental, transportation and CD printing/shipping. The cornerstone of our products will be a series of studio recording sessions titled "The 408 Sessions" (taking place at Fever Pitch Recording, Room 408, Chicago).

The work I will be putting in will also be funded by your contributions. My approach has been to work with upcoming independent artists. It makes sense because of what budget currently allows and my own professional standing. But also, there is something very satisfying and organic about this approach. For The 408 Sessions #1, I spent weeks of preparations with singers. It was beneficial for them to get acquainted with the studio environment without added pressure of a stage audience. It was beneficial for me to begin an efficient process that I can now streamline for the rest of the series. The musicians from The 408 Sessions #1 will reappear on other songs, but there will always be less seasoned talent in development. Matching the performer's sound to the piece is where I will be going by instinct and allowing the style of song to determine the musicians required. 

Thank you for your support! And if you know anyone else who would be into The Entals please help us spread the word.


More:

Ori Kawa

Full Spectrum Features

story:
Our Story

The LADY GOT CHOPS WOMEN'S MONTH JAZZ FESTIVAL (aka Music and Arts Festival) was conceived in 2003 by mother and daughter new cafe owners Lillithe Meyers Tiecha Merritt and bassist /fledgeling web designer Kim Clarke. The fest original two fold purpose- to draw customers and celebrate women  in jazz.
Although the cafe, The Jazz Spot, was a lovely venue its locale was in a challenging locale in a two-fare zone.The address itself was erroneous as the entrance was around the corner from the legal address.
The cafe closed in 2009 .http://theglobaljazznetwork.ning.com/video/1982065:Video:14027

 Kim designed their website,promoted and booked 99% of the women musicians many of whom she had worked with in Kit McClure Big Band.
Without  a home base  in 2010 ,Kim applied for a Chase grant  and a few other grants.Friends came her assistance with booking opportunites in several locations and the festival continued under the Music and Arts name. 
The 8th festival had 25 performances in 15 venues around NY and included musicians from other idioms and 1 dance troupe.Festival T-shirts were auctioned to raise money for Doctors Without Borders as were banners and large posters.
http://kimclarke.8m.com/ladyfest8.html (2010)
Information on all prior fests can be found 
http://thejazz.8m.com/fest.html The festival archive.
CURRENT CALENDAR http://kimclarke.8m.com/ladyfest9.html

This festival is designed to give women musicians ,writers,band leaders and composers the light that is lost namely THEIR NAMES .It was also designed for women to give other women work-mentor to girls considering musical performance and spread the history of women who preceeded them ..In a time when art, cultural achievements

 as well as the struggle of humanity is slated to be erased from the history books its the least we can do in the digital age- to acknowledge and honor each other .It is extremely difficult for women to feel confident outside of their comfort zone. It has been the history of the LGCWMJF

to break this chain by combining folk who may or may not have ever worked with each other due to social barriers in even an ethnically as diverse a locale as NY. Each event has been surprisingly successful in making new friends or just good music for the moment.We hope to extend the festival to reflect the beauty of art as is celebrated in so many professional festivals around the world.

The Impact

We have lost many of the giants of jazz.Some of us have known and been in their presence as women performers.Few of the women instrumentalists names have survived the test of time.I have been told of a woman bassist who played with Charlie Parker -no name was given.There are many lessons which can be garnered for young women today studying and understanding the struggles and achievements of those in times past. Before their story is completely forgotten we would also like to capture bright moments on film of those who are performing locally on a global scale .


What We Need & What You Get

My ultimate vision for the festival is to 1 rent a large easily accessed Manhattan venue for 2 days .
2 hire a crew  for security, box office,lighting and sound crew with equipment
hardcopy press- flyers banners-posters-
handbill with bios,tickets- 
3hire some of the more well known women in jazz at the fee that they command
and introduce them to the up and coming ladies who will also be paid for performance.

My immediate vision is to be able to
1 pay musicians whose bands are working off the door- (paying the band out of the funds collected or supplementing them with their own income) 40 musicians (10 bands with 4 members)x $100=$4000
 2 hire videographers to attend and film 3 minutes of each festival date 25 dates x $50=1250
to hire a person to handle the DOOR ,Tickets, and /orsale of artist merchandise  25dates x$30= 750
3 I would also like to have some "patch fund" money to give to the club owners who have assisted in the festival and may not have outstanding turnouts.

(Last year i received a grant of $300. from the Jazz Foundation for the making of flyers,posters banners etc.
We auctioned the posters and festival t-shirt and artist donated items and raised $1428 for Doctors Without Borders Haiti crisis.)

story:
I am a harpist, and have been writing music and touring for the past 4 years. I have an amazing group of musicians currently playing with me, and we have put together a new cd, “Little Flowers”! We are so excited about this project! After a 2 month tour of writing and playing new music, we’ve gotten into the studio and have recorded a new project that we are all in love with! This music is really our hearts, and we want to share it with the world!
I heard the final mixes last night, and I’m SOOO EXCITED!!
After an bit of a fundraiser flop, I’ve personally used up all of my savings and band money for the studio (though we still owe $800), and now need money for mastering ($1000) and for printing ($2000). We’d love to partner with our friends, family, and fans to make this record possible and get it out into the world!
For only $8 you can essentially pre-order the record, and we’ll mail it out the second we get it in, even if that’s before the cd release show.
We have a lot of other great rewards, including one-of-a-kind art and jewelry from members of the band, a hand decorated mix cd from me, free admission to shows, a harp lesson, and much more!

If you would like to know more about my music, please read my bio. You can listen to some of my music here:
Myspace.com/Timbre
and some more songs here:
sonicbids.com/Timbre2

story:
THIS IS THE LAST DAY OF THE CAMPAIGN! THANKS TO SEPARATE DONATIONS OUR TOTAL IS IN FACT OVER $5,000 HIGHER THAN THE TOTAL YOU SEE. AT THIS POINT WE HAVE PROBABLY MADE ENOUGH TO COVER PRODUCTION COSTS. THAT IS AMAZING!!!! IF WE CAN MAKE A FEW DOLLARS MORE ON INDIEGOGO WE MIGHT EVEN HAVE A PUBLICITY BUDGET! THAT"S WHY WE SET SUCH A HIGH GOAL IN THE FIRST PLACE. BUT WE ARE EXTREMELY HAPPY AND GRATEFUL FOR SUCH A REMARKABLE SHOW OF SUPPORT ALREADY!!!
PLEASE PITCH IN OVER THESE LAST FEW HOURS IF YOU CAN!

Here are some new rewards on offer:

Angie Wang's New Yorker illustration of the band at $250

Prints and Originals of Brazilian artist Maria Eugenia's watercolors for Spottiswoode videos: $500 for 1 original painting or 2 larger prints, $1,000 for 2 originals or 5 larger prints, $2,500 for 5 originals or 20 larger prints.

An exclusive piece of artwork by our trumpeter Kevin Cordt at $500

An exclusive photo album of the band's "wedding" at $500 

All these offers come with CDs of course! To see images and further details about these perks, go to: http://www.spottiswoode.com/missives

Thank you! Now please read about our record...

 We have a dream, an English Dream!

What do you get when an Englishman with a New York band makes a record about England in New York? A whole new genre!

English Dream will be the 6th record of Spottiswoode & His Enemies’ 15-year career. So far we’ve made a rock record, a gospel record, a Euro-cabaret record, an Americana record and most recently, Wild Goosechase Expedition, a record that was so hard to categorize that it won the Vox Populi Independent Music Award for Best Eclectic Release of 2011.

English Dream will be a new form of music entirely: ANGLICANA!

Yes, you’ve heard it here first. Like Americana, Anglicana is an organic form that combines doses of folk and electric music. However, unlike Americana, Anglicana’s themes are English! English songs performed by an American band. It also helps that Spottiswoode’s father became an Anglican minister when his youngest child was a teenager. (No, it’s not a religious record!) Some of the 14 songs on English Dream evoke the haunting English countryside. Others touch on Spottiswoode’s childhood in London. All reflect the bandleader’s distinct lyrical and storytelling style.

Add to that the unique musicianship of a critically acclaimed and award-winning New York septet! We really think this will be our most beautiful recording yet.

It’s being produced once again by our own Riley McMahon. We recently laid down the basic tracks at the Bunker Studio in Brooklyn. We plan to finish it off at Riley’s New Warsaw Studio in East Williamsburg where we will add the vital element of our horn and backing vocal section: Candace DeBartolo and Kevin Cordt!

Once overdubs are completed we shall mix and master the record, complete artwork and duplicate one thousand CDs. All of this takes money! Studio, engineering, production and post-production costs will reach close to $16,000.

However, the record doesn’t stop there. A major frustration we have faced in the past is that, despite fantastic reviews for all our recordings, we haven’t been able to get the word out. It’s vital that we have money left over this time to orchestrate a real publicity campaign, something that can truly spread the word and allow the band to keep going. So an extra $10,000 to cover the cost of press, blog and radio promotion would make a HUGE difference. We also hope to make at least one music video, a vital on-line tool these days.

In the past, that was the role of “the music industry.” But these days more and more artists are depending on their audience. We have been extremely fortunate with former projects to have received the backing of friends and fans from all corners of the globe. If you have given before, we hope you’re glad you did! Please consider supporting us again. Thanks to you we have won awards and plaudits from all over the world! If you’ve only recently discovered us please come on board!

There are a slew of rewards to choose from: pre-sales, album credits, bonus tracks, house concerts, artwork, commissioned songs etc. We hope there’s one that appeals to you.

If you have any questions or want to hear some of the nearly-completed tracks please contact us directly at spode@spottiswoode.com

And please please spread the word to your friends, even if you can't contribute yourself. Use the indiegogo share tool on this page.

Thank you!

Spottiswoode & His Enemies

www.spottiswoode.com

www.facebook.com/spottiswoode
story_txt:
THIS IS THE LAST DAY OF THE CAMPAIGN! THANKS TO SEPARATE DONATIONS OUR TOTAL IS IN FACT OVER $5,000 HIGHER THAN THE TOTAL YOU SEE. AT THIS POINT WE HAVE PROBABLY MADE ENOUGH TO COVER PRODUCTION COSTS. THAT IS AMAZING!!!! IF WE CAN MAKE A FEW DOLLARS MORE ON INDIEGOGO WE MIGHT EVEN HAVE A PUBLICITY BUDGET! THAT"S WHY WE SET SUCH A HIGH GOAL IN THE FIRST PLACE. BUT WE ARE EXTREMELY HAPPY AND GRATEFUL FOR SUCH A REMARKABLE SHOW OF SUPPORT ALREADY!!!PLEASE PITCH IN OVER THESE LAST FEW HOURS IF YOU CAN!
Here are some new rewards on offer:
Angie Wang's New Yorker illustration of the band at $250
Prints and Originals of Brazilian artist Maria Eugenia's watercolors for Spottiswoode videos: $500 for 1 original painting or 2 larger prints, $1,000 for 2 originals or 5 larger prints, $2,500 for 5 originals or 20 larger prints.
An exclusive piece of artwork by our trumpeter Kevin Cordt at $500
An exclusive photo album of the band's "wedding" at $500 
All these offers come with CDs of course! To see images and further details about these perks, go to: http://www.spottiswoode.com/missives
Thank you! Now please read about our record...
 We have a dream, an English Dream!
What do you get when an Englishman with a New York band makes a record about England in New York? A whole new genre!
English Dream will be the 6th record of Spottiswoode & His Enemies’ 15-year career. So far we’ve made a rock record, a gospel record, a Euro-cabaret record, an Americana record and most recently, Wild Goosechase Expedition, a record that was so hard to categorize that it won the Vox Populi Independent Music Award for Best Eclectic Release of 2011.

story:
What is Velvet Rope Magazine?

 

Velvet Rope Magazine is a publication distributed in cities across Ontario including Kitchener, Waterloo, Cambridge, Guelph, Stratford, Brantford, London, Mitchell and surrounding areas. Since its inception in 2012, Velvet Rope showcases local entertainment in talent; from musicians to artists, writers, and photographers. We have a team of over 85 volunteers who have the same passion and vision to make this magazine a true showcase of the culture of Southern Ontario. 

What do we plan to accomplish?

Our goal is to provide a community entertainment magazine to the public, free of charge, in an effort to support our local music scenes. We believe that through our support, we are assisting local businesses, bands and artists broaden their customer reach, as well as continuing to build community support for our local entertainment scene.

Our objective is to continue publishing a free magazine. We can accomplish this with your help. 

What's in it for YOU?

If you donate to Velvet Rope Magazine, we will be able to continue publishing a free magazine, highlighting the entertainment of YOUR region, both online and in print. Your donation will be helping both us and plenty of small business owners, aspiring bands, musicians and artists get their hard work noticed and appreciated by the public and a thriving region to continue it's cultural growth.

Your donated funds will allow us to continue publishing a free Velvet Rope magazine, and maximize our potential to expand our pages, and our distribution.

--------------------------

If you cannot donate to Velvet Rope Magazine, we totally understand. All we are asking at the end of the day is to spread the word out about our publication so we can all rally together and build a great community in Southern Ontario. It would be much appreciated if you could spread the word of our campaign with everyone any way you can. Facebook, Twitter, Indiegogo Share Tools, or good old fashioned word of mouth. We really appreciate your support and thank you for taking the time to help us out.
