story:
For general inquiries or to upgrade your perk, please contact: info@michellecreber.com

 

A CREBER CHRISTMAS ALBUM

Holiday classics by a versatile musical family

 

If you know us (Michelle, Monique and Michael) at all, chances are you know that we really, REALLY love Christmas. We love everything about it: snow, evergreen trees, decorations, big family dinners, the celebration of light in the darkness of winter, the spirit of love and generosity...and, of course, the music. All three of us are professional entertainers with busy careers as actor, singer and dancer (Michelle), vocalist, teacher and producer (Monique), and composer, producer and pianist (Michael) - but when the idea of recording a family Christmas album came up recently, we were immediately ready to drop everything to make it happen.

Okay, maybe not ready to drop EVERYTHING. But definitely ready to put "produce new CD in time for Christmas" at the top of the family To Do list!

We wondered, though: would anyone besides us so much as notice yet another holiday-themed album, even a beautifully-produced one featuring A-list musicians and fantastic pop/jazz repertoire? Michelle, who has a large and enthusiastic fan following on social media, put the question out on Facebook and Twitter: if my parents and I were to release a Christmas CD...would anyone be interested? The response was an immediate and resounding YES!!

So be it! We have already actively started work on it but the main challenge is coming up with the funds while we are still in the process of recouping expenses from Michelle’s debut CD. (Producing high quality recordings is very costly to do as indie artists without record label support.) That's where YOU come in. We need to raise the necessary funds with CD presales by early November.

Why should you invest in our project?

1. The music! If you are familiar with Michelle's debut album, you know that when she covers a song, she does something amazing and different with it. Imagine what she could do with all the great Christmas repertoire out there! If you've seen any shows from Monique & Michael’s Magic of Christmas concert series or heard their compilation CD, you will know that their extensive experience with Christmas repertoire and recordings is going to shine through on this project. The trio are also thrilled to be having Andrew Stein, a super talented singer/musician/arranger, working on the project as well. Plus, more special guests and contributors will be announced!

2. We know what we're doing. Monique is an experienced producer whose most recent project was Michelle’s debut CD. Monique is also a session singer who has done featured vocals for film, TV, animation, jingles and many recording projects. Michael has produced albums for countless clients and has recorded & performed with the likes of k.d.lang, David Foster, Martin Short and Raffi. Michael won a Juno Award and was nominated for a Grammy for his work with Raffi on “Bananaphone”, a song he co-wrote). Michelle has also contributed her singing and acting skills to numerous high-profile film & tv projects such as "My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic", "Smart Cookies" and "The Search for Santa Paws".

3. We work with top notch musicians, engineers, designers and recording studios, and are committed to a final product that has excellent production values. Your pledge will go towards every step of this process, from recording & mastering to artwork & manufacturing, and all the magic in between.

4. Support an important cause. As with Michelle’s Timeless album, a portion of the proceeds will be donated to PLAN International's "Because I Am A Girl" campaign, which addresses the issue of gender inequality in developing countries and promotes women's rights. Although girls are often the poorest of the poor, it’s proven that investing in girls is key to eliminating poverty. When a girl is educated, nourished and protected, she shares her knowledge and skills with her family & community, and can forever change the future of a nation. It’s that powerful!

We're really excited about making this a collective community project, full of the best kind of Christmas spirit and involving as many of YOU as possible; our fans, friends and family from near and far. There are all kinds of ways you can participate, from supporting the project with the equivalent of a simple pre-order of the CD or digital download...all the way up to an Executive Producer credit that comes with a whole sleigh ride of amazing perks! (Which include shipping anywhere in the world) If you want to help but can't make the budget stretch, we'd love it if you would consider spreading the word about the project via Facebook, Twitter, e-mail and just by talking about it to people you know. Every mention makes a difference, and we are very grateful for any support you can provide!

May this Christmas be the best...from our house to yours,

Michelle, Monique & Michael Creber

story:
Short Summary

A sentence of life without the possibility of parole (LWOP) is a death sentence.  Worse, it is a long, slow, dissipating death sentence without any of the legal or administrative safeguards rightly awarded to those condemned to traditional forms of execution.  It exposes and caters to that segment of our society that believes redemption and personal transformation are not possible for all human beings, and that it is reasonable and just to forever define an individual by his or her worst act.  LWOP is wrong and should be abolished.

The Other Death Penalty Project (TODPP) is a true grassroots organizing campaign comprised wholly of men and women sentenced to life without the possibility of parole, the purpose of which is to end this practice of sentencing tens of thousands to a slow and painful execution in this nation’s maximum-security prisons through a peaceful, well-orchestrated and thought-out plan to change hearts and minds. TODPP’s ultimate goal is to see the permanent end to the use of this form of state-sanctioned execution (along with all other forms), resulting in all life term prisoners having, at least, the possibility of earning parole. 

A generous grant from the Peace Development Fund has paid for the production costs of TODPP’s forthcoming book, “Too Cruel, Not Unusual Enough,” a unique and extraordinary anthology of writings by LWOP prisoners and others.  Funds raised through this campaign will allow us to print copies of this remarkable book to be placed on the desks of at least 1,000 death penalty abolitionist groups (who support LWOP as a “reasonable alternative” to lethal injection), policymakers, thought leaders, and others of influence nationwide.  Monies raised will also be used to place targeted ads to raise awareness of our cause and raise even more funds for project related activities through increased book sales and donations.

Your contribution is vital in helping to create a more just, humane, and compassionate society through the abolition of all forms of the death penalty, including LWOP.

 What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 to pay for printing, postage, and mailing costs for 1,000 books, as well as for targeted advertisements and book contest entry fees.  It costs $4 to print each book ($4,000), an average of $3 per book in postage ($3,000), and approximately $800 in office supply costs (mailing envelopes, paper, tape, etc.).  The remaining $2,200 will be used to place targeted ads in print and other media and enter “Too Cruel, Not Unusual Enough” in writing contests which will garner additional publicity for our cause. 

Our unique and exciting perks! 

For a $10 donation, receive the “Greater Good” gift:  The good feeling of knowing you are playing a vital role in making the world a better place by ensuring human rights for all! 

For a $20 donation, receive a download of 3 audio recordings of essays/poems from “Too Cruel, Not Unusual Enough,” read by their imprisoned authors.

For a $30 donation, receive a personal thank you letter from the "Too Cruel, Not Unusual Enough" editors.

For a $40 donation, receive a set of 5 "Too Cruel, Not Unusual Enough" postcards.

For a $50 donation, receive a "Too Cruel, Not Unusual Enough" button.

For a $60 donation, receive a "Too Cruel, Not Unusual Enough" refrigerator magnet.

For a $75 donation, receive a "Too Cruel, Not Unusual Enough" poster. 

For a $150 donation, receive a copy of “Too Cruel, Not Unusual Enough,” signed by noted author and prison reform activist Luis J. Rodriguez. 

For a $150 donation, receive a copy of “Too Cruel, Not Unusual Enough,” signed by artist/activist Wayne Kramer (Jail Guitar Doors USA and MC-5 Co-Founder), and/or one of his celebrity friends. 

For a $250 donation, you will receive a chance to win a special guitar signed by Wayne Kramer and other famous musicians.

If we don’t reach our entire goal, funds raised will be used to print and mail as many books as possible to policymakers and others in a position to make a significant impact in the abolition of LWOP.

The Impact

Every human being has inherent worth and value, including those who owe a debt to society.  As well, every human being possesses the capacity for transformation and redemption.  By contributing to our campaign, you are helping to spread awareness of these profound truths, while creating a system of justice based on healing and restoration rather than retribution and revenge.

TODPP is a project of The Steering Committee for the Honor Program, which was founded in 2001 by Kenneth E. Hartman, a prisoner serving LWOP at California State Prison-Los Angeles County (CSP-LAC).  Ken wrote the original proposal that helped to start the Honor Program (please see www.prisonhonorprogram.org), and went on in late 2008 to found TODPP, serving since as its Executive Director.  The purpose of The Steering Committee is to provide a platform for motivated prisoners, most of whom are serving LWOP sentences, to actively shape the agenda of the prison system to one in which rehabilitation is possible.  The Steering Committee has had enormous success in this regard.  Working with California Senate Majority Leader Gloria Romero, The Steering Committee was the catalyst for her 2007 prison reform legislation, SB 299, which sought to expand Honor Programs to all Level III and Level IV prisons throughout the state.  In 2008, nominated by Senator Romero for its remarkable work in prison reform, The Steering Committee was selected as one of twelve prize-winning finalists (out of over 250 applications) in the James Irvine Foundation Leadership Awards. 

When we launched The Other Death Penalty Project, there was virtually no awareness or discussion of LWOP as a death sentence.  The recent Supreme Court rulings limiting the use of life without parole sentences for juveniles; California Senator Leland Yee’s bill, SB9, recently signed into law by Governor Brown, now permits prisoners serving LWOP for crimes committed as juveniles to appeal their sentences; and Proposition 34, on the ballot last November, which sought to abolish execution by lethal injection and replace it with LWOP (death by incarceration), have all served to heighten the level of visibility about the true meaning, cruelty, and inhumanity of life without parole sentences.  

TODPP has been at the forefront of these developments since our inception, and especially in the past year.  The highlight of 2012 was when Ken Hartman addressed the July meeting of the California Democratic Party’s Progressive Caucus.  Ken, who spoke by phone from prison, participated in “Dead Men Walking,” a panel discussion arranged by Christine Thomas of The Campaign to End the Death Penalty (one of the few death penalty abolitionist groups that publicly opposes life without parole sentences as a “reasonable” alternative to lethal injection).  Ken’s comments on LWOP as the other death penalty opened the eyes of many at the meeting who automatically assumed prisoners on death row would be happy to receive LWOP, rather than the truth that they are merely being given a different death sentence.  (You can hear Ken’s presentation at the “Dead Men Walking” panel discussion here:  http://dir.groups.yahoo.com/group/JudgedMenAllianceForTomorrow/message/17748.)

TODPP's work has also been embraced by the academic criminal justice community.  We are quoted in the new book, “Life Without Parole: America’s New Death Penalty,” edited by Charles Ogletree Jr., Jesse Climenko Professor of Law at Harvard Law School and Austin Sarat, William Nelson Cromwell Professor of Law at Amherst College. Professor Sarat wrote a short positive commentary for “Too Cruel, Not Unusual Enough," as did Professor Michelle Alexander (author of “The New Jim Crow”) and Dr. Robert Johnson, Professor of Justice, Law, and Society at American University.   

 Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t make a cash donation, you can still have a huge impact on this important work.  Help us by spreading the word about our campaign to all of your email contacts, Facebook friends, and in-person connections. Send out regular tweets about the campaign, and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

TODPP is a project of The Steering Committee for the Honor Program, which was founded in 2001 by Kenneth E. Hartman, a prisoner serving LWOP at California State Prison-Los Angeles County (CSP-LAC).  Ken wrote the original proposal that helped to start the Honor Program (please see www.prisonhonorprogram.org), and went on in late 2008 to found TODPP, serving since as its Executive Director.  The purpose of The Steering Committee is to provide a platform for motivated prisoners, most of whom are serving LWOP sentences, to actively shape the agenda of the prison system to one in which rehabilitation is possible.  The Steering Committee has had enormous success in this regard.  Working with California Senate Majority Leader Gloria Romero, The Steering Committee was the catalyst for her 2007 prison reform legislation, SB 299, which sought to expand Honor Programs to all Level III and Level IV prisons throughout the state.  In 2008, nominated by Senator Romero for its remarkable work in prison reform, The Steering Committee was selected as one of twelve prize-winning finalists (out of over 250 applications) in the James Irvine Foundation Leadership Awards. 
When we launched The Other Death Penalty Project, there was virtually no awareness or discussion of LWOP as a death sentence.  The recent Supreme Court rulings limiting the use of life without parole sentences for juveniles; California Senator Leland Yee’s bill, SB9, recently signed into law by Governor Brown, now permits prisoners serving LWOP for crimes committed as juveniles to appeal their sentences; and Proposition 34, on the ballot last November, which sought to abolish execution by lethal injection and replace it with LWOP (death by incarceration), have all served to heighten the level of visibility about the true meaning, cruelty, and inhumanity of life without parole sentences.  
TODPP has been at the forefront of these developments since our inception, and especially in the past year.  The highlight of 2012 was when Ken Hartman addressed the July meeting of the California Democratic Party’s Progressive Caucus.  Ken, who spoke by phone from prison, participated in “Dead Men Walking,” a panel discussion arranged by Christine Thomas of The Campaign to End the Death Penalty (one of the few death penalty abolitionist groups that publicly opposes life without parole sentences as a “reasonable” alternative to lethal injection).  Ken’s comments on LWOP as the other death penalty opened the eyes of many at the meeting who automatically assumed prisoners on death row would be happy to receive LWOP, rather than the truth that they are merely being given a different death sentence.  (You can hear Ken’s presentation at the “Dead Men Walking” panel discussion here:  http://dir.groups.yahoo.com/group/JudgedMenAllianceForTomorrow/message/17748.)
TODPP's work has also been embraced by the academic criminal justice community.  We are quoted in the new book, “Life Without Parole: America’s New Death Penalty,” edited by Charles Ogletree Jr., Jesse Climenko Professor of Law at Harvard Law School and Austin Sarat, William Nelson Cromwell Professor of Law at Amherst College. Professor Sarat wrote a short positive commentary for “Too Cruel, Not Unusual Enough," as did Professor Michelle Alexander (author of “The New Jim Crow”) and Dr. Robert Johnson, Professor of Justice, Law, and Society at American University.   
 Other Ways You Can Help



Even if you can’t make a cash donation, you can still have a huge impact on this important work.  Help us by spreading the word about our campaign to all of your email contacts, Facebook friends, and in-person connections. Send out regular tweets about the campaign, and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
No Tengo Dinero Music Video

The idea for the song came about in the kitchen of Jazz Trumpets. This is the reason why it was written in Spanish - the “official language” of the kitchen.

Very often there is not enough money to pay the staff at the end of the night, especially considering the particularly difficult times we are going through.

These very general financial difficulties are aggravated by the fact that jazz music is not exactly the most popular type of music. Although we have a lot of regulars who truly appreciate what we are doing, there is not enough of them to be able to run the club and make a profit.

Very often I have to go into the kitchen announcing, “I have no money”. One particular night I happened to say it in a musical way. A short rhythmic musical phrase that the Spanish speaking kitchen staff seemed to appreciate, they started laughing and singing the phrase back to me. The song was born!

In a very spontaneous and real way I started talking about the problems that a jazz club owner like myself has to endure, and every single character who is depicted in the song exists in real life.

We are trying to film a music video and share it with the world online.

The song speaks to a lot of people around the world. Not having money is the current universal truth!

Be a Part – Join the Band…

story:
What

A Funk Above The Rest is America's ONLY radio show sponsored by Funky Town Grooves Record Label based in London England with offices in NYC.

Where

Nestled in Downtown Denver - The Mile High City - we have chosen Sculpture Park to launch what we hope to be an annual event! With a festival-like atmosphere with vendor booths offering food, drink, crafts, and other merchandise, this funky festival that would take place rain or shine on July 5th 2014! We would host a pre-launch party, and we are getting word that fans from around the globe are looking forward to making a funky exodus to the Mile High for this event.

Who

Bands from around the world including Japan, Sweden, London, France, Germany, and The Netherlands; we anticipate securing contracts and travel arrangements for groups who will participate in this festival!

How You Can Help

We need your help to get the ball rolling and make this event an international success! Funding will be used for facility deposits, security, artist fees, airfare, lodging, production, and marketing/promotion.

The Event

For a day and a half, during the 4th & 5th of July, A Funk Above The Rest in conjuction with (other partners) will, produce the International Rocky Mountain Funk Out! The 4th will be our pre-launch media party with the 5th being a dedicated day of funk. The A Funk Above The Rest radio show has been supporting funk and soul major and independent artists for well over 7 years and our audience continues to grow! While main stream sources have tried to bury this incredible building block of American music, there is a growing movement worldwide that refuse's to let it go away. With your help of just $3 we can make this event happen! We have a film crew waiting to document this groundbreaking, so What Are You Waiting For? Join our independent spirit of the funk!

Visit these website
www.afunkabovetherest.com- www.sjrmediagroup.com – www.kzkoradio.com  www.kgnu.org - www.cedricprideentertainment.com

story:
After performing to sold-out audiences throughout New York City, we're ready to present our first annual Opera Hispánica Festival in March of 2013!

 

As the nation's first and only Spanish-language and Hispanic opera company, Opera Hispánica offers audiences a unique and relevant form of cultural entertainment at a time when many traditional opera companies throughout the country are closing their doors. Now more than ever is it important to support innovative organizations like Opera Hispánica that are changing the performing arts. 

 

As part of this year's festival, OH will be presenting two performances of María de Buenos Aires, a tango-opera by Astor Piazzolla at the acclaimed Le Poisson Rouge in Manhattan's west village. This production will be streamed LIVE from New York City. Help bring our production of Maria de Buenos Aires to life by supporting our IndieGoGo Campaign!

 

 
PROJECT DESCRIPTION:
 
María de Buenos Aires
A tango-opera by Astor Piazzolla
(le) poisson rouge
March 15 & 17 at 7:30pm
 
Conducted by Jorge Parodi
Directed by Beth Greenberg
Solange Merdinian as Maria
Marcelo Guzzo as El Payador

Juan Pablo Jofre, Bandoneon

 

You'll lose all sense of boundaries as you experience María de Buenos Aires, the famous tango-opera by Astor Piazzolla. Who is this woman of the night that wanders the streets without fear or reason? Is she a mother, a child, or a ghost? Saint or whore? She is María, the most common name, and the name of the Most Exalted. She will not be confined by categorizations, she absorbs all assumptions. Join Opera Hispánica as it turns (le) poisson rouge into sultry Buenos Aires for 3 nights of tango, seduction and mystery!
 
OUR GOAL THROUGH THIS CAMPAIGN:
 
Opera Hispánica is trying to raise $15,000 for our production of María de Buenos Aires. 
 
Your tax-deductible gift will help make this production possible and go directly towards production costs such as: artist fees, costumes, scenery, and administrative costs. OH is a tax-exempt non-profit organization which means that when you donate to OH through our IndieGoGo campaign, your gift is tax-deductible. 
 
THE IMPACT & HOW  YOU PLAY A VALUABLE PART:
 
A pioneering non-profit organization in every sense of the word, Opera Hispánica was created to serve as a platform to promote operas inspired by the Latino and Hispanic cultures. 
 
Our new production of María de Buenos Aires gives OH the opportunity to engage new opera audiences by promoting a musical genre, that is rarely explored and often neglected by traditional opera companies. Join us by becoming a contributor to an opera company that is truly different! Every donation in every denomination is appreciated and valued to the growth of our organization and our Festival.  Can't be in NYC for the production? No worries! We will stream the production live from (le) poisson rouge. Be a part of this amazing production no matter where you live.
 

The BEST support comes through your word:

Help us spread the word!  YOUR support helps Opera Hispánica!
 
Please visit our website and become part of our community! Read our latest, exciting news and attend any of our upcoming events!  See how YOU can get involved!
 
www.operahispanica.org
 
Find & "Like" us on Facebook!
http://www.facebook.com/operahispanica
 
Follow us on Twitter!
http://twitter.com/operahispanica

story:
Short Summary

Random Hero is a Christian Rock Band based in Denver, Colorado. Our primary goal and ministry is to bring light into the darkness. We love bringing a message of hope and joy to people in their darkest moments of life. The songs that we sing are influenced by personal experiences with loved ones and friends.

Random Hero has performed with many of today's top artists both Christian and Secular.  The band has been featured on MTV, Vans Warped Tour, ESPN X-Games, and more.  Random Hero is the exclusive band for Rise Up Tour, which brings a unique program focused on suicide and addiction education, to high schools and middle schools.

By supporting our IndieGoGo campaign, you will help Random Hero release our first full length album this year and then support the album with our upcoming tour. You will also help us grow our ministry as we reach out to a ton of new people this summer. 

Where is your money going?

Album

-       Final stages of album production.

-       Mass production of the album.

-       Promotion of the album.

-       Mailing the album to radio stations.

Tour

-       Pays for gas, food and lodging to and from shows where we have lowered our pay in order to reach more people (We will have a few of those this summer!).

-       Vehicle Maintenance & Update.  Some of our dear friends have offered to let us use a really cool tour RV that needs some love in order to get through our busy summer schedule.

-       Trailer Upsize.  Our trailer is too small to carry our full production, so we need to trade our old one in on something larger.

-       More Merch!

-       Emergency Fund.

 

The Impact

By supporting this campaign, you help us deliver a message of hope to those who need it most and other people who might just need a reminder. It is our hope to make this a full time ministry and a full time job for all of us. With your support of the album and tour, we will get to meet new people and build new relationships that will help us grow our ministry.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute now, you can still help! How?

-Pray for us!

-Come to a show

-Purchase our album when we release it.

-Share our music with your friends and family.

 

International Friends:

 


To all of our international friends! Due to the high cost in shipping out of the United States, we are unable to include International Shipping Costs into the cost of our items. If you would like to pay for the International Shipping, we would be more than happy to send the items you want to you. Before ordering, e-mail Chris.Emanuel@RandomHeroMusic.com with your name, home address, and which items you are interested in purchasing. He will provide you with an international shipping price.

story:
We're shooting a sci-fi music video!

Hi, we're Modern Vintage, a Los Angeles classic rock-inspired band.  Our upcoming album is a science-fiction concept about a washed-up musician and an earth-bound alien learning about friendship and power of music.  In the first single, Friend's Ship, we find Wood and Zado, the protagonists of the album, transporting from location to location as they establish trust between each other. 

In this music video, we decided to depict this journey of developing friendship through the imaginative eyes of children playing the 'close-to-home' game of hide and seek.  The video begins in the boy's room, and as he plays with his toys he teleports to a far-away site where he meets his new alien friend Zado.  The two kids begin the game of hide and seek, their realities coming together as they teleport across LA. 

We need a little help.

We're not asking for much; just $800 to cover the cost of the camera, lights, and equipment rentals, costumes, masks, props, gas, and food.

As a token of our gratitude... 

We have rewards, all right - everything from special thanks, t-shirts, digital download of the song, admission to upcoming live shows, even your name as producer !

Thanks for your support!  

We really appreciate your help!  Anything you can do to spread the word helps us get closer to making this happen.

story:
NOTE: All perks (other than the digital album download) are COMPLETELY EXCLUSIVE to this campaign. They will be available only to people who donate, and will never be available again once the campaign ends.

At the age of eighteen, I signed a record deal with Universal Republic and released my major label debut, Picturesque. I recorded a duet with Colbie Caillat. I toured the country, made more than a handful of friends that I treasure to this day, and had the amazing opportunity to work with a team of people who honestly believed in my music.

Just a short six months later, it was all gone. My label dropped me, and I was discouraged. More than that, I had lost that artistic spark that fueled my songwriting. The whole experience left me nursing my wounds and feeling sorry for myself, but sometimes experiences like these can leave us stronger and more determined than ever if we can learn from them and use them to grow.

Recently, I felt something that I thought might have been lost to me forever... That burning desire, a need to create again. The more I thought about it, the more insistent the idea became. I spent the past three years nursing my wounds, but I had also been growing as a person, as a musician, and as a songwriter. I've been waiting three years for this moment: I am finally ready to make an album again.

There is no such thing as a DIY artist. When I first started making music, the support people showed me was incredible and I will never forget the impact that it made on me. Everything I have accomplished has been because of people who have poured out overwhelming support and love.

So when I began to plan who I would partner with to record and release this album, it was clear to me that the best choice was to collaborate with the people who have been beside me all along, investing in me and my music. I cannot tell you how much your belief in what I'm doing means to me, and the time has come for me to put my trust in you.

I need your help. I am going into the studio and will have to pay for studio time, a producer, mixer, and more. I am creating a 15-20 mini-documentary to be released along with the album, and I also hope to tour the US in support of this album.

The money will be used to directly fund the recording of the music, as well as to market and promote the album, and allow me to release the album independently. My only goal with this album is to share it with as many people as possible, and I can't do it on my own. I'm placing my faith in you, and I'm asking you to place yours in me.

I know some of you won't be able to make a contribution to my project, and that's perfectly okay!

No matter what, know that I appreciate every donation, every download, and every encouraging word that I have received throughout the years. It has been more support than I could have ever hoped for, and I can't thank you enough for everything you've done for me.

So when I began to plan who I would partner with to record and release this album, it was clear to me that the best choice was to collaborate with the people who have been beside me all along, investing in me and my music. I cannot tell you how much your belief in what I'm doing means to me, and the time has come for me to put my trust in you.
I need your help. I am going into the studio and will have to pay for studio time, a producer, mixer, and more. I am creating a 15-20 mini-documentary to be released along with the album, and I also hope to tour the US in support of this album.
The money will be used to directly fund the recording of the music, as well as to market and promote the album, and allow me to release the album independently. My only goal with this album is to share it with as many people as possible, and I can't do it on my own. I'm placing my faith in you, and I'm asking you to place yours in me.



I know some of you won't be able to make a contribution to my project, and that's perfectly okay!
No matter what, know that I appreciate every donation, every download, and every encouraging word that I have received throughout the years. It has been more support than I could have ever hoped for, and I can't thank you enough for everything you've done for me.

story:
Gabriel Tristan came to Hollywood, Ca with not only his talent, passion and ambition to launch a major singing career; he also came with a long-held creative vision to bring to audiences a new kind of concert experience...one that would take them on a time-traveling musical journey that nearly spans a century!

This concert will run the gamut of rhythms: early jazz, swing, romance, motown, rock, pop, latin and current electronic.

Gabriel aims to help bridge the gap between the younger and older generations by bringing them together for one unifying musical experience!

While Gabriel will be showcasing his own style and vocal talents, he will respectfully pay homage to some of the greatest singers and entertainers of the 20th century!

Timeless songs made popular by amazing artists such as Fred Astaire, Ella Fitzgerald, Nat King Cole, Frank Sinatra, Marvin Gaye, Elvis Presley, Stevie Wonder, and Michael Jackson will be only a part of this musical extravaganza!

Of course, producing and bringing to life his creative vision for this debut show is a huge undertaking and HE NEEDS YOUR HELP!

Major costs involved include: concert hall/theater rental, musicians, dancers, costumes, lighting, sound & video equipment, stage props, stage manager, sound engineer,  insurance, public relations, promotional marketing and other unforeseen expenses that may arise.

Gabriel currently needs your help to get this one-of-a-kind show securely off the ground and successfully launched.

It will be the first of many to come!

Thank you for all your support!!!

story:
Short Summary

We are Moogatu, a progressive rock group from the Washington, DC area. We've just completed our debut album at Mystery Ton Studios in Monrovia, MD and the purpose of this fundraiser is to help us with final mixing/mastering/duplication costs. 

Last year we played over 80 shows and used that money to finance the recording of our album. The band is now in the stage of mixing and mastering, which can get very expensive, especially for a group of working musicians. 

We've spent the past couple of years writing and perfecting these songs and could not be more excited with how they have turned out. If you love our live show, expect a similar shreddy dance party on this album! The album also features a guest appearance by tenor saxophonist, Ron Holloway (Warren Haynes Band, Dizzy Gillespie, Root Boy Slim, Susan Tedeschi, and more). We couldn't be more proud of this record!

Without your support, this album would not be possible!

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a basic breakdown of our costs and where your contributions will be going towards:

  • Mixing/Mastering: $2500
  • CD Duplication: $1500
  • Merchandise/Shipping costs of Perks

Rewards

Along with a brand new album with us, we've compiled a list of great perks including festival tickets, private shows, song requests, merch, BBQ, and more!

If you have any questions regarding rewards, feel free to email us at: moogatuband@gmail.com 

The Impact

We are a completely independent band and have self-financed a large portion of this project through many gigs and days on the road. Moogatu has no record label, distribution, or outside backing. By contributing to our project, you are directly involved in helping this style of music thrive, as well as supporting your local and regional music scenes. We've gotten this far because of your support, and without you, neither album or this band would even be possible! Thank you and remember: Shred Responsibly

Other Ways You Can Help

It's understandable if you're unable to contribute. But you can still help out by spreading the word. Share this page, tell your friends/family/co-workers/pet, etc.

THANK YOU AND WE LOVE YOU!!!

- Brian, Chris, Steve, BZ

www.facebook.com/moogatuband

www.moogatu.net

story:
*New Bob Marley World Cup T-Shirt Perk

*New Surf Roots Crop Tops

CREATING THE ULTIMATE REGGAE NETWORK! NEW APP + 4 NEW RADIO STREAMS! 

It's our annual Indiegogo fundraiser! This year we're looking to take it to the next level, launching a new improved App and 4 new radio streams! By adding new streams we'll essentially become the "Pandora of Reggae", you'll be able to flip around, change songs, and get all the best music in one place. And with the new App you'll have improved streaming quality (less drops & smoother buffering) and more advanced features including a renovated design tailored to iOS7 and new Android operation systems + social network connectivity with Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter. And with your help we can keep out all corporate commercials. 

The 4 new streams include:  

REGGAE NATION - Playing the best of from Jamaica & international, with today's hits and classics from artists such as Bob Marley, Steel Pulse, Tarrus Riley, Alborosie, Chronixx, Buju Banton, Capleton, Burning Spear, Barrington Levy, Sizzla, Gyptian, Morgan Hertiage...


ISLAND MIX - Best from Hawaii, New Zealand & more such as Katchafire, The Green, Rebel Souljahz, J Boog, House of Shem, Anuhea, Maoli, Irie Love, Kimie, Kolohe Kai, Natural Vibrations, Sudden Rush, Spawnbreezie, HIRIE, The Steppas, Ooklah the Moc... 

ON THE RISE - Breaking new bands 24 hours a day! Up & comers like Arise Roots, Wheeland Brothers, Sono Vero, Ease Up, Tribal Theory, Reeform, Iya Terra, The Originalites, Natural Heights, The Hip Abduction, HI Roots, Rian Basilio & the Roosters, Special C, Aloha Radio, Mikey Reyes, Ikaika Beamer, Tatanka, Wakane, Kings & Comrads, Ezzrah, Coral Thief, Arden Park Roots, Just Chill...


SURF ROOTS CLASSICS - The artists who paved the way including Sublime, Jack Johnson, 311, No Doubt, Pato Banton, Eek-A-Mouse, Half Pint, Don Carlos, Mishka, Fishbone, English Beat, The Samples, Reel Big Fish, OPM, Too Rude, Common Sense... 

And we still have the original Surf Roots station playing today's hottest reggae-rock artists including Slightly Stoopid, Rebelution, Iration, Pepper, the Marleys, Tribal Seeds, Dirty Heads & more..Surf Roots has been ranked the #1 Reggae station online for 3 years straight (according to iTunes Radio & Live 365) with thousands of listeners per day and millions of stream launches. So we know you love the music! But we've gotten feedback from you that the App cuts out too much, and not enough variety in the playlist. With this campaign we can change that. 

With your help we can continue having NO corporate commercials. The only breaks in the music are your favorite artists telling you when their new album drops, a tour you should check out, or a great festival coming up. When you turn on most stations you hear commercials constantly. When you come to Surf Roots you get strictly the music you love. 

Another difference with Pandora is that we are real reggae fans! This isn't some computer generated playlist. We support the artists, we sponsor festivals and tours, we are there at events hanging out with you at the booth, chillin with you daily on social media. Our radio staff works directly with the bands so we can debut new songs for you, do live chats, and give hot emerging bands their break.

We are also paying publishing royalties for every song we play, so Surf Roots is making money for your favorite artists. It's important for us to always be giving back to this scene, and helping out these bands we all love. Paying royalties and not ripping off the music is crucial. 


LAUNCHING THE NEW SURF ROOTS 2014 APP 

The Surf Roots App V4 version will include: 

*Better connectivity with less drops & smoother buffering

*A new and improved Player

*Advanced social network connectivity with Instagram, Facebook, Twitter

*A renovated design tailored to iOS7 and new Android operation systems 

*Listener customization including a sleep timer & alarm clock 

But we need your help! We're asking you our VIP's (Very Irie People) to contribute and get awesome Perks including limited edition Surf Roots gear, bikinis, phone cases, stickers, Sublime gear, Bob Marley gear & more. You can even get your band or company advertised through our pipeline. 



2014 PERKS AVAILABLE NOW  

All Perk prices include Shipping & Handling charges (in the U.S.) *additional for international orders 

Once we receive your order we will email you and ask which size and color you want. 

SURF ROOTS STICKER PACK  You will receive 3 of the new Surf Roots 2014 stickers! (2013 sticker shown)

SURF ROOTS PHONE CASES 

For iPhone or Android 

      


SUBLIME "40 OZ TO FREEDOM"  Guys & Girls T-Shirts
  

SURF ROOTS "RASTA" LOGO T  Guys & Girls T-Shirts, Tanks & Hoodies 

BOB MARLEY  T-SHIRTS, TANKS & HATS 




SURF ROOTS BIKINIS  2 Styles - "Spring Break" & "Summer" *Summer is featured on right side below, with stripes on the side

KEEP CALM & LISTEN TO REGGAE  Guys & Girls T-Shirts, Tanks & Hoodies

SURF ROOTS "OG" ORIGINAL LOGO Guys & Girls T-Shirts, Tank Tops & Hoodies 

 

SURF ROOTS HATS - FLEX FITS & SNAP BACKS 

"REGGAE LOVE" Guys & Girls T-Shirts, Hoodies & Bags

"FEELIN IRIE"  Guys & Girls T-Shirts, Tanks & Hoodies


RESIN MUSIC Guys & Girls T-Shirts, Tanks, Hoodies & Hats


BRAND NEW "SURF ROOTS ALL STARS"  Illustrated by Eric Everett. Limited edition. Guys & Girls T-Shirts, Tank Tops & Hoodies available

Contact Surf Roots with any questions or to get more information. Email us at resinmusic@hotmail.com 

Note: If you purchase a Perk and we do not hit our funding goal you WILL receive all the physical items that you ordered such as clothing, hats, stickers, etc. but we will not be able to deliver all the new streams.

Make sure to join our social media pages @Surfroots and set up your member profile @ www.SURFROOTS.com 

Special thanks to Matt Irie and Riley Neil who did the graphics for this campaign!

Noah23 exists within the fringes of underground music culture and needs your help to ensure Occult Trill III, Blast Master Therion gets a professional mastering treatment.

   All Noah23 albums are available for free at http://www.noah23.bandcamp.com He would like to be able to continue quality music on a pay what you can basis.

   Please make a pledge and spread the word of Plague Language!

 

THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary  

 

About Me  

My name is Derina Harvey and I'm the lead singer for the Derina Harvey Band (dHb). I've been on stage since age 5 and began performing professionally at age 16. I've performed with many different groups and worked as a sound and lighting technician's assistant. I even have air play on CBC for a song I wrote back in 1999 called "Rotten".  

 

The Band

Throughout my life I have been very fortunate to be surrounded by, and continue to surround myself with, experienced and accomplished musicians who just happen to be my very best friends. They are Steve Pinsent, Scott Greene and Ed Smith.

We have diplomas from the Music Industry and Performance Program and Recording Arts Program, both from the College of the North Atlantic, Newfoundland and Labrador, and a Bachelor of Music from Saint Francis Xavier University, Nova Scotia. We're all early-thirty-something and have over 110 years of combined experience on stage.  

We entertain people from all over the world. I am very humbled to hear them say that our music has "brought them home" and relieved their homesickness for even a short while. Entertaining is in our blood, passed down from our musical, comical, and artistic families. 

The Derina Harvey Band or dHb have been performing together for years and have been asked on countless occasions by a fantastic and growing group of fans if we had an album to sell.   

 

Our Project

This full length album is relevant and among the next generation of music that is honest and heartfelt. We are currently nearing the end of our recording project, a self titled album of the crowd's favourites. The covers we've chosen are Traditional, Celtic, and Eastern Canadian, however, we have branded them with our creative and energetic rock and roll flavour.

We've been doing this one by the book - professional gear, top engineers, mixing, mastering, photography, digital designers, mechanical rights, and registering. This album looks great and sounds even better! 

 

Our Campaign

Which brings me to the funding. I'm a happily married mother of three producing a top quality product from my heart and my hands. My family will always come first and they've alway supported me.

 I've paid for everything thus far  - pre-production,  studio sessions,  musicians,  engineering,  and mixing - with performance revenue from approximately 150 solo shows & 40 band shows each year.

I'm very proud of this! This project has been a long time coming, as we began this ride back in 2012.  Now that I'm in the last leg of this amazing journey, I am asking YOU to dance and sing across the finish line with me and my band of merry men!  

 

How You Can Help?

This Indiegogo campaign will give you the chance to hear a sample of the music, get your toes tapping, and pre-order the album. Check out the perks too!  

We have digital downloads, signed CDs that we'll mail out to you, high quality t-shirts for men and ladies, and opportunities for you to book me or dHb for your own private party where we'll entertain your friends with our wide range of crowd pleasing tunes.

Your purchase or donation dollars will go directly to the mastering, duplication, and marketing of the Derina Harvey Band album.  

So check out the video clip and have a listen to our version of EXCURSION AROUND THE BAY. Then donate, purchase a CD or t-shirt, or bring us to your garage for a party and be the talk of the town.    

 

Budget

 

FULLY FUNDED

Musicians & Engineer             $3,500.00

Recording Equipment Rental     $300.00

Mixing                                 $800.00

Art/ Photography                   $500.00

All has been paid in full      $5,100.00

 

What's Left to Fund?

 

GOAL

Mastering                          $1,300.00

Duplication                         $2100.00

Layout and Design                 $500.00

Merchandise & Marketing        $2145.00

Indiegogo fees 4% of goal       $260.00

Credit Card fees 3% of goal     $195.00

Total Goal                              $6,500.00

 

On behalf of dHb - Steve Pinsent, Scott Greene, Ed Smith, and myself:

THANK YOU for your time and now I'll leave you with my favourite saying: 

"We just try to have fun on stage and see how many people we can take with us!"

Thanks again, and don't forget to spread the word. Tell your friends to check us out and find us playing in a pub near you! 

Derina Harvey

story:
UPDATE (11/30)...

One day! That was all it took. :D

I want to thank everyone who took the time to donate to the cause. You guys raised more than the $642 that was required to save my hard drive, and there's still 29 days left in the fundraiser!

I can officially pay to get my hard drive recovered now, but there's not reason for anyone to not be able to purchase any of the perks that are still available! 

The $15 perk is a physical and digital copy of the album and a subscription to next year of Caleb Orion. For $15 you basically get two albums worth of music! That's an awesome deal no matter which way you cut it. I can use the money for other things that are directly related to Chromatose getting released.

1) I can pay for the printing of the cds! I was going to save up and pay for this out of pocket. Printing of CDs costs a couple hundred dollars, anything that I save up after the original $642 will first go towards the printing costs.

2) I can pay the wonderful guest musicians who took time out of their lives to record for my cd! I had a drummer, ROK, who played for most of the album, Jon York and Shane Costigan played electric on a song each, and Jay Harps played the blues harp on 1973 Barbara Dane. They all did a wonderful job with their work on the disc, and I'd love to recompense them for their help!

3) More music! A lot of you put in enough dollars to get a subscription to Caleb Orion, which gets you a whole years worth of music released every three months. I can put extra money into the project and ensure that every track you receive is a beautiful production worthy of your ears.

Lastly, a HUGE thank you to everyone who donated yesterday! You made a massive difference, and I feel like the most fortunate person in the world for having such a caring and giving collection of friends, family, and fans. :)

Our Story So Far...

For the past two years, I have been working on a follow-up to my last album Hendiadys [That And This]. Hours were spent making sure each guitar, bass line, and vocal were on pitch and in time, and I even solicited help from a solid drummer from Canada to tie the entire production together!

But then something hit me from the left hand.

I lost the hard drive that I was temporarily storing all of my information on. One of these pieces of information was the entirety of my album Chromatose. Every pluck, every strum, and every beat of the drum was lost. It's one of those moments where the world stops spinning on its axis and just slows to a crawl.

I tried everything that I knew how to do. I handed the drive off to friends, and their friends, but nobody could get at my data, and the hard drive just wouldn't spin up.

A New Hope...

A friend of mine mentioned sending the drive in to a recovery center.

"It'd be very expensive," he said, "but they would be able to do it."

So, after a minimal amount of hemming and hawing, I sent my broken dreams in to one of the recovery centers that I was able to find. After a lengthy wait, I received a phone call from my case manager at the recovery center. They will be able to save the hard drive!

But, it's expensive. $642 to be exact.

What I Need...

All I need is $642 to help me pay for the data recovery service. All of the work I have been doing in the past two years will be for naught if I can't get these songs back. And they're great songs! If you haven't yet, please listen to the video up top. It contains the last 30 second samples that I have been able to cull from my SoundCloud.

Perks...

For helping me out, there's a lot of perks!

For starters, everyone who supports me with the smallest possible amount will get a free digital copy of the album when it is released. This is my way of saying, Thank you for helping me raise the money to save my music! I want people to hear the fruits of their care.

Other perks will be a hard copy of the album, hard copies of Hendiadys, and even a hand-made hard copy of my first album, Plumb. Plumb never even saw the light of day as a physical release, only as a digital download. I will gladly hand-make a numbered, limited edition, physical version of the album for this project to succeed.

For those who fund at higher levels, I offer hand-made t-shirts with designs of your favorite food or favorite animal. These shirts will be completely designed by me by hand, converted to stencil format, and painted onto a t-shirt. They are guaranteed to be one of a kind, and you'll be able to tell people you got it by helping make music happen!

And the biggest perk of all, if you fund the entire Hard Drive recovery fee, I will write a song dedicated to you (with a topic that we agree upon beforehand), which I will write and record specifically to append as a bonus track on the end of Chromatose. That's right, I will hasten a track just for you, and it will sound delicious!

Caleb Orion Subscription?...

Everyone who donates $15 or more to the recovery cause will not just earn their perks, but they will also be signed up for a year of Caleb Orion. What does that mean?

Instead of having to wait a whole year or more for my next release, everyone who subscribes to Caleb Orion will get four new songs every four months, for a total of twelve songs a year. 

Every year I will compile all of these songs together for a full album release to distribute to anyone who is not already a subscriber, but with a subscription comes the great responsibility of having to enjoy all the songs in four-track increments. Imagine being the talk of the town by hearing all the new material months before anyone else! Awesome.

Please Share...

Share with your friends. The only way I can ensure that I can release my album is by your help! If everyone gets together to help out, we can all be a part of the process.

Thank you so much in advance. You have no idea how much it means to me. :)

story:
"Please help keep our vision alive and be part in making movies happen"

- Harald Galinski | Studio Founder

"You really can't underestimate how important a space like this is to making major motion pictures"

-Marty Bowen, Producer | Dear John & the Twilight Saga


SUMMARY 

In May of 2011, I fulfilled a dream and opened Studio Charleston, South Carolina’s first permanent Film/TV production facility with a vision to help bringing back Film/TV productions, creating new jobs and to help stimulate our regions economy!

WHAT HAPPENED

Last summer, South Carolina lost its competitive Film Incentives. Film incentives are rebates provided by the state to the movie makers and are one of the main reasons why productions select a specific state. Without them, the chances of large productions coming back to our state are slim, and Studio Charleston and our S.C. film industry will not be able to survive.

The 70,000 SF studio needs big productions to make it. The facility has been the production hub and stages for major studio productions like "Dear John". It quickly attracted a variety of great clients; a History Channel TV Show Pilot, an Atlantic Records Music-Video productions and independent feature films, like "Little Red Wagon" and the locally produced "Warrior Road" - all of which employed local crew & talent, using local vendors and services.

OUR STRATEGY

We are fighting for a couple of things:

  • Passing New S.C. Film Incentives, which were successfully introduced first thing this year and have already passed the challenging S.C. State Finance Committee.
  • Keeping Studio Charleston alive until the new incentives are passed

YOU CAN MAKE IT HAPPEN

We Need Your Help to raise the money needed to pay the basic operating expenses. More than ever, we are committed to stay focused on recruiting new Film/TV projects to our beautiful state and pushing to swiftly pass the new incentives.

We have great perks for your contributions; for only $10 you are honored with a permanent "Thank You Recognition" on our website, just $25 will put your name permanently on a plaque at our stage-walk, Exclusive Studio T-Shirt for $50 and perks as unique as NAMING A STAGE. Please remember that even the smallest contribution will make a BIG DIFFERENCE. 

Right now, WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE IT HAPPEN!!!

PLEASE CONTRIBUTE TODAY by clicking on one of the perks below or select from the full list to the right:

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION ! ! !

 

THE FULL STORY....

Having competitive state film incentives in combination with a production facility is key to recruiting new productions to South Carolina. The studio complex now offers a total of 70,000 SF of Creative Production Space - it instantly made South Carolina competitive with our neighboring states.

The facility really is amazing, offering Studio & Stages ranging from 780 SF to 19,500 SF with 40' high ceilings, Equipment Rental, 14,000 SF of Production Offices, Copy Center, plus technical and production management solutions for every scale of production; from one hour Photo Shoots at our turn-key STUDIO A, to month's long Film/TV productions.

 

"Having these massive stage settings in the same space as production offices, conference rooms, construction department and everything else you need to run a project smoothly is perfect", said Marty Bowen, producer of the successful Twilight Saga, about our facility, which he used as production hub and for soundstages on the production of Nicola’s Sparks “DEAR JOHN”, which employed over 250 crew members in South Carolina.

 

Studio Charleston and its many wonderful supporters have given me the dignity of being uncompromisingly loyal to something I believe in...and to hold on to it. And, above all else, believe, without question, that it will carry on!

With the encouraging support of my wonderful family, friends and business partners, I have stayed strong and loyal to what I believe in. We have focused our energy on what is most important, getting new film incentives passed - the key to our success. We are very close, but it will still take some time and we need your help to stay alive! Together, with your involvement and contributions, we will be able to keep the studio doors open until the new incentives pass, which are currently with our State's legislators, pending votes of approval to pass. 

Please be a part of this once in a life time opportunity to bring this unique and rewarding industry back to South Carolina. With your contribution, you will become an important part in the foundation of South Carolina's very first production facility!

Your contribution will help keep the studio alive while directly influencing our local economy.  Film and TV creates hundreds of everyday jobs for South Carolinians while bringing millions in income to local businesses – and irreplaceable promotional value to our state. Even independent productions, such as the locally produced "Warrior Road" feature film, produced by visionary, Charleston based Charliewood Pictures, hire many full-time local Crew Members, Cast & Extras.

By contributing today, you can be the reason why Films & TV shows are made in your neighborhood, our historic streets and throughout this beautiful state! 

>> WHY KEEP STUDIO CHARLESTON OPEN?

Films need big production space: Getting the film industry to come to a state without a production facility like Studio Charleston, offering thousands of square feet of stages, offices and construction area, is like trying to get the New York Yankees to come play baseball in your city when you don’t have a stadium and the cities next door do. They are simply more likely to go there and not your city. Make sense?

Famous film producers,like Marty Bowen, would love to come back with new projects and all it will take is your help.  

>> THE IMPACT

Just one medium size budget film produced in our facility created:

  • 258 High Paying Jobs
  • 4,780 Local Hotel Night Bookings for Cast & Crew alone
  • $13 Million Spent with South Carolina Businesses

The jobs that the film industry brings are not exclusive to producers, cast and camera crew, but can create work for people like your neighbors, friends or family members in an array of professions, such as:

  • Electricians
  • Carpenters
  • Framers
  • Landscapers
  • Caterers
  • Seamstresses
  • Policemen
  • Hair stylists
  • Truckers
  • Mechanics… just to name a few! 

On top of creating more jobs, it also increases the income of local business, such as:

  • Clothing stores
  • Hair salons
  • Car rental companies
  • Equipment rentals
  • Supply stores
  • Furniture stores
  • Restaurants and bars
  • Food stores
  • Coffee shops
  • Taxi companies
  • Dry cleaners
  • Hotels
  • Tourist attractions and many more! 

What about our students studying at one of the many film schools in South Carolina? Right now, most of them must leave there home state to work in the industry they have gone to school for – let’s keep them here at home!

>> THE HISTORY OF STUDIO CHARLESTON

In 2008, Studio Charleston founder Harald Galinski came to Charleston as part of the team that produced the multi-million dollar feature film “Dear John” starring Channing Tatum and Amanda Seyfried.  If you have seen it, you know it’s a beautiful story set in Charleston, and the film does an amazing job showcasing the beauty of this state.  While Channing and Amanda’s characters fell in love on screen, Harald fell in love with South Carolina, and the dream of “Studio Charleston” was born.  With a vision to help bring jobs and opportunities to his new home state of South Carolina, he took on the challenge, dedicated his life to fulfill his dream and turned his vision into reality by opening the Studio in May 2011 - he never looked back!

>> WE NEED YOUR HELP!

The clock is ticking!! Studio Charleston needs your help to raise $35,000 to pay the bills and keep the studio alive while the incentives undergo the legislative process. Just the utilities alone cost $1,300 a month when the studio is not in use!

We are reaching out to our supporters like you to ask for contributions. In exchange, we offer many different perks, such as your name on a permanent plaque at our Stage Walk, T-Shirts, Set-Visits to future Film/TV productions and three(3) "Corporate" opportunities to name one of our stages.

Regardless of how big or small your contribution – every little bit will help and everyone is going to be recognized as permanent supporter of Studio Charleston.

Give yourself the opportunity to spot your favorite celebrity walking down your streets, to see your local coffee shop on the big screen, to be an extra in a film, to proudly show your friends and relatives were different scenes were filmed when they visit… to put South Carolina on the map like never before!

Thank You for Your Contribution ! ! !

>> Other ways to show your support and be a star in the film world!

In addition to contributing to our cause, you can also help by contacting your Senator and House Representative and asking them to support our bills as they go through the legislative process.

Spread the word and allow South Carolina to outshine the rest and be a part of history and the future of South Carolina today!

Thank you for your support and contribution. If you have any question or if you would like more details on how you can help, please feel free to eMail us to support@studiocharleston.com.

>> Our FACEBOOK Page: https://www.facebook.com/studiocharleston

>> Studio Website: www.StudioCharleston.com

The proposed bills waiting to pass:

  • S.C. Senate Film Incentive Bill: http://www.scstatehouse.gov/billsearch.php?billnumbers=163&session=120&summary=B
  • S.C. State House Film Incentive Bill (both are identical): http://www.scstatehouse.gov/sess120_2013-2014/bills/3357.htm

 

Non-Endorsement Disclaimer: Unless clearly stated, this campaign has not been endorsed by any specific commercial Film/TV production, products, process, or service, referenced herein by trade name, trademark, producer, studio or otherwise and any such reference in this campaign does not constitute or imply the endorsement of this campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Hey! Thanks for checking out my campaign, let me tell you a little bit about myself. I'm a young singer-songwriter based out of Montreal. I'm one half of the band Cabin 9, who you might have seen on YouTube. I have big dreams of writing a great award-winning musical (or several, really!) and in order to get there, I'm studying songwriting at Berklee College of Music's online school. Writing lyrics and scripts is my passion and the education I'm getting at Berklee is massively helpful. The one problem is, it's super expensive, and I have to pay for all my expenses myself. This means that in order to do school, I have to work crazy hours and starve myself a little, and that's not super fun. At the rate I'm going at, it will take me about three years to finish my program if I want to avoid going into debt. With your help, I could be done by next summer!

What We Need & What You Get

My total tuition is $12,775. I've already paid for two of my courses, so I only need another $10,000 to finish things up, not including book fees. I've set the goal here at $6,000 because I figure getting even half of my total tuition funded by other people would be amazing. If somehow I raise more than $6,000, the extra money will go toward the Open Door, a homeless drop-in center here in Montreal.

If you donate to this campaign, not only will you have my undying gratitude, but you can get some pretty cool stuff out of it as well! Everyone who donates will get thanked publicly, but the higher-level donations will be able to claim shinier perks ;) I'll write you a song about yourself or about a topic of your choice! I'll offer you a two-hour Skype chat where you can pick my brain about music stuff (or really about whatever else you want!) I'll get you tickets to literally everything that I ever do forever! On top of that, my amazingly talented roommate Tim Blais (who you may know as the Acapella Science guy!) has agreed to help me out with the perks, so we as Cabin 9 will perform covers of whatever song you want dedicated to you or a loved one on our YouTube channel! How great is THAT?! You can also get a private concert, a homecooked meal, and a whole bunch of other things! I'm seriously going all out here.

The Impact

With your help, I'll be able to finish school a lot quicker and with a lot less stress. This will free up more of my time to create great new stuff. This is a really cool opportunity for you to invest not just in a project, but in a person, in their career, and in their future.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, I'm super broke most of the time, so I totally understand if you can't donate anything. You can still help out by sharing the link to this campaign with all your friends and followers! The more people see this page, the better! :)
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hey! Thanks for checking out my campaign, let me tell you a little bit about myself. I'm a young singer-songwriter based out of Montreal. I'm one half of the band Cabin 9, who you might have seen on YouTube. I have big dreams of writing a great award-winning musical (or several, really!) and in order to get there, I'm studying songwriting at Berklee College of Music's online school. Writing lyrics and scripts is my passion and the education I'm getting at Berklee is massively helpful. The one problem is, it's super expensive, and I have to pay for all my expenses myself. This means that in order to do school, I have to work crazy hours and starve myself a little, and that's not super fun. At the rate I'm going at, it will take me about three years to finish my program if I want to avoid going into debt. With your help, I could be done by next summer!


What We Need & What You Get
My total tuition is $12,775. I've already paid for two of my courses, so I only need another $10,000 to finish things up, not including book fees. I've set the goal here at $6,000 because I figure getting even half of my total tuition funded by other people would be amazing. If somehow I raise more than $6,000, the extra money will go toward the Open Door, a homeless drop-in center here in Montreal.
If you donate to this campaign, not only will you have my undying gratitude, but you can get some pretty cool stuff out of it as well! Everyone who donates will get thanked publicly, but the higher-level donations will be able to claim shinier perks ;) I'll write you a song about yourself or about a topic of your choice! I'll offer you a two-hour Skype chat where you can pick my brain about music stuff (or really about whatever else you want!) I'll get you tickets to literally everything that I ever do forever! On top of that, my amazingly talented roommate Tim Blais (who you may know as the Acapella Science guy!) has agreed to help me out with the perks, so we as Cabin 9 will perform covers of whatever song you want dedicated to you or a loved one on our YouTube channel! How great is THAT?! You can also get a private concert, a homecooked meal, and a whole bunch of other things! I'm seriously going all out here.


The Impact
With your help, I'll be able to finish school a lot quicker and with a lot less stress. This will free up more of my time to create great new stuff. This is a really cool opportunity for you to invest not just in a project, but in a person, in their career, and in their future.


Other Ways You Can Help
Hey, I'm super broke most of the time, so I totally understand if you can't donate anything. You can still help out by sharing the link to this campaign with all your friends and followers! The more people see this page, the better! :)

story:
*Please include shirt size in "comments" section, along with whether or not you would like a certain perk signed.*

Indianapolis Metalcore

In the past two and a half years since we started back in April of 2011, I Will Define has been working vigorously through writing music, playing shows, and even embarking on our first 10 day tour back in the summer of this year. We even released a debut EP entitled 'Foundations'. A year has passed since that release and in that time the band has not slowed down one bit on the writing end. Now we are coming to you with brand new material and hoping to release it with a bigger bang than ever. These songs, we feel are a complete transformation when compared to previous songs. They come bearing a message that we want you guys to hear. This is where YOU come in.

Why an IndieGoGo?


We chose to use the Indiegogo format to raise funds for this EP for a variety of reasons, however, the main reason being, to be perfectly honest... we are broke. After debating together as a band, facing ways we could fund this album, choosing a fundraising platform such as this one opens up a lot of opportunities to give back to the people who are willing to help and support this band. However, in choosing a fan based donation, we also will more than likely face the "beef" certain people may have with bands choosing to do so. Despite that, we are willing to ask for your guys help once again. 

Our Goal

We have chosen to set our goal for this album at (what we think to be) a modest sum of $4,000. All funds that we raise will go towards time used to record the album and towards getting the album printed and distributed to us to get to you guys. We have tons of various prizes/perks for you guys to choose from. Most of which, will be personalized towards you in our ever growing attempt to thank you for your generosity.

 

In Closing...

Thank you. Seriously, Thank you. Without you guys, we wouldn't be at this point of thinking it would be worth our time to put out this record. Even if you are uninspired by any perks or think we're huge assholes for even doing this, thank you for checking it out, in the very least. If you are interested in helping, every $1 helps out in more ways than you could imagine. If you've happened to stroll across this by chance and have never heard of the band before; you can check out our live video for our song titled 'Line to Line' here; http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OtR-Sokx_Rs

Hopefully we'll be updating you guys throughout the course of this thing with anything new we happen to throw at you. We'll also probably update you all when tracklisting, artwork, EP title gets announced. :)

I Will Define is...

Cody Wyrick - Vocals
Corey Standifer - Guitars
Landon Ziegler - Guitars/Vocals
Sam Foster - Bass
Sam Gordon - Drums

story:
Clambake Post Party Drive!

If you witnessed the 25th annual Clambake then you know what an amazing time it was. There were fireworks, multiple bands, multiple DJs, and almost $20,000 dollars raised for Special Olympics

Who did the most work for Clambake this year?  -Andy and Coach Paul

Who had $2900 worth of musical equipment stolen from them?  -Andy and Coach Paul

The amazing night now has a black mark on it because the people who made it possible by fixing up the barn and playing music, people who gave a lot, also lost a lot.

Since the Clambake would be much less without Andy and Coach Paul

We want to help replace their equipment.  Andy's bass guitar was stolen.  Coach Paul lost several guitars and a mixing board.

Spread the word

Also, can you share this link with anyone who knows Andy and Coach Paul?  Help us rally to un-sully the great time Clambake usually is!  

PS - Thanks for reading this.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Mark Eby. A few months ago I was lucky enough to be voted in as the President of the Mountain View High School Band Booster Club. Our school lies east of El Paso and we are in the Clint Independent School District.

The day of the last football game our very old stand (that the Drum Major directs from) finally gave out. It had broken once before in the same place a couple years ago, but we were able to get it welded back together. This time though, they say it can't be welded again and also one of the braces bent.

Without a stand, our band will not be able to perform in competitions this coming school year. Taking the money out of the band's regular budget will hamper the program substantially.


What We Need & What You Get

The cost of a new stand and the wheels for it is approximately $3500. Any money raised will be earmarked specifically for the stand. If we somehow happen to exceed the amount needed, the remainder will be used for any other instrument or equipment repairs as needed.

Anyone donating $10 or more will get a picture of the school. For donations of $100 or more we will have one of the students send you a personal, handwritten thank you letter.


The Impact

Your help today will allow these kids to go forward with their goals of being the "Best Little Band in El Paso!" Many of these kids come from poor homes and being in band is one of the ways they are able to "overachieve."


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please, please, please share this!!! Maybe someone else that you share it with will be able to help! Share it on Facebook, Twitter, or Google+. And of course, you can always use the built in Indiegogo share tools...
