story:
THE PROJECT

This will be our first full-length studio album in over 5 years. We have spent a lot of time writing the new material and we are really excited.

Cherry Suede have been together for about 13 years and have played over 2000 shows and there's no intention of stopping anytime soon. We hope this campaign can give us a boost so we can play more cities and more venues.

“Between Here and There”, the name of our new album and tour, embraces the core idea of human connection at every level.  Each aspect of this album, from the songs, to the way in which we record them, to the way we tour and share our live shows, is about bridging a gap between us all, through the power of music. And hopefully along this journey, we can make some memories. 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Until now, we have always funded our projects privately and through heavy touring, but this time around we are coming to you, the Cherry Suede Brigade, to be a part of the team.

The first Cherry Suede album cost close to $60 000 just to record, and even more to tour - and as you know, we gave away the download of that album for free.

Luckily, new advancements in recording have helped bring down certain costs, but at the same time, these new technologies have made many traditional income sources obsolete. Not to mention that the cost of touring has increased dramatically. Just the gas prices alone make it very expensive to tour.

So here’s how we plan to proceed.

Day One - even if we raise only $1

We will guarantee these cities on the tour:

  • Montreal
  • Ottawa
  • Toronto
  • NYC
  • Asbury Park
  • Los Angeles

 

$15 000 mark (our official IndieGoGo target)

This is our absolute minimum budget. This also releases an additional 5% of the funding back to us as a bonus from IndieGoGo.. At this point we can guarantee these cities:

  • London, UK
  • Brighton, UK
  • Manchester, UK
  • Glasgow, UK
  • Edinburgh, UK
  • Aberdeen, UK
  • Philadelphia, PA
  • Boston, MA
  • San Diego, CA

We’ll do our best to add a few extra cities to this list - but these ones we can GUARANTEE we’ll hit, provided we achieve our goal of $15 000.

But please keep in mind, the TRUE budget to make all this happen is closer to $50 000 before we’ll actually see any sort of profit.

“Stretch Targets” - THE ROAD TO $50 000

A stretch target is simply a milestone beyond our minimum goal. At every Stretch Target, we will offer bonuses to the early-bird backers, plus we’ll be able to release more of the limited bundles, so we can work together to get us to $50K.

Every target we reach unlocks a new set of bonuses and possibilities. (20K, 30k, 40K, 50K)

Think of it as a “Beat the Clock” challenge. The longer you wait for a big ticket bundle, the more it may cost - or worse yet- it may be sold out altogether.

So please back early.

We will add new cities based on demand and proximity.

This may include additional UK cities, as well as additional US and Canadian cities - we might even be able to look at other countries.

If your city is not yet on a list, we encourage you to buy a ticket and help create awareness for your town. If we see enough backers - your city will jump to the top of the list of considerations. 

So you can see how important it is for us to hit our minimum goal early, so we can put the album and tour into motion.

To buy a perk, simply click any red button.

THE BUDGET

Here’s a rough breakdown on how the money will be spent:

Service Charges (IndieGoGo and Paypal)

Roughly about 10- 12% (drops by 5% once we hit $15 000 goal)

The New Album/Song Book Companion: 30%

This will be a collection of life-inspired songs that we feel are some of our best songs yet. We have some new touching ballads, plus a handful of pure rock and roll tunes to get the blood pumping, not to mention a few that we have yet to write.

The song book is a companion piece for those who yearn for the days of going to the record store, buying an album or CD, getting home and putting it on while flipping through the accompanying booklet. 

The Tour: 50%

The ”Between Here and There” Tour is already off to a great start, having sold out shows in Montreal and Ottawa. We also hit Toronto and New Jersey, and with your support, we’ll just keep adding to our list of cities.

It roughly costs, on average, about $2500 for us to play each city (travel, accommodations, gas, promotion, venue charges etc).  So you can see how it adds up quick and why this is the majority of the budget.

The Online Experience: 10%

The online experience we’re creating at CherrySuede.com will provide the means to watch the making of the album, and participate in live shows from anywhere in the world.

We've tested every system out there - every platform, every streaming option, every indie music service - and decided that we just need to build our own. And that is what we've done.

The new cherrysuede.com is being custom built, from top to bottom, so that every single aspect of the site is geared to a more fun and interactive CSB experience.

PERKS FOR BACKING US EARLY

Take a look at the far upper right corner of this page, that's how many days we have left for these perks at these prices.

Each perk level builds upon the previous level. The more you’re able to offer in support, the more we can offer as a reward.

To buy a perk, simply click any red button.

How much?

That's up to you. Any amount from $5 on up allows you to get the album and become part of the experience. If every one of our 12 000 fans gave only $5, we would easily hit our target.

Realistically only 10% will buy - which means if you each bought a CD/Show ticket ($50)- we'd still be set.

The more you spend, the more perks (limited edition CDs, song book, show tickets, trips, etc...) and you'll be helping us make a better album and bigger tour.

NOTE: You will be charged right away via paypal but you DO NOT need a paypal account - you can simply use your credit card like you would anywhere else.

A benefit of PayPal is that it has the ability for people to also use their bank accounts to transfer funds. That way people who do not have a credit card can still participate.

PLEASE BACK US EARLY

By backing early, not only we will hit our goals sooner so that we can start offering bonuses, but you'll also encourage other backers to join in and create a momentum that will help us cross the ultimate finish line.

What if we exceed our goal?

We’re hoping we do. Like we said, we are only asking for a minimum to get this going, but the true budget is 3 to 5 times that minimum amount of $15 000.  If we exceed our goal, we start aiming for those Stretch Targets which, once attained, will allow us to reward early backers with special bonuses, as well add new cities to the tour.

So, please, become a backer now. It's quick, it's easy! (just like RS :P )

YOUR IMPACT

For Cherry Suede, next to the music, the most important thing we hold close to our hearts is our community of fans.  Why? Because we feel very strongly that music is a two-way street; a symbiotic relationship between artist and fan. Throughout history, this relationship could only truly exist in a live environment. 

But thanks to today's technologies, this is no longer the case.  It’s now possible for us to include everyone in any and every aspect of our tour and creative process. Just this idea alone makes it one of the most incredible times in history to be an artist. It’s like the beginning of rock and roll all over again, this time with the internet and mobile devices.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Spread our indiegogo link far and wide. Facebook it, e-mail it to friends, tweet it. Become part of the story; regularly check on our progress and get your friends and family in on the story, too.

Here is the link to share with others:

http://www.indiegogo.com/cherrysuede?a=641636

AND MOST IMPORTANTLY, please know how much ALL of us in Cherry Suede- from RS, RY, DJ and AL, to Joe, the man behind the scenes- appreciate and thank you for your support.

Any questions or concerns at all - email us at band@cherrysuede.com

To buy a perk, simply click any red button.

**ALL SHIPPING COSTS ARE INCLUDED IN EVERY PACKAGE **


**TRAVEL PACKAGES ARE FLIGHT AND HOTEL ONLY (food and local transportation is extra) **

story:
WHY ARE WE ON INDIEGOGO ASKING FOR MONEY?

We are asking YOU to be a participant in breathing life into Fred Friction’s much anticipated new CD “MURDER BALLADEER”. The songs are written and waiting to be recorded.

We need your help to get Fred into the recording studio. Your contributions will help pay for the recording studio time, the mastering and producing of the recording along with the pressing of the CD, cover/promotional artwork, production of a lyric book illustrated by Fred Friction and promotional merchandise for the CD release. Any monies left over after those costs are met will be put towards media-press promotion of the new CD.

Crowd sourcing seemed the perfect first approach to raising the needed funds and Indiegogo won hands down as the funding platform to use.

 

JUST WHO IS THIS FRED FRICTION?

Those of you who know Fred… ‘KNOW FRED’. He is a character not easily forgotten once met. For those who have never met Fred Friction… it’s time you did. And there is no better way to meet Fred then through his music.

Fred Friction is one of St. Louis, MO’s legendary iconic songwriters, classic spoon player, radio celebrity, poet and musician. Fred first made a name for himself in the St. Louis music scene as producer and frontman of A Night of a 1,000 Spoons, a highlight among the many themed shows in the early St. Louis indie rock scene and as a sideman on spoons with Enormous Richard.  With Mark Stephens, he formed The Highway Matrons in 1994 and began to emerge as a major songwriter. He also is an important tastemaker as volunteer host for the past 13 years of Fishin’ with Dynamite on KDHX 88.1  St. Louis’ independent radio station and former owner of the seminal Frederick’s Music Lounge. His poetry talent has been utilized by Poetry Scores; a non-profit organization that translates poetry into other media. They score long poems as you would a movie, then make silent movies to the scores. He has been featured on two of their international audio projects.

http://vimeo.com/42377430 

 

WHAT DO WE NEED THE MONEY FOR?

Your contribution with help pay for

  • the studio recording time, mixing, mastering and pressing of the CD
  • the cover/promotional artwork for the CD
  • promotional video
  • CD release promotional merchandise

 

 WHAT WILL WE GIVE YOU IN EXCHANGE FOR CONTRIBUTING?

Fred’s whole hearted handwritten thanks on a limited edition postcard to all who contrubute!

 !! AWESOME ‘STUFF’ !!

  • Limited Edition Fred Friction Artwork
  • Murder Balladeer CDs                              
  • Jesus Drank Wine CDs
  • Roast Fred Friction ‘Alive’ DVDs
  • Special Edition Murder Balladeer T-shirts by STL-Style
  • Special Edition Murder Balladeer Lyric Books illustrated by Fred Friction
  • Free tickets and VIP seating for the CD release party at Off Broadway Music Venue
  • A guest performance opportunity at the CD release party
  • Spoon Playing Workshops at The Folk Music School of St. Louis
  • Private house concerts by Fred Friction
  • A Sleep-Over at Fred’s house for up to 5 people
  • Signed Limited Edition framed prints of the Murder Balladeer artwork by Kevin Belford
  • Limited Edition Fred Friction Coffee Mugs
  • Limited Edition Handmade copies of the Murder Balladeer Lyric Books

We will be updating news and images of these wonderful perks.

There will be additional ‘time limited’ offers to entice your charitable curiosity.

SO CHECK BACK OFTEN!!!

Since Fred is doing this campaign to help pay for the recording and promotion of his new album, the Murder Balladeer CD will be a pre order item, along with the DVD, the lyric book and the T-shirt, limited edition prints and postcards, stickers and posters offered in the contribution perks. You will be able to pick your perks up at the CD release party at Off Broadway Music Venue in March/April 2013 or we will mail them to you direct, no shipping charge to you, with an estimated delivery date of April 2013.

 

 WHO THE HELL ARE THESE ‘WE’ YOU KEEP TALKING ABOUT?

WE consist of three St. Louisians who have donated their time, efforts and talents to help Fred Friction release another brilliant CD through the St. Louis Curio Shoppe  

WE are three of the many who admire Fred Friction’s songwriting talent, his poetry prose, and his never ending desire to selfishly entertain through his multiple financially undernourished talents without hesitation.

 WE are three people who know that there are numerous others in St. Louis, the USA, the World, who like us, support deserving, undernourished talent when ever and where ever we find it.

 We are:

Chris King; Producer- Directing Editor for St. Louis American Newspaper, Co-founder and C-reative Director of Poetry Scores and founding member of the folk band Enormous Richard/Eleanor Roosevelt

Jacque Brown; Co-Producer and Project Administrator- Manager of the St. Louis Curio Shoppe and Promoter of local St. Louis talent and small businesses, Artist

Kristin Gassel; Assistant Administrator - Owner of  the St. Louis Curio Shoppe and purveyor of all things St. Louis

 And WE are asking YOU to join us in our support of financially malnourished talent, like Fred Friction, that utilize the futuristic crowd sourcing Arts funding provided here on Indiegogo.

Please help if you can, even if "help" simply means reposting this on all of your various social media networks and telling all of your friends about it.

We are asking YOU to be a participant in breathing life into Fred Friction’s much anticipated new CD “MURDER BALLADEER”. The songs are written and waiting to be recorded.
We need your help to get Fred into the recording studio. Your contributions will help pay for the recording studio time, the mastering and producing of the recording along with the pressing of the CD, cover/promotional artwork, production of a lyric book illustrated by Fred Friction and promotional merchandise for the CD release. Any monies left over after those costs are met will be put towards media-press promotion of the new CD.

story:
Short Summary:

   We really want to make this release a very special one. We've put tons of time and effort into writing this and making this possible. We're offering different kinds of packages that will ALL include pre-orders of "Nostalgia", our debut album set to release on December 15th, 2014. 

What We Need & What You Get:

   We're hoping to reach a goal of $800 to pay for printing hard copies of the album, merchandise, and all of the other accommodations we have to offer! So with this, we will have multiple packages of different kinds that you can order! Once the goal is met, we will be contacting every person who has ordered to inform them of when they will be receiving their packages. 

The Impact:

   Music has been a very large part of all of our lives, and we wish nothing other than being able to make music and provide it for anyone who is willing to listen!

story:
Hey guys!!! Hollywood Hotel is a rock/punk/psychobilly band from The San Francisco Bay Area. This summer, we are planning our first tour on the West Coast of the good ol' USA. Now, touring is no joke as far as expenditures go. There is gas to buy, merch to make, and like in our case, a trailer hitch to pay for. This is why we are offering some pretty cool and unique goodies for your extremely appreciated donations. We can guarantee that every cent you give us will fund the tour, and will most likely feed us for the duration. 

Planning a tour is tough. And as a band that works pretty much on a DIY ethic, that makes it even harder. We don't use a tour manager, a production company, or anything like that. All of our shows are put together by us, the show promoters that work with us, the bands we play with, and the venues who are nice enough to let us play there.

That being said, problems are normal. Sometimes shows are cancelled, bands can't make it, cars break down. It happens, but musicians are a relentless breed. Hollywood Hotel promises to work hard in order to make this a great tour not only for us, but our fans, regardless of the set backs that may arise. If for whatever reason Hollywood Hotel isn't able to do the tour, all perk packages will still be sent out to the people who have donated, and all of your money will still go to band funds like gas, equipment, repairs, things like that. NONE of this money will be going to any one individual within the band.

story:
"If you knew how important even the smallest contribution was, you'd feel like a million bucks. It means you hear us."


NEW ANNOUNCEMENT:

It's come to our attention that many people would rather contribute by cheque or e-transfer.

Our mailing address is

30 First Ave

Orangeville, ON.  L9W 1H8

email - mgpiratedays@gmail.com



A Huge Thank you goes out to Heather Katz and Michael Griffin of Broadway Music in Orangeville.

Their contribution of $500 was given to us personally, but we're unable to display their names on the contributors' list.

Seriously Awesome.

Takes my breath away.

All of you do.


Originally our campaign goal was $15,000.          

We are thrilled to say that just before we launched this campaign, we received a generous contribution of $7500 from a fan, which has enabled us to start recording.

I'm trying to convince him to let me post his name. He's also creating a multi-media package of Allan's song, "Dance Hall Girls".

With your help, we'll reach our goal and beyond!  There are two payment options; Direct from credit card or PayPal. We recommend PayPal. It's easy, you don't need an account.

If you have any questions please contact us. mgpiratedays@gmail.com

So here's our story!

The new merger of Fraser & Girard, shows all the magic that can occur when two gifted singer/songwriters join forces. Both have great songs. Both have everything it takes to completely satisfy an audience on their own. Together, they offer an abundance of riches. The resulting musical chemistry unfolds in spontaneous and unpredictable ways, creating one moment after another of unexpected grace and joy.

The New York Times predicted that Allan Fraser's lyrics "... may well go down in the oral tradition of modern poetry..." The Toronto Star praises Marianne Girard as "...a proven songwriter ... (with) a voice that's unequivocally pure and joyfully unrestrained...” and The London Free Press describes them together as "..an incomparable duo both on and off the stage...".  Allan's songs have been recorded and performed by John Oates, Tom Russell, Garrison Keillor of Prairie Home Companion, The Dukhs, Cal Hand with Leo Kottke and many others.

Paul Mills is producing Allan and Marianne's debut album. In Canada and internationally, Paul is a highly respected producer, engineer, and musician who has worked with prominent Canadian artists Natalie MacMaster, Stan Rogers, Fraser & deBolt, Sharon Lois and Bram and many others. He is currently producing an album for Canadian astronaut, Chris Hadfield.

"I'm very excited and honored to be involved in this project with Fraser & Girard. These are two exceptional songwriters who have teamed up to create a powerhouse duo. This is going to be a great album!

Below is a pic of them in my studio today recording a demo  of a new song just written by Allan."  

Fraser & Girard is an unstoppable combination, and audiences everywhere agree.
You cannot argue with the power of these two lives merging.
Both grew up in the folk revival of the '60's and '70's, and the rock music explosion. Both are born wordsmiths and were destined from the earliest years to be writers and musicians. Each has had a solo career spanning over four decades, with the stories that go with it.
Marianne was raised in the tobacco belt of southwestern Ontario, west of London on old Hwy 2. Her musical training began in the church choir and school choir.
Allan was born in Windsor, Nova Scotia, and raised in Sherbrooke, QC. As early as 12 yrs. of age he appeared on Don Messer's Jubilee, Singalong Jubilee, The Tommy Hunter Show, The Elwood Glover Show..... this is taking you waaaaay back, folks!


What We Need And What You Get.

  • We need $15,000. Split three ways: a) album production, b) mastering, album design, manufacturing and, c) promotion/publicity. 
    • We have a lot of innovative perks for you, as you can see on the list.
    • There is a dual purpose here for us: we need your support, and we see this as a great way to highlight and honour your involvement in this project.
    • We'll keep you in the loop, updating regularly with photos and videos from the studio, and hope you share our excitement as we bring this work to fruition.

  • And..... we need cat sitters! Meet Jeremiah and Delilah, two newly adopted Bluepoint Siamese. Aren't they beautiful? And so very mellow, friendly, and  cuddly. 

  • They came from a very loving home, but Delilah had a harsh past before that. She'd been thrown from a car and was found in a stairwell with a broken hind leg. Who would do this?        

  • Her rescuers said she never stopped purring, even while the vet was operating on her. She's a very small cat, her little left hip shows permanent signs of her injury. She has such a sweet disposition you'd never believe she'd  had this trauma.

    • Jeremiah (Jerry) and Delilah met in a shelter and are inseparable. Jerry is very protective of Delilah, and of his new home. They came to us no more than 3 months ago.  And, just as quickly as they entered our lives, we became very busy, with many new prospects knocking at our door, including this recording. We feel they brought this prosperity and happiness to us, and want them to have the best possible care whenever we go on the road.

The Impact
  • Why this campaign is valuable to you as the contributor:                                  

  • Individually, we have each been recognized as influential and valuable artists. This album brings two lifetimes of song, and more than twice the impact. We're working with one of the best producers in Canada, Paul Mills . Bass player, Dennis Pendrith (Gordon Lightfoot, Bruce Cockburn, Murray McLaughlin, Raffi, Sylvia Tyson, Fraser & deBolt) will be the first studio musician on Sept. 25, on his double bass. This establishes world class bedtracks and sets the stage for further stellar musical contributions.

  • Many of you are already aware that the music industry is not what it used to be. Most, if not all of the onus of recording, marketing, and booking falls on the artist, while trying to sustain a high level of creativity. A very daunting job, to say the least. Your contribution allows us to work with the best people in Canada, bring our music to you and promote worldwide, and to make time to allow more great songs to emerge.

Risks & Challenges

  • Our ultimate goal is to become self-sustaining in the music industry. We'll do this by touring and performance, t.v. and radio royalties. We've already begun to do this even before we've started recording as a duo. The debut album of Fraser & Girard will propel our intentions even further afield. And it will be you, our music community that helps make this happen.  We have the music, solidly,  and you can help to provide the vehicle to move it forward and be further recognized as viable and significant work.
  • Challenges we face are maintaining our health while keeping up the pace required in this business. Touring is physically and mentally wearing: we are spry, but not spring chickens! Remembering to eat and sleep well, and most of all....not worry, is something we all face.
  • How can we overcome this? We are seasoned citizens of the gypsy life of musicians... we know how to do this, under any circumstance, but it sure makes a difference knowing we have a little financial cushion.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Not everyone can contribute monetarily. We value your support at every level.  Tell your friends. Share this campaign. Share on Facebook and Twitter and all social media. Like us. Like our music. Enjoy what we bring to you. Somewhere along the line, we'd love to meet you.

story:
The Goal: Releasing 'Lost In Petrichor'

Do you believe in the value of independent art? Do you value and support Do It Yourself [DIY] projects? Would you like the chance to defy an industry that typically says, "NO,"by saying, "YES," and support an independent musician make his dream a reality?  

"Lost In Petrichor" is my labor of love bordering on obsession. The songs are written, the tracking is almost finished, now I need your help to get my third studio album, professionally mastered, printed and manufactured.

 At the age of 15 I discovered the guitar, by 18 I was writing my own songs, and in my freshman year of college I released my first album of original music. Four years later "Muse" a folky fresh harmonica driven opus followed. I've continued playing and writing over these last seven years, and would very much like to share the music I've created during the journey with you.

With the love and support of friends, family, and collaborators I've been able to write and record "Lost In Petrichor", but now I need your help to release it. The realities of releasing a professional quality album of original music as an independent artist without industry support is shockingly expensive. Here's what your support will accomplish. 

  • professional mastering $200
  • copywriting fees and UPC barcode $100
  • digital download cards $100
  • mass production of eco-wallet CDs $600
  • In the event the overall goal is not met all funding will go toward releasing "Lost In Petrichor in this order: 1. Copywrite, 2. Mastering, 3.Download Cards, 4. EcoWallets 

What You Get

  • The satisfaction of having supported an independent artist create art! Lost In Petrichor is professionally produced 
  • As a thank you'll receive some nifty one of a kind gifts from shout-outs to reproductions of my songwriting journal documenting the process of lyric development for "Lost In Petrichor" 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for visiting this campaign. No worries if you can't contribute. You can still help by liking my facebook page, and or spreading the word! 

  • https://www.facebook.com/Shadesjm
  • www.shadesjm.com

Thank you kindly for  your support . It is the reason I'm able to continue doing what it is I do.

Best Regards, 

Justin

The songs are written, the tracking is almost finished, now I need your help to get my third studio album, professionally mastered, printed and manufactured. At the age of 15 I discovered the guitar, by 18 I was writing my own songs, and in my freshman year of college I released my first album of original music. Four years later "Muse" a folky fresh harmonica driven opus followed. I've continued playing and writing over these last seven years, and would very much like to share the music I've created during the journey with you.With the love and support of friends, family, and collaborators I've been able to write and record "Lost In Petrichor", but now I need your help to release it. The realities of releasing a professional quality album of original music as an independent artist without industry support is shockingly expensive. Here's what your support will accomplish.  
professional mastering $200
copywriting fees and UPC barcode $100
digital download cards $100 mass production of eco-wallet CDs $600
In the event the overall goal is not met all funding will go toward releasing "Lost In Petrichor in this order: 1. Copywrite, 2. Mastering, 3.Download Cards, 4. EcoWallets 
  What You Get 
The satisfaction of having supported an independent artist create art! Lost In Petrichor is professionally produced  As a thank you'll receive some nifty one of a kind gifts from shout-outs to reproductions of my songwriting journal documenting the process of lyric development for "Lost In Petrichor"    
Other Ways You Can Help
 Thank you for visiting this campaign. No worries if you can't contribute. You can still help by liking my facebook page, and or spreading the word!  
https://www.facebook.com/Shadesjm www.shadesjm.com  Thank you kindly for  your support . It is the reason I'm able to continue doing what it is I do.Best Regards, Justin

story:
Bringing Jazz to Japan after the Earthquake/Tsunami

•Hearing about catastrophic events leaves individuals from afar wanting to help and show those affected they are not alone.  The Earthquake/Tsunami in Northern Japan in 2011 was such an event. The jazz group, OTONOWA, led by drummer Akira Tana, was assembled with Japanese and Japanese American musicians living in the U.S. They traveled to Northern Japan (Tohoku) in March 2013 to perform five free concerts and to provide music clinics for youth.  

Residents still living in temporary housing and many not likely to return to their villages were provided a temporary reprieve from their situation and could just focus on the uplifting music. The sense of gratitude expressed by residents to know they were not forgotten was extremely moving to see. 

CD recorded for Tohoku

• OTONOWA, also the name of the CD recorded to raise money for the Tohoku effort, included jazz interpretations of Japanese folk and pop melodies. This CD was also distributed to Tohoku residents at the concerts. 

• Jazz musicians include: Akira Tana (drums); Art Hirahara (piano); Masaru Koga (reeds, perc), Noriyuki Ken Okada (bass)

Fundraising to return OTONOWA to Japan July 2014

•OTONOWA is planning a return trip to Northern Japan and is fundraising to cover travel and lodging costs to make the trip a reality. All musicians are donating their time. Our goal is to once again spiritually uplift the people of Tohoku through our music and raise money for the rebuilding efforts. Your generous contributions, large or small, will have a direct impact on the lives of people whom we shouldn't ever forget.  San Jose Jazz, a nonprofit that sponsors the exciting annual San Jose Jazz Summer Fest, is a key supporter and Otonowa’s fiscal sponsor, making all donations for US citizens100% tax deductible. Donations made to San Jose Jazz must be noted for Otonowa Tour.

•The OTONOWA group includes six people including the organizer/guest vocalist, Saki Kono, and a tour manager. Airfare will cost a total of $12,000 USD. Domestic travel by train, van rental, lodging and meals for 6 days for 6 persons in Japan will cost close to $8,000. The goal is to raise a total of $20,000.  

Our gift to you

  • Your donations will not go unrewarded! More are listed in the perks column but donations of $25 will receive a download of the recording. Donors of $100 will receive a copy of the CD, "OTONOWA." Donors of $1000 will receive the CD and also be mentioned publicly in printed programs as sponsors of the tour. A personal thank you by each member of the group will be included in the video/photo compilation of the tour.    Donations of $5000 or more in addition to the above, will afford the donor an opportunity to have a live performance by OTONOWA, exclusive of costs related to the performance i.e., travel and lodging and related expenses; all performance fees will be waived.
All donations will gratefully be accepted, large or small. Your donations will have a direct impact on the spiritual lives of the communities still rebuilding from the tragedy of 2011. Forgetting is not an option!

story:
Our Story

I am Jacquelyn Stearns, a recent graduate of Western CT State University, based in Danbury, CT, where I studied classical voice. In the summer of 2010, I was fortunate enough to participate in a summer program for voice and German language in Salzburg, Austria. This summer, I am thrilled to say that I have the opportunity to participate in Opera Project NYC, where I will be a member of the chorus for Tchaikovsky's Eugene Onegin and also the opportunity to perform various roles in various opera scenes for the New York Opera Festival.


http://www.operaprojectnyc.org/


Some steps have already been made in the direction of funding this program. These steps being...I have been accepted. I have been able to save some of the money, which I will put towards the program; however, it is a heavy financial hole which I desperately need help with. 

I am attempting to raise $2000.00 for the cost of the program, score and travel expenses to and from New York City. 

I urge you to make any sort of donation as I attempt to fulfill my dream of becoming the best possible opera singer I can be. 

Thank you for reading this and I thank you for your generous help!

story:
Short Summary

We are a psychedelic blues band from a small town in rural Oklahoma. We've been together for six years playing all around the southern United States. We like beer long walks on the beach and Sonny Boy Williamson. We have released one album on Zanzibar Records called "I Don't Know How to Tell You This But Heres... Psychotic Reaction." We would like to press our next album on vinyl and get at least 500 copies pressed. However pressing vinyl is really expensive and between the three of us its still allot of money. Around $2000 for a basic pressing of 1000 with color jackets. We'd like to have them before we go on tour in June. So if you can help us out and give us a buck or two we will keep on kicking out the jams!
What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to print 500 records who knows if well sell every one of them in our lifetime but we are damn sure going to try. Printing 500 is 1300. Even if we don't make it to our goal it will help us a lot to take some of the load off so we can make a record we are pretty proud of. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have money help us get the word out about it. If you play in a band tell everyone at your show about it. Help us book shows. Do what ever you want whatever you can. Its rock and roll. http://www.facebook.com/pages/Psychotic-Reaction/116631510863

story:
Picture by: Eparrilla Photos

 

Anchorage…    is more than a group of five dear-friends coming together to play music. With a tangible passion for creativity and expression, it is the coalescence of like minds and emotions. Constant drive and determination help them to push forward with each day, but above all else it is the music itself that gives meaning to Anchorage.  It is the belief that through passion and hard-work positivity and community can flourish.

For the past seven months…Anchorage has worked diligently in breaking down emotional and mental barriers in order to create a sound that is uniquely their own.  Drawing influences from all walks of musical life – jazz, funk, alternative rock, folk, metal, electronica – the combined creative force has finished what is to be their most daring and proud collection of work to date.  The loss of dear friends and members to the band, looming deadlines, and the difficult decision to embrace a more open musical style has given Anchorage strength through adversity. With patience and a determined passion to accomplish any goal, Anchorage continues to press forward fearlessly.

 All of the money raised…will help fund various expenses that Anchorage believes will truly help them market themselves as a professional and determined small business. The overall fundraising goal of $2500 will finance 33% of the total costs that will be accrued over the next few months.  Of the net total:

• 43% will go toward recording a new full-length album, and will account for all travel expenses. 

• 34% will go toward gas needed touring during the month of February.

• 10% will help restock merchandise

• 4% will afford the physical pressing of our full-length album.

• 4% will support Karen Du of Klavicoal Media who helped produce our Indiegogo video.

• 2% will help launch the Anchorage website.

 

With your help…Anchorage can become something greater than the five friends could ever hope to achieve on their own.  A financial contribution of any kind is support to the belief that music is about more than living a rock and roll lifestyle -- more than parties, and fame, and superficialities.  Music is about creativity and passion.  It’s about unity and the human collective.  Together we can make a difference, and with your support this shared dream can become a reality.

story:
More Sharing Services

Share

|Share on facebookShare on emailShare on favoritesShare on print
 
Joshua Sidney Russell Stern 
(August 15, 1984 - December 18, 2012) 

Send Sympathy Gifts Send Sympathy Card 
Guest Book | Sign Guest Book

STERN, Joshua Sidney Russell, age 28 of Tampa died Tuesday, December 18, 2012.Joshua was a Graduate of Howard W.Blake School of the Arts. Josh was a tour manager for a number of alternative rock bands most recently the band, Newfound Glory. Writing music and playing guitar were his passion. He is survived by his parents, Richard & Sara Stern, sister, Rachael Stern all of Tampa, cousins, Whitney, Maggie and Donny Mills, cousins and their children, Martin & Stephanie Orlick (Jake, Molly & Katie), Loren & Ann Orlick (Sierra) and Jonathan & Cheryl Orlick (Jordan & Sefra), aunts and uncle, Leila Mills and Helen & Peter Russell along with other extended family members including, Larry & Wendy Lempert and their daughter Amanda. Funeral services will be held Friday, 10:00 AM at Congregation Beth Am, 2030 West Fletcher Avenue, Tampa. Interment will follow at Hillsborough Memorial Park. In lieu of flowers memorial contributions may be made to Howard W. Blake High School, Friends of the Arts, 1701 North Boulevard, Tampa, FL. 33607.

 

 

 

Print Obituary
 
Back

story:
"No one can stop me, I won't be bound, I'll fight for love I'll fight it loud... I've got my Iron Fist"

That is a quote from a song on the album I'm currently working on. My name is Jack Mozie. I'm working on releasing it on April 9th and I need your help! I learned many things from working on my first album. The most important thing I learned is that in order to have a successful album launch you need a lot of support... and a budget. 

I am in great need of as much help as I can get. This album is of great importance to me. In these last two years I have learned a lot helping in the community and fighting for Marriage Equality in Washington. I wanted to make an album that told my story; the story of how I found my identity and fight for love and equality every day. 

Your contributions will take my album to the next level. There is software needed, promotion costs, distribution costs and more. With your help I can make a great album and not starve for a year. Any amount of great help. 

This is why I need your funding:

Distribution costs alone add up to $1750. This is including physical and digital distribution. With this money I could easily eat for many many days and with your help I can keep it that way. 

Mastering is gonna add another $550 to the cost. The mastering process is needed for an album to be successful and of course, for it to sound good. 

I need different pieces of software and hardware that add up to another good $1000+ (and more if I buy the hardware instead of renting... your funding will decide that I guess)

Promotional Costs are at $2200 right now for posters, flyers, wristbands, flyin discs, facebook ads, and more. Before you bail on this one let me tell you that without a proper budget for marketing and promotion the last you will probably hear of this album is well, this fundraiser. This is one of the most important parts. So please help with as much as you can!

Cool stuff I want to give you:

I want to give you a copy of my album. I cannot give one to everyone however, so if you donate $25 or more I'll throw you a copy of the album, and why not? A cool wristband.

If you are in a position to give more than that, then I would love to give you more as well! If you can donate $100 or more you get a Flying Disc with the album name on it and my autograph. And while I'm at it I will also give you the album and wristband. 

If you can donate $250 or more, not only do I want you to buy me dinner but I will send you 4 tickets to my album release concert, bring you up on stage with me and give you a hug. And yes, you also get the album, wristband and flying disc. 

The Impact

I want to use this record to begin my career as a recording artist, and share my experience with others about social change, LGBT rights, youth empowerment and more. 

I want to use the money made by this album to take it on tour with me. I need this album to be successful because a part of the tour proceeds are being donated to Social Outreach Seattle (http://www.socialoutreachseattle.com) to bring equality for LGBT people and their allies in Washington. A successful album adds to a successful tour. 

Your help can have an impact on an album and tour that fights for LGBT rights and youth empowerment. 

Feel free to contact me (jackmozie@gmail.com) if you want to ask me anything related to the project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is of great assistance to the success of my album but it isn't the only way you can help. If you share my passion for LGBT rights and pop music but can't donate at the moment then help me get the word out. 

Passion is perhaps what will fuel this fundraiser and make it successful. Share it on facebook, text your friend about it, blog about it, tell your local newspaper. Any way you get the word out about it can help bring more funding. 

Thank you in advanced and I hope we can be successful,

Jack

story:
Hello, I am Devan Martinez, CEO of Infectious, LLC., a record label that is bent on making a difference in the world today. Currently we are organizing a premium concert series entitled “Save Our Schools” to raise money to keep fine arts programs in schools.

This is a premium event that will be held at various venues within the hosting unified school district and be attended by national acts fol
lowing their Holiday season. Additionally we have obtained sponsorships from Global Women’s Wellness, Sienna National Title Agency, VH1 Save the Music Foundation, the New York Unified School district and the Sacramento Unified school district.

This Premium concert series will gain exposure for all companies involved and be seen by an expected 5.7 million musicians and fans. The tour is scheduled to begin February 22nd 2013 and will cover 31 major cities over a 4 month period.

Currently this event is headlined by national independent acts including PBC and Moeazy, Born Promise, RXR, Kombat (AU), Kurk Kokane (AU), Riot Squad, Cedric Benson (DJ World Peace), as well as major label acts with YMCMB including Kene West, Lil’ Chukee, Flow, and Kevin Gates.

If you would like more information about this premium concert series or it’s participants please feel free to contact me with any inquiries.

story:
MUSICIANS OF MERCY (MOM) is a collective of over seventy freelance musicians and artists based in the Metropolitan D.C. area.  Founded and directed by violist Robin Fay Massie-Pighee, the group was formed in January 2010 following Haiti’s devastating earthquake.  MOM raises funds for humanitarian causes through the production of benefit concerts.  All performers volunteer their time and talents in concerts that are free and open to the public.  MOM showcases gifted solo performing artists, chamber ensembles, jazz combos, and a full orchestra.  For more information, visit our website: www.musiciansofmercy.org  Follow us: Twitter (@MercyMusicians), Facebook and YouTube.

 

USING OUR GIFTS TO SERVE

Since January 2010, we have produced sixteen benefit concerts which have generated funds from generous attendees which were donated to charitable organizations such as Save the Children, American Red Cross, Youth Frontiers, Habitat for Humanity, FIRN, World Vision, AIDS Response Effort, Winchester, VA, United Way of Western CT, Thrive City String Academy, Jubilee Arts Baltimore, and more! 


WHAT'S THE CATCH?

There is NO catch!  We greatly appreciate our volunteer artists who perform for our concerts which are free (or nearly free) and open to the public.  As a grassroots organization, we depend upon the generosity of our audience and supporters.  YOU make it possible for us to serve our community.  At the same time, we provide local performers with opportunities to showcase their talents while helping to make a positive difference in the world.


WE ARE GRATEFUL

We are still growing and appreciate those who have cheered us on since 2010!  We are ready to take the next step to achieve legal nonprofit status. 

 

"Music can change the world because it can change people." -- Bono

 

Logo by Arron Pighee

Photo by T. Ashleigh Photography

Since January 2010, we have produced sixteen benefit concerts which have generated funds from generous attendees which were donated to charitable organizations such as Save the Children, American Red Cross, Youth Frontiers, Habitat for Humanity, FIRN, World Vision, AIDS Response Effort, Winchester, VA, United Way of Western CT, Thrive City String Academy, Jubilee Arts Baltimore, and more!  
WHAT'S THE CATCH?
There is NO catch!  We greatly appreciate our volunteer artists who perform for our concerts which are free (or nearly free) and open to the public.  As a grassroots organization, we depend upon the generosity of our audience and supporters.  YOU make it possible for us to serve our community.  At the same time, we provide local performers with opportunities to showcase their talents while helping to make a positive difference in the world.
WE ARE GRATEFUL
We are still growing and appreciate those who have cheered us on since 2010!  We are ready to take the next step to achieve legal nonprofit status.  
 
"Music can change the world because it can change people." -- Bono
 
Logo by Arron Pighee
Photo by T. Ashleigh Photography

story:
To my old and new fans, I thank you in advance for being a part of the new technology platform that will allow me as a Jazz flutist of 40 years, now independent, to create an album of beauty; along with my writings and photos.

This campaign to raise funds will be a consummate marriage of creativity and commerce; enabling me to hire the top session players, arrangers, studios that will result in a creative product born of heart, belief,and hope! You see, I still believe in the songs in my heart that I'd like to share with you, even after all these years! With the global faith of all those who hear the'new songs.For all who have found joy over the years in my recordings of songs as "HARLEM RIVER DRIVE", "SATIN DOLL", "CHICAGO DAMN", and so many more.[please visit www.youtube.com and my website at www.bobbihumphrey.net]

I have so many new compostions waiting to be born. I seek your production  assistance! This album will also help me to tour and see fans that I have so missed! I remain, even after so many years of  trying, to get royalties from the major labels who made millions from my creativity as a Jazz Flutist, yet had pennies for me. With this new album, creativity, faith, experience creates the most beautiful songs!Songs that are Authenic! Fearless! Boundless!  My flute soars with a new freedom from fans and friends who believe in me and my Music; a new production and partnership birthed by the Music, the people,and technology. As an Artist, with your help, I will play in my "key", JOY! Grace, Bobbi Humphrey "FIRST LADY Of FlUTE"

 

P.S. I hope that my 7K FACEBOOK FAMILY SUPPORTS ME AND GETS THE WORD OUT!

story:
Hello! We are The Slippery Lips and we're in the process of recording our first full-length album "Come Get It" but in order to get it all produced, we need your help!

With the money we receive from this fundraiser, we will be finishing up paying for the costs of recording and getting the album pressed & into your hands. We have a few packages ranging from $2-$150+ so it fits the budget of anyone who wishes to donate.  If we don't reach our goal, your donation will be refunded entirely-- so you have nothing to lose!

If you're unable to donate, but wish to help please feel free to share our link on your facebook, twitter, tumblr, etc. to spread the word to your friends.   We love you!

story:
Rachelle Adrian is a singer, songwriter, and rhythm guitarist for her band SHELL. Her recording budget has run out, all that needs to be done before the new tunes can be realeased is MASTERING the songs. For your kind generousity there are perks that will be rewarded to you at different levels of donation.

For $5 you get a download of the EP of 4 new songs once the songs are mastered! (please indicate which email address you would like the songs to be sent to)

For $25 you get a signed 4x6 photo of Rachelle plus the download of the 4 new songs!

For $100 you get a live accoustic performance by Rachelle of the 4 new songs (within 20 miles of Simi Valley or via Skype) plus the signed photo and the download of the finished EP. 

Thank you so much for your time and donations! 

Stay in touch at...

http://www.facebook.com/shelltheband

http://www.youtube.com/shellband

http://www.twitter.com/shellband

http://www.shellband.com

story:
(Polska wersja językowa znajduje się pod angielską!)


Hello Stranger!


       My name is Krzysztof Mickiewicz, I'm 22 and I'm a student at the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland in Glasgow, Scotland. I've been studying double bass at the conservatoire for the last three years, but before that I was attending two different music schools in Poland. Oh, I'm Polish, I forgot to add.

       I was born in Szczecin, Poland, and spent most of my life there, but then I moved to Scotland seeking luck - and I believe I found it. I have an amazing teacher, Nicholas Bayley, who's also one of the greatest musicians I've ever met, many good friends and I feel motivated to work by the great artistic atmosphere of the place.

       I put a lot of passion into my work as a musician. Every hour spent on practice makes me feel even more enthusiastic about what I do. Well...okay, not every hour, because there are some hard times as well - but at the end of the day I'm always glad and feel very proud of what I do. I love playing my instrument.


The problem


       The only problem is... that I don't have an instrument. I have never had one. I come from a family with a lower middle income and my parents have never been able to help me to purchase a bass. Throughout all those years I have been using so many different double basses that I couldn't even count them all, but none of them was ever mine. When I came to Glasgow I was very lucky to get support from the conservatoire and be let to borrow and instrument from it, but as it happens it is my last year of the Bachelor degree and soon (hopefully) I'll be starting the postgraduate studies and soon after I'll have to start working as well if I want to be able to afford the course. However, as I mentioned before, I am not allowed to use the academic instrument for professional work. And so the problem persists...


The solution


       In order to become a professional musician I need all the help I can get. When I found Indiegogo I decided that I should give it a try definitely. I believe this is the place which will finally help my dreams to come true.

       I need about 5000 pounds, because this is an average price of a good standard double bass in the United Kingdom. However, what bass I will get depends on how much money I'll be able to collect. I also consider buying an instrument in a different country, if I find an appropriate one within a reasonable price range.


The outcome


      Once I have a proper instrument, I will be able to start working professionally as an orchestral musician, while widening my solo repertoire and improving my skills during the Master of Music course at the conservatoire.

      I am asking you today to help my cause in any way you can - not everyone can afford supporting a stranger with their change, I totally understand it! Just share this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, anywhere and I'll be just as grateful as if you contributed with cash.

     Right now I can't give you much in return, but you will have my gratitude for life. And after that too.



PS. Look up for updates in the "updates" tab! ; )


-----------------------------------------------Polish version------------------------------------------------


Witaj Nieznajomy!


     Nazywam się Krzysztof Mickiewicz, mam 22 lata i jestem studentem Królewskiego Konserwatorium w Szkocji w Glasgow. Grę na kontrabasie studiuję tam już ponad 3 lata, ale przedtem uczęszczałem do dwóch różnych szkół muzycznych w Polsce.

     Urodziłem się w Szczecinie i spędziłem tam zdecydowaną większość mojego życia, i dopiero wówczas przeprowadziłem się do Szkocji, szukając szczęścia – i wydaję mi się, że je znalazłem. Mam niesamowitego nauczyciela, Nicholas'a Bayley, który jest jednocześnie jednym z najznamienitszych muzyków jakich znam. Dobrzy przyjaciele i nieziemska artystyczna atmosfera tego miejsca cały czas motywują mnie do pracy.

     Wkładam w moją pracę muzyka bardzo dużo pasji. Każda kolejna godzina spędzona na ćwiczeniu powoduje, że czuję jeszcze większy entuzjazm wobec tego, czym się zajmuję. No dobra... może nie każda, bo bywają także i te cięższe momenty – ale ostatecznie zawsze na koniec jestem szczęśliwy i dumny z mojej pracy. Uwielbiam być kontrabasistą.


Problem


     Jedyny problem jest taki, że... nie mam kontrabasu. Nigdy nie miałem. Pochodzę z rodziny z niższym średnim przychodem i moi rodzice nigdy nie byli w stanie pomóc mi z zakupem instrumentu. Przez te wszystkie lata używałem tak wielu różnych basów, że nie potrafiłbym ich teraz zliczyć, ale żaden z nich nigdy nie należał w pełni do mnie. Kiedy przyjechałem do Glasgow, miałem to szczęście, że moja uczelnia pozwoliła mi wypożyczyć instrument, jednak jest to już ostatni rok moich studiów licencjackich (Bachelor of Music, 4 lata) i niedługo (miejmy nadzieję) będę zaczynał kolejny etap – Master of Music, na który żeby było mnie stać, będę musiał zacząć także pracować. Niestety, nie mogę w pracy używać instrumentu wypożyczonego przez uczelnię. Tak więc koło się zamyka.


Rozwiązanie


     Żebym mógł zostać w pełni profesjonalnym instrumentalistą potrzebuję każdej możliwej pomocy. Kiedy znalazłem stronę Indiegogo, zdecydowałem, że spróbuję. Mam przeczucie, że to właśnie to miejsce, które pomoże mi spełnić marzenia.

     Potrzebuję 5000 funtów, ponieważ taka jest średnia cena przeciętnego, ale już dobrego kontrabasu w Wielkiej Brytanii. Jednak jaki kontrabas uda mi się kupić zależy od tego ile pieniędzy uda mi się uzbierać. Biorę także pod uwagę kupno instrumentu w innym kraju, jeśli znajdzie się odpowiedni i w rozsądnym przedzialce cenowym.


Skutek


     W momencie kiedy dostanę do rąk porządny instrument, będę w stanie zacząć pracować profesjonalnie jako muzyk orkiestrowy, a w międzyczasie poszerzać swój solowy repertuar i rozwijać umiejętności w czasie kursu Master of Music w konserwatorium.

     Proszę Ciebie dzisiaj o pomoc w jakiejkolwiek formie – nie każdy ma drobne, które może wrzucić do cudzej skarbonki, doskonale to rozumiem! Po prostu podziel się tą stroną ze swoimi znajomymi na Facebooku, Twitterze, gdziekolwiek, i będę tak samo wdzięczny, jak gdybyś dołożył się do sumy!

     W tym momencie nie mogę dać wiele w zamian, ale moją wdzięczność będziesz mieć do końca życia. I później też.



PS. Sprawdzaj uaktualnienia strony pod zakladką "updates"! ; )

story:
How You Can Become Part Of A History-Making Recording Event

On July 23rd of this year a new event was recorded that has been bringing joy and lifting the spirits of everyone who has heard it.

If you have ever attended a concert by The New York State of the Art Jazz Ensemble at the Gillespie Auditorium and experienced the overwhelming feelings of joy and excitement that accompany such an event, you and countless others will now be able to relive this experience every time you play this fabulous CD.

Not everyone can afford an expensive trip to New York to have the type of New York experience this group provides.  You will be saving those who live outside of the Metropolitan New York area a lot of money, as well as providing them with a unique and wonderful experience they may never have if this project fails to be released.

The fact that an experience like this has been captured LIVE on a recording is unique in itself, and if released, can give you and others the opportunity of enjoying this type of experience in the comfort of your own home.

Most people, like you, are always in hope of experiencing something of this caliber whenever they go out and are often disappointed by a lackluster or mediocre performance.  A recording of this magnitude will give you the kind of experience you crave every time you listen to it saving you the time of traveling to a concert venue by effortlessly hitting the on/off switch on your CD player.

The New York State of the Art Jazz Ensemble can swing you into good health, so to speak, whenever you hear their powerful music.  This letter sent by world-renowned author and playwrite Kirpal Gordon, who attended one such concert says it all.

Dear Dotty,

This is just to say I'm still hearing that beautiful music Mike's big band played Wednesday evening at the Baha'i Center!  Mike's charts, the solos each player took, the song selection and the way the band blended their instruments into a whole and integral sound: in a word, WOW!

In other words: I felt this warm, effusive, wonderful feeling of love enveloping me and the rest of the audience.  Yes, they swung, as they say (and what else would one expect with the line-up of players Mike assembled?), and I couldn’t stop tapping my feet, but that’s  not the half of it.  I found this music, and the dedication of the musicians playing it, connecting me to a world inside this world.  This was the kind of show I would have wanted everyone in my extended family---from  my immigrant grandparents to my great-niece and nephew---to hear.  Age didn’t matter ; the concert defied demographics and decades, genres and styles.  It put the muse back in the word music.  Mike is really carrying on Dizzie’s legacy, Dotty.  I’m a soul in wonder.

Please call on me if in any way I can help bring this treasure to more people.

Warmest regards,

Kirpal Gordon

 Most people would consider it a praiseworthy act to donate to such a deserving project that will not only bring joy to so many people, but will gain in popularity once it is released -- thanks to your efforts.

Since people around the world have seen videos of this band on YouTube it can’t help but have created curiosity about what this great group would sound like on a professionally produced recording with the highest quality of stereo sound. 

One of the reasons we need to release this recording is because we haven't released a CD on this group since 2004 due to the prohibitive costs of doing so with a group of this size.  Helping this gem to be released will enable people in all walks of life to have a thing of beauty in their possession that will satisfy their appetite for fine music through the many repeated listenings inspired by this wonderful musical experience.

By being on the list of contributors that made this happen, you will undoubtedly be seen as an individual of unique and admirable taste.

Others who are among the more sophisticated appreciators of quality music will surely notice your reputation as a supporter of deserving and quality art.

Now here’s the rub.  We need funding to produce a recording of this magnitude. For example:

1)  Union scale for the 17 musicians who performed on the recording.

2)  Cost of producing the recording

3)  Post production costs including mixing and mastering to ensure you the highest quality in sound production

4)  Cover and art work to create the packaging

5)  Manufacturing costs of the CDs themselves

6)  Marketing costs including radio promotion and press promotion.

7)  Distribution costs including retail as well as on line distribution. 

There is no way that we can sustain these costs ourselves.

All in all we need to raise around $16,500 to accomplish this task and we have 30 days in which to do it.  Won’t you take part in bringing this historic event to the public and help stimulate the love and interest in jazz once again?

No contribution is too small!  Please check out the exciting perks on the right  that you can choose at different levels of funding.  We will be forever grateful for the support you give us.

Thanks so much!

Mike and Dottie Longo

 

How It All Started:

Back in 1999 an exciting new musical group was formed called the New York State of the Art Jazz Ensemble.  It was a 17-piece band started by jazz pianist/composer Mike Longo who had been Dizzy Gillespie's pianist and musical director for many years.  Mike also had been a private student of the great Oscar Peterson. 

The big band came about quite by accident in 1999 when Mike got a call from his agent inquiring about booking the Dizzy Gillespie All Star Band, which Mike was a member of at that time.  She was trying to engage a big band for the Jersey Jazz Society's jazz week series at a library in New Jersey.  She wanted Mike to give her some idea of what it would cost to book that band.  Mike told her he didn't know the answer to that question since he was not the leader.  All he could tell her was that he was receiving $1,000 per concert and there were 17 members, plus the leader's fee which would probably be higher.  She called back a half hour later with the news that the fees were way too high for their budget and asked if he had any other ideas.  Mike told her that over the past 10 years or so he had been commissioned by saxophonist James Moody to write several big band charts for Moody to use in performances with college bands on tours he was doing in conjunction with master classes.  Also Mike stated he had the scores from some of the big band music he had written for Dizzy Gillespie during his tenure with that group.  The only thing he didn't have was the musicians to play it.  Fortunately the agent's call had interrupted a private lesson Mike was giving to Bob Magnuson, one of the most sought after musicians in the New York scene at the time.  Bob, upon overhearing the conversation, became quite agitated and began whispering and gesturing to Mike, "Take the gig!  I will get you the musicians!".  Needless to say, Bob put together an aggregation of 17 of the top musicians based in New York and in the world for that matter. 

Shortly thereafter, Mike was to leave for the Pori Jazz Festival in Finland for a 9-day stint.  While there, he had been given a luxurious private apartment with a kitchen and terrace and a private sauna.  he took an electric keyboard and a lot of score paper and began writing new material for the first rehearsal with his new band upon his arrival back in New York.  They rehearsed the new music and played their first gig for the Jersey Jazz Society's Jazz Week Concert.  The band was received by screaming fans who were knocked out by their music.

After the concert the musicians kept prodding Mike to keep this band together on a permanent basis.  When they first began they had 13 arrangements in the book -- just enough to play the concert in New Jersey.  Fast forward to 2013 . . . . . The New York State of the Art Jazz Ensemble has over 150 blockbuster arrangements, mostly composed and arranged by Mike Longo. 

In the beginning, word spread about the quality of this band and its music which led to bookings at several festivals and New York jazz clubs like Birdland and others.  Around that time, the band was recorded and 3 CDs were released between 2001 and 2004.  All 3 of these landed in the Top 10 on the national airplay charts.  One was voted in the Top 10 CDs of the year in the South American Jazz Poll and the latest in 2004, called Oasis caused them to be voted Band of the Year and Mike came in second behind Dave Brubeck for Composer of the Year in the same poll. 

This brings us to the point of why we are sharing all of this with you.  We are now in our tenth year of presenting these concerts, the goal of which is to present world class jazz to audiences at prices they can afford.  This takes place every Tuesday in our acoustically perfect warm environment of the Gillespie Auditorium.  Many of you reading this have probably experienced this yourselves and many of you also contributed to our successful 2012 Kickstarter campaign to keep operating in 2013.  As a result of your generosity we have launched a successful advertising campaign and have obtained a way for accepting tax-deductable donations.  We are now in the process of obtaining grants and funding for the operating expenses of the jazz series. 

 Now to get to the point of this document..  In an article around the turn of the century, jazz journalist Owen Cordle made reference to live jazz as being the “salvation of jazz.”  For the past few years now we have been recording the live concerts at our venue and learning from this how to refine our recording techniques to the point now that we are able to produce live recordings of professional quality and high level stereo recordings capable of being released by professional record labels. 

The concert on July 23rd in which the Ensemble was literally “on fire”  filled the air with electric excitement.  The outstanding solo and ensemble work was elevating the audience to heights rarely reached in performances of late and almost never captured on a recording.  Fortunately this one was, and it reflects all the above-mentioned excitement and energy emanating from both the stage and throughout the audience. 

We want to bring this marvelous experience to those of you who missed the concert as well as provide this memorable occasion to those of you who experienced it by releasing this recording.  And believe me, it is an experience  you will never forget and one that will have you engaged in repeated listening for years to come.
story_txt:
How You Can Become Part Of A History-Making Recording Event
On July 23rd of this year a new event was recorded that has been bringing joy and lifting the spirits of everyone who has heard it.
If you have ever attended a concert by The New
York State of the Art Jazz Ensemble at the Gillespie Auditorium and
experienced the overwhelming feelings of joy and excitement that accompany such
an event, you and countless others will now be able to relive this experience
every time you play this fabulous CD.
Not
everyone can afford an expensive trip to New York to have the type of New York
experience this group provides. 
You will be saving those who live outside of the Metropolitan New York area
a lot of money, as well as providing them with a unique and wonderful
experience they may never have if this project fails to be released. 
The
fact that an experience like this has been captured LIVE on a recording is
unique in itself, and if released, can give you and others the opportunity of
enjoying this type of experience in the comfort of your own home.
Most
people, like you, are always in hope of experiencing something of this caliber
whenever they go out and are often disappointed by a lackluster or mediocre
performance.  A recording of this
magnitude will give you the kind of experience you crave every time you listen
to it saving you the time of traveling to a concert venue by effortlessly hitting
the on/off switch on your CD player.
The
New York State of the Art Jazz Ensemble can swing you into good
health, so to speak, whenever you hear their powerful music.  This letter sent
by world-renowned author and playwrite Kirpal Gordon, who attended one such
concert says it all.
Dear Dotty,
This is just to say I'm still hearing that beautiful music
Mike's big band played Wednesday evening at the Baha'i Center!  Mike's
charts, the solos each player took, the song selection and the way the band
blended their instruments into a whole and integral sound: in a word, WOW!
In other words: I felt this warm, effusive, wonderful
feeling of love enveloping me and the rest of the audience.  Yes, they
swung, as they say (and what else would one expect with the line-up of players
Mike assembled?), and I couldn’t stop tapping my feet, but that’s  not the
half of it.  I found this music, and the dedication of the musicians
playing it, connecting me to a world inside this world.  This was the kind
of show I would have wanted everyone in my extended family---from  my
immigrant grandparents to my great-niece and nephew---to hear.  Age didn’t
matter ; the concert defied demographics and decades, genres and styles. 
It put the muse back in the word music.  Mike is really carrying on
Dizzie’s legacy, Dotty.  I’m a soul in wonder.
Please call on me if in any way I can help bring this
treasure to more people.
Warmest regards,
Kirpal Gordon
 Most
people would consider it a praiseworthy act to donate to such a deserving
project that will not only bring joy to so many people, but will gain in
popularity once it is released -- thanks to your efforts.
Since
people around the world have seen videos of this band on YouTube it can’t help
but have created curiosity about what this great group would sound like on a
professionally produced recording with the highest quality of stereo
sound. 
One of the reasons we need to release this recording is because
we haven't released a CD on this group since 2004 due to the prohibitive costs
of doing so with a group of this size. 
Helping this gem to be released will enable people in all walks of life
to have a thing of beauty in their possession that will satisfy their appetite
for fine music through the many repeated listenings inspired by this wonderful
musical experience.
By being on the list of contributors that made this happen, you
will undoubtedly be seen as an individual of unique and admirable taste.
Others who are among the more sophisticated appreciators of
quality music will surely notice your reputation as a supporter of deserving
and quality art.

Now here’s the rub.  We need funding to produce a recording of this magnitude. For example:
1)  Union scale for the 17 musicians who performed on the recording.
2)  Cost of producing the recording
3)  Post production costs including mixing and mastering to ensure you the highest quality in sound production
4)  Cover and art work to create the packaging
5)  Manufacturing costs of the CDs themselves
6)  Marketing costs including radio promotion and press promotion.
7)  Distribution costs including retail as well as on line distribution. 
There is no way that we can sustain these costs ourselves.
All in all we need to raise around $16,500 to accomplish this task and we have 30 days in which to do it.  Won’t you take part in bringing this historic event to the public and help stimulate the love and interest in jazz once again?
No contribution is too small!  Please check out the exciting perks on the right  that you can choose at different levels of funding.  We will be forever grateful for the support you give us.
Thanks so much!
Mike and Dottie Longo

story:
Who's Chase Fortune?

Hey there, my name is Chase Fortune (ya.. that's my real name.. my parents have an odd sense of humor) and I am but a humble, young gunned musician, yearning to make my mark in music. I've been playing music in one form or another for a good part of my life. Back in 2011, I released my first EP album, Today, which featured the light hearted full band acoustic pop sound of my music at the time.

So why do I want to make another album? Well here's the thing, my music has evolved... A lot. Since my first album, I've completely changed my musical stylings, dropping the 'acoustic pop rock' for a more unique solo act. Now, instead of taking the full band route, I've incorporated a loop station into my act that allows me to play my didgeridoo, guitar, and world percussion all at one time. Like all things in life, my music has adapted to my changing interests and now reflects a more indie/folk/world sound.

So for that reason, my recorded music is in dire need of an update!

I started looking around and realized, it's really expensive to make an album! So I need your help.


Let's Talk Shop. What's the Rundown?

Although $1500 is a shoe string budget for an album release, I've found ways to be thrifty about it. Here's the breakdown of cost:

****$1000 goes to recording, mixing and mastering the 8 song album.

               This is not much for an album but I work with an amazing recording                        engineer who cut me a great deal.

****$500 goes to producing CD's, getting the music on Spotify and other music sharing sites, and promoting the new album.

And hey, if, for whatever reason, this fundraising project exceeds its requirement, I won't complain. I promise.

Now don't go thinking this is all a one-way-road giving palooza, you get some pretty cool stuff in return! Check out the perks to the right to see some of the sweet merch just waiting for you.


Other Ways You Can Help

Although money's great, I could still use help in other ways! If you're not in the position to throw down some dough but want to help, you can help me out by sharing this campaign, share my facebook page, talk to your friends about the music, etc. They say word-of-mouth is the most effective way to get the word out so let's see what we can do with it!


Check out my Facebook page for updates and more info:

www.facebook.com/chasefortunetunes


Some Side Notes:

For shipping outside the U.S., please add $15 for shipping. Thanks!

story:
We are Mindy and Eric, aka Heartroot.  We started singing as a duo in Portland, Oregon in early 2010.  In August 2012, we moved to Berkeley, California for Eric to go to graduate school.

After more than three years singing as a duo, we feel the time is right to record a professionally produced EP.  We've found a studio we like (Live Oak Studio in Berkeley), and booked time there in August. We've also chosen a photographer to work with for new duo pictures.

We have seven songs in mind to record:  

"Little Bird Jump," "Cabbage In Heaven," and "You Are Not Alone" (by Mindy),

"Throw the Small Ones Back," "Break Me Open," and "Joy Will Dance" (by Eric),

and the Dave Carter song "Gentle Arms of Eden."

Your donations will go towards studio time (recording and mixing), mastering, new professional photography, graphic design, printing the finished product on CDs, and mailing expenses.  If we don't make the full $4000, we will scale back our recording plans proportionately.  Anything raised beyond $4,000 will help to support our musical endeavors beyond this project, including a planned summer 2014 tour of the Western U.S.!

In return for your help, we have some fun things to give back!  Check out the list on the right side of the page for more information on that.  Of special note, the first five people to donate at least $75 will receive a jar of Mindy's homemade olive oil and maple granola!   

If you'd like to support us, but don't feel able to contribute financially,please spread the word!  Just use the Indiegogo share buttons, or post a link to this page.

Thank you so much for your support and encouragement.  We miss many of you, and hope to see you on the road next year!

Warmly,

Mindy and Eric

story:
Campaign Summary

My passion and interest in music began very early in life. At 4 years old, I attended a program called “Music for Young Children” and was introduced to the basics of piano and performance. It was while attending this program that I composed my first piano piece at the tender age of 6, and continued to compose a total of 17 piano pieces before the age of 10. At 7 years old, I began to study classical piano privately and excelled, attaining my Grade 10 certificate and winning numerous competitions and awards. I also spent some time during my adolescent years learning to play other instruments such as guitar, bagpipes, oboe and fiddle.

I delved into the world of songwriting at 15 years old, finding solace in the musical expression of my thoughts and feelings. To this day, I get a familiar rush each time a new song is channeled into being. Music was my first true love and still remains a strong and steady presence in my life. 

It has been a longstanding dream of mine to record an album of my original songs to share with the world. In July of this year, I attended a workshop in Toronto called SongStudio, and it was there that I met a producer who I feel will do an excellent job of bringing my vision of an album to fruition. Now is the time!

As some of you may be aware, there are many costs associated with the production of an album including producer fees, mixing and mastering fees, the costs of photography, artwork, physical CD production and merchandising, as well as marketing and advertising initiatives. 

Your donation will help offset the cost of some of the above mentioned items and will allow me to apply for further funding through various funding organizations in order to see the album through to completion and properly market it.

Every donation is sincerely appreciated and I am looking forward to interacting with you all as we bring the album to life!

What I Need & What You Get

Overall, I will need upwards of $25,000 to fund and market my debut album. The $7,500 that will be raised through this campaign will be used as start-up funds to put the production process in motion. I will use any initial demo recordings to apply for further funding through FACTOR and other funding organizations, which will see the album through to completion.

I have included some exciting perks for each donation level including autographed CD's, limited edition T-shirts, limited edition vinyl copies of the album, even exclusive voting rights so that you can have a say as to which songs will end up on the album! Please read through the list of perks associated with each donation level for more of the juicy details.

If, in the event I do not reach my goal of $7,500, all funds raised will still be used to get the ball rolling as much as possible and I will endeavour to bring the album to fruition, although it may take a little bit more time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to make a monetary donation, please donate a few minutes of your time by sharing my Indiegogo page with all of your friends and family using the Indiegogo share tools, your social media sites, or plain old word of mouth. Every little bit counts and I am truly appreciative of your support!
