story:
Prelude Chamber Music Camp in Jacksonville, FL has been teaching kids the joy of chamber music since 2002.  The brainchild of Jacksonville Symphony violinist Jeanne Majors, it has become an annual labor of love for her and the many local professional musicians who teach there.

                                 

Prelude Camp is open every June to strings students of all ages (and some adults), and to musicians of all levels of proficiency.  Each year 90-100 students attend the 2 week summer camp and most of them receive generous scholarships.  Prelude Camp’s alumni grow up with a greater appreciation for classical music and some continue to pursue professional musical careers.

The summer of 2014 will be a very exciting one for PCMC!  The award-winning Dover String Quartet, including Milena Pajaro-van de Stadt (a Prelude alumna), will be in residence on June 10 and 11.  At Riverside Park United Methodist Church they will teach 2 master classes for the intensive track students, and perform a free concert on June 10, which will be free and open to the public.

The cost of this event, including publicity, rental car, concert reception, and of course the Quartet’s fee will approach $10,000.  The inspiration that this young dynamic quartet will bring would be priceless for all Prelude students, not just the intensive track.  That is why we are asking for your help.

Your tax deductible contribution, no matter the size, will help Prelude Chamber Music Camp bring the Dover String Quartet to Jacksonville for this very special event.  Can’t donate, but would like to help?  Volunteers are always welcome!  Contact Jeanne at majorkey@bellsouth.net.  And share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter!

We have some wonderful perks for your donation, including gourmet meals cooked just for you and a live concert in your home. Check out our perks and give generously!

this event, including publicity, rental car, concert reception, and of course
the Quartet’s fee will approach $10,000. 
The inspiration that this young dynamic quartet will bring would be
priceless for all Prelude students, not just the intensive track.  That is why we are asking for your help.

 
 
Your tax deductible
contribution, no matter the size, will help Prelude Chamber Music Camp bring
the Dover String Quartet to Jacksonville for this very special event.  Can’t donate, but would like to help?  Volunteers are always welcome!  Contact Jeanne at majorkey@bellsouth.net.  And share this
campaign on Facebook and Twitter!

 
 
We have some
wonderful perks for your donation, including gourmet meals cooked just for you
and a live concert in your home. Check out our perks and give generously!

story:
The Reproduction of Lui Stories.


Hi, my name is Lia Luisa Abella-Castillo, more widely known as Lui, and I’m a singer-songwriter in the Philippines.

I’ve been in the local music industry for about roughly seven years, in and out, as I’ve gotten married, borne a child, lost one, and separated.  All throughout, my one constant thing and lifeline has been music. 

The thing is, I have this one E.P. that I produced myself two years ago with the help of family and friends called “Lui. Stories.”  It has 4 tracks, 2 in English and 2 in Tagalog, which is our native tongue.  Everybody has been really supportive of me being into music.  But all 250 copies of that E.P. is gone, and most of it I have just given away as a sort of business card to recording companies, managers, and agents and only about 40 pcs. were bought.  Which is not enough to cover even 1/8 of the recording, the mixing, and the making of the E.P. 

I am here because I’d like to have that E.P. reproduced in 500 more copies, which I will sell at a minimal amount (about $3.5) to be able to fund the recording of hopefully a 5 or 7-song E.P. this time, depending on how much we are able to raise here together :)  I want to make more copies of these four incredible songs instead of going right ahead to making the second E.P. because the passion, the work and the time that I've put into it is not even close to equally reaching it’s full potential to get through to the people I know in my heart they’re supposed to reach. 

(In the video attached atop, the song at the end part is the first song of the E.P. - those are not the original lyrics though hehee)


What We Need & What You Get

The plan is to raise up $700 to reproduce 500 copies (it’s about $1.5 / CD which includes the mass production of CD with sticker, and the E.P. cover) by February 2014.

This project is giving and receiving; the Universal Law is never to stop the flow of giving :) Though I am wanting to keep this project simple, I’d just like to give tokens to those who give - those donating $7 will get a digital download token of the complete album a week after the closing of the funding; those donating $15 will get a physical copy of the album token, with a special note from me of course; those donating $20 will get a physical copy of the album token, with a special note from me, plus one more song that will be included on the 2nd E.P.  And for everyone who donates, you will all be informed on a regular basis for every aspect of the process and will be mentioned by name on all of my social networks :)

*By the way, you can check out a short write-up about it on the site where it can be digitally downloaded for only $4 on http://22tangorecords.blogspot.com/2011/04/lui-debut-ep-now-on-digital-download.html :)

The Impact

It’s a challenge for me to mass-produce it myself as of my current situation because I have just re-located to Manila, the capital of the Philippines, from Davao, the third biggest city of our country, and it’s back to zero for me as of this time, singing back-up to one of our local musical legends, Mr. Joey Ayala, aside from songwriting and singing my own songs; and will be working part-time learning how to manage talents, which is in my near future.

But in my life, I just continue to trust every single day that there is a reason why I am one of those given the talent of music, and songs.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who want to help and support in any other way, you can just click and paste this link on wherever social networking site you have and share, share, share :)

Thank you for your time, I really appreciate it :)

Blessings!

story:
My name is Brandon McGuiness and I've been creating music all my life.  I'm a singer/songwriter living in Nashville, TN.  I'm passionate about my music and I believe that I am meant to share it with people.  I've been performing for years with my acoustic guitar, but I'm ready to take my music to the next level.

I'll be going into the studio the first week of October.  We'll probably be in there for about 2 weeks.  I'm working with a producer named Neilson Hubbard.  He's a great Indie Music producer here in Nashville.   He's worked on two of my favorite records by Nashville artist and Ten out of Tenn member Matthew Perryman Jones.  You can check out his more of his work at www.neilsonhubbard.com.  Neilson will play a significant role in establishing my sound as an artist and I have every confidence in him.  I will also have top-notch studio musicians playing on the record. By the time this project is complete, I'm confident that it will impress.  This is bigger than anything I've previously done with my music and it will be well worth it.  

I have been writing with Neilson and he has connected me with other singer/songwriters to write with as well.  I'm planning on a full-length album of 10 songs.  Once the album is complete, I will use it to show off my talent and capabilities as a marketable artist.  This will be a doorway to many opportunities that will help me build a management team and book shows.  I also have a vast network of people in the music industry that I have been gathering during my years here in Music City, USA.  I will be able to get my music to some crucial ears.  Aside from this network of individuals, I have access to several avenues that can help get my music on TV and Radio.

The budget for the record is about $10,000.  This money will go towards studio time, hiring musicians, and mixing and mastering.  Once everything is done, I will still need funds for album artwork and the manufacturing of the CDs.  I have been saving up money, but I will be counting on fans and friends to help fund this album.  Any contribution you can make will be greatly appreciated.  If you can't make a pledge, you can still help promote my campaign on facebook, twitter, and good old-fashioned word of mouth!

All in all this is very exciting and I would be honored if you were a part of making this possible!

Cheers,


Brandon

www.brandonmcguiness.com

story:
Hello...this is Nathan Hamilton. I am an independent artist based in Austin,Texas and I am about to record and release my sixth album. I am really looking forward to seeing what can happen with this new batch of songs.  I plan to record mostly live in the studio with drums, upright bass, quitar, piano, cello, pedal steel and trumpet as the core instrumentation. I would also love to be able to pay these musicians what they deserve for their talents. My last release was a home recording, playing most all of the instruments myself. I was pleased with the results, it found favor with many listeners and I learned a good bit doing it, but this time out, I would really like to return to a fully equipped studio and be able to capture the richness of every note and word.

The money raised will go to these recording costs.  Any funds raised beyond the goal will pay for manufacturing of the cd's,posters,t-shirts and promotional material as well as all publicity including website upgrade and radio promo. I am looking to record in late spring and release the album in August of 2011 with tours to follow. I have toured internationally for the last decade and am scheduled to tour Europe again in the fall. 
In return, I am offering a number of "rewards" for various pledges. You will be able to choose from signed copies of the cd, the original demo recordings (like the one here for Ether & Time), original paintings and house concerts anywhere in the US. 
I hope you can join me on the journey and also help spread the word to anyone you think might be interested in taking part as well.

Many Thanks, 
Nathan

story:
Hey! We're making a music video for the amazing song 'All Bets Are Off,' the lead-off single for the upcoming debut album by Toronto-based alternative pop band Suncapades. Click on the video above -- it's pretty sweeeeeeet. 

Being the band's debut album, much of its success is going to hinge on us getting the word out via the lead-off video. 'All Bets Are Off' is a really beautiful, powerful tune, one that needs a video of similar quality. Once it's shot and edited, I'm going to use my publicity background (I've been in publicity for 10 years) to push this song and video internationally and help the band get the accolades I really feel it deserves. Your contributions -- of any amount -- would be AMAZING. 

All money raised will cover the following costs: 

    • Camera, lighting and assorted equipment rentals
    • Rehearsal costs and honorarium payments to our video's lead, as well as 40 hula hoopers who'll perform a synchronzed routine at the song's climax. 
    • Wardrobe costs for the video's lead. 
    • Craft services costs for the 40 folks in the video. 
    • Post production special effects. 
Whether you're able to make a contribution or not, we'd love you to pass this link onto some folks you know and help get the word out. 
 
Below is some info on Suncapades: 
 
Tim Fisher spent years working toward a music career; even switching career paths to pursue it. Unfortunately, a lifetime of labour and bill payments sidelined his efforts. Now at 40 – an age when most recording artists have closed up shop to rest on their laurels – the multi-instrumentalist is releasing his debut album under the band name Suncapades. 'Everything Darker' features a sound one might not expect from a stocky, working class furniture mover. Written, recorded and produced by Fisher, it’s a layered and richly melodic collection of alternative pop songs about life, death, redemption, rebellion and a yearning for the past. The lead-off single is the melodically anthemic 'All Bets Are Off.' 

The album 'Everything Darker' was written and recorded during a tumultuous period over the past year, where Tim faced various personal challenges, including the illness and eventual passing of his sister. “The difficulty of the past few months was pretty transformative, “Fisher says. “I either had to take a big risk and finally pursue this calling of mine, or abandon the idea once and for all and live with that decision.” Despite much being on the line, Fisher’s expectations for the album are modest. "I poured my life's savings into these songs,” he laughs, “so if I could get even a couple hundred people to pick up a copy, I'd be over the moon." And beyond that? “If there’s any interest out there,” he says, “I’d love to take Suncapades on the road and tour these songs.”

story:
Our Story

Hello! My name is Amy Cunningham, and I am a Canadian singer/songwriter. Singing and playing music has been a big part of my life since I first started to walk and talk. It just comes out of me, and I can't go a day without singing or writing down an idea for a song or a line that strikes me as poetic.

 

I've been writing since I was 13 (now almost 30! gah), and this past year I finally worked up the courage to do what I have always dreamed...I met an amazing producer named Corwin Fox, saved as much money as I could figure how to save, drained my "downpayment-on-a-house" fund, and made my first record. Working with some of the best musicians in BC, it was one of the most moving and exciting experiences of my life. 

 

With a release date of June 30th, 2011 I moved into my 1999 Dodge Caravan and began an extended 7 month tour that took me all over Canada, the US, and ended in Japan (where I am currently writing this). I have met amazing people, played in beautiful venues, on streets, and at festivals, and now find myself exhausted and ready to hibernate in order to finish writing my next album!

 

They say that once you are finished recording your first album, you're finally ready to start recording your first album. I've found this to be true :) I learned so much during the first round from so many people and experiences, that I couldn't stop myself from dreaming about the next one while the recording of the first was still taking place.

 

The challenge becomes funding. Once you've put every last penny you have into the making of your first, and then proceed to travel and perform for 7 months straight, dreams of recording the next album begin to seem quite daunting. With so many ideas, style changes, personal growth, and improvement as a musician from all of those shows, coming up with new material that is fresh sounding doesn't seem to be the issue. Finding a way to make the second album come to fruition does.

 

So that is where I hope some of you may come in. I don't, in any way, want people to feel pressured to donate. I will say that every penny helps (side note: thank you to those who have fed me and housed me during this past tour!!). Independent artists all over the world are trying to work out a way to do what they love, and I know I'm not the only one out there with a starving artist story (I'm not really that hungry Grandma, don't worry :). If you will consider donating to the recording of my second album, I will be forever grateful. If you choose to show your support in other ways, I am forever grateful. And if it's just bad timing, I very much understand. I can't wait to reach these fundraising goals and begin recording this fall!

 

The Impact

If you've listened to my music and its messages, you may have noticed one thing; it is fairly idealistic and often addresses environmental, philosophic, and sociologic issues. I write about what is in my heart and on my mind, and I find music to be a medium for uniting people and creating a platform for people to come together on issues. Or at least help them feel like they are not alone in their struggles/triumphs/fears. Of course some songs are just about good old fashion love relationships. We all have those too. I've matured a lot over the past few years, and I can't wait to deliver an album that is reflective of continuous grounding and shifting, both within myself and reflecting on the lives of others on this Earth during this time of great change. And I hope it makes you smile, cry, and most of all feel comforted.

I have dreams of linking up with some of my favourite non-profits, promoting sustainable lifestyles, health and wellness, and environmental awareness. All of this will be worked into tour details once the album is released.

What We Need & What You Get

To be completely honest, making a great album is EXPENSIVE. Studio time is about 40-50 dollars an hour, and each musician you hire (and they deserve it) is worth about $75 PER song. Times that by minimum 4 musicians per track, and things are already adding up. And a good album takes hours and hours to create. And mix. and master. Producer fees can be at least $2,000. HST. Album art. Producing actual copies of the Album. You get the idea.

That all being said, my budget is flexible. Whatever I have to work with monetarily, I will create an album that is reflective; not in quality but perhaps in instrumentation, or track numbers. Either way, I'll make it work. I am setting a goal of raising 8,000. I'm anticipating matching that out of my own pocket. Any sized donation you can spare is wonderful. 

 

For anyone who donates $25 or over, you will receive a signed copy of the CD mailed to you upon release, as well as a ticket to the CD release party in the city closest to you. As the increments of donation rise, there will be more thank you gifts added to your package (you will be able to see this on the donation page when you choose what you would like to offer).

 

Mostly, you will get a whole lot of thanks from me. And I hope you enjoy the album once it is finished!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, let others know about this campaign. Share the link on facebook. Tweet about it. Make a T-shirt with a black marker and some sparkles. Burn copies of my last CD and share it with others (orrrr direct them to Itunes so they can buy it) Any way you can get the word out, I appreciate it!

story:
Never too old to dream...if given the chance :)

My dad Joe will be 102 in a few weeks.  My dad is still a vibrant man that enjoys people, watching TV, going for walks (when he can) and just being alive.  His hearing has been suffering lately and it was time to see the doctor about a new hearing device.  My nephew informed me that the devices needed will cost a minimum of just under $5000.00.  The doctor has explained that he noticed that my dad is showing some signs of disassociation.  This means that if we don't get the hearing aids, that part of his brain will die.  And it will just get worse from there.  So I have decided to take this out to the world to ask for help.

The first $5000.00 will go directly to giving my dad his hearing back.  All additional money raised will be used for repair on his manufactured home, a trip to see his only living sibling and for general living expenses to help make the rest of his life more comfortable. If by some miracle we raise enough money to replace his mobile home, he would just be thrilled!  My dad has always been one to donate to charities that help children.  His donations have only been $5.00-$15.00 at a time, but over the years, that adds up.  Now I am asking for the love and respect of others to help one our senior citizens of the world.

Being able to give my dad the gift of hearing back will be huge, for all involved.  Being able to communicate with him again and he not feel so frustration and us not feel like we are yelling at him is HUGE!  He still has a lot to share.
 
Please share this page with everyone you know.  I cannot begin to thank you enough for your support.  The picture is him at his 100th Birthday. 
 
Thanks again everyone ~ The Mijares Family

story:
Who We Are

The LOFT Youth Centre for Social Enterprise and Innovation (LOFT YCSEI), a branch of the Christie Ossington Neighbourhood Centre, is a pioneering multi-use space that fosters creativity, community engagement, social enterprise and entrepreneurship amongst the hardest to reach youth in Toronto. The LOFT provides youth with social supports, skills training, mentorship and networking opportunities through program delivery and employment.

LOFT Sound Studio

The LOFT Sound Studio has been a staple of the LOFT's programming for the past five years, providing at-risk, young emerging artists with the chance to hone their technical and musical skills.

Approximately 75 youth per week access the Sound Studio's free recording sessions, engage in workshops and mentorship from local artists such as producer Rich Kidd (Nelly Furtado, Drake, K-os); and collaborate in the creation of LOFT Music compilation albums, multi-volume series that showcase the writing, performing, producing, recording, mixing and mastering talents of the youth involved.

Social Impact & Outcomes

Youth who are actively involved in the Sound Studio have proven less likely to be negatively impacted by their environment, and more likely to overcome barriers to success, taking stronger  leadership roles within their communitites. Studio participants often express an increased interest in furthering their education and obtaining meaningful employment, demonstrating successful program outcomes. While engaged in music making within a safe space, youth are free to lead organic onversations around social barriers they face on a regular basis, giving LOFT staff a platform to better serve and empower youth towards a more holstic well being.

It Takes A Village Within A City

Like most non-profit organizations, a large part of our funding is received through grants and fundraising initiatives. With the recent cuts to youth programming, and with youth organizations competing for the same pockets of money, like our sister organizations we are finding it increasingly difficult to keep our music programs alive. As a result, the future of our Sound Studio could be at risk.

A generous contribution towards the operating costs of our Studio, in particular towards the purchasing of brand new state-of-the-art studio equipment, and up-to-date music software; as well as salary fees for important staff, such as our Chief Engineer; and repair costs to our humble studio, YOU could mean a tremendous difference in our ability to deliver workshops, programming and FREE studio time to the amazing youth that we serve.

The Sound Studio is not only a place for young artists to record music, but to engage in a safe and non-judgmental space, and receive much needed support as they learn valuable employability and life skills.

What We Need 

$10,000 will enable us to purchase new studio equipment and music software that will expand our capacity to produce inspiring high quality music that meets and exceeds industry standards. Items on our Wish List include a new iMac Computer, Mic Pre Amp Compressor, Mixer, and the latest version of Protools (Recording Software).

Ideally we would like to raise $20,000 so we can continue to offer valuable programming, workshops, and aprenticeship opportunities for young aspiring artists. Studio staff are generally contracted via grant funds, and future funding could mean longer contract times for our Engineers, who are essential to the functionality of the Studio. Many of our participants are drawn back to the Sound Studio time and time again, making the Studio and all that we do here not only vital to the youth, but the community as a whole. 



What You Get

Perks:

As a special Thank You to all those who donate, whether it be $5 or $500, we have some AMAZING gifts just for you as a way to show our appreciation. Perks include original Thank You cards created by our very own graphic designers in the UTR (Under The Radar), and music made by our aspiring LOFT Music recording artists. We also have Gift Baskets of varying sizes chalk full of LOFT goodies, and many more unique items that you will absolutely LOVE.

 

 
The Impact

The area served by the LOFT is ranked first out of all 140 Toronto neighbourhoods for percentage of youth not attending school. In addition, Toronto Vital Signs Report findings indicate that the youth unemployment rate in the Toronto region is 22% distinctively higher above the national average. In the face of these alarming statistics, and in response to the concerns identified by local youth, LOFT was initiated in 2001. 

The LOFT Sound Studio is an essential component to the way in which we are able to access and engage the youth that we serve. It is a fact that a majority of our youth have a passion for creating music, and an interest in furthering a career witihin the music industry. With adequate financial support we will be able to better offer professional, high quality music production and engineering, as well as keep our highly trained Studio Engineer on board with us. 

Our vision of a Sound Studio that is able to compete with industry standards can be made a reality; other non-profit organizations have also led successful community studios with amazing project outcomes. The impact is quite clear: more youth creatively engaged in learning tangible skills equals more youth leaders who are equipped to lead stronger and positive lives. Less youth living at risk means healthier and more sustainable communities, which benefits us not only on the community level, but on a global scale as well.

The Proof is in The Pudding

LOFT Music has released a total of 5 compilation albums, including LOFT Music Vol. 5: E.V.E (Every Voice Empowered); a number of music videos including "Learning" by LOFT artist PHoenix (directed by LOFT alumni/Chief Engineer Rich Kidd, shot by LOFT alumni The Edisons), and have hosted a series of LOFT Jams throughout the city of Toronto.

LOFT Alumni artists have also gone on to become graduates of such post secondary music schools as Trebas Institute and Harris Institute, returning regularly to the Sound Studio to volunteer time and to mentor new participants. We regard all of these outcomes as proof of the positive impact that music related tools and programming can have on young people.

 

 

Funders & Program Partners of LOFT Sound Studio:

  • Long & McQuade
  • United Way Toronto
  • City of Toronto Community Service Partnerships
  • Service Canada
  • Toronto Arts Council
  • Ontario Arts Council
  • Joseph Mimran & Associates
  • Alterna Savings
  • St. Christopher's House
  • Telus

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to our cause with a monetary donation, please help us by spreading the word. We appreciate any support you have to offer...afterall, "It takes A Village Within A City".


....Peace,
                                    LOFT Fam.

story:
Short Summary


UPDATE*** This concert is now only happening November 2nd due to schedule conflicts. Please come down Sunday, November 2nd @1pm, in Ross Bay Cemetery to enjoy the live music.

***********************************


I am a classical singer from Victoria, British Columbia. I love the avante garde when it comes to music, and so I have started planning my own concerts that are tailored to my musical interests and personal tastes.

This year I am organizing a concert in Ross Bay Cemetery (Victoria, BC). It will be an outdoor concert in the beautiful and historic cemetery, on November 1st and 2nd - All Saints & All Souls Day. I have wanted to do this concert for many years and I have finally put together the permits and the people to be able to pull it off. It isn't easy getting permission to sing a concert in a cemetery around Halloween, so I was extremely fortunate to have the City of Victoria on board with my event!

The inspiration behind the concert comes from my reverence and respect for the oft forgotten 2 days after Halloween. All three days (Halloween, All Saints Day, and All Souls Day) make up the time of the year where it is said that the veil is the thinnest between the worlds of the living and the dead. It is said that our ancestors are closer to us during these 3 days, and there are many traditions around the world honouring those who have passed. Especially in Europe, this time of year is very special, a time when we hold our loved ones close, whether living or deceased. This time of year also coincides with my birthday, November 1st. For the past few years it has been a personal tradition for me to go down to the Ross Bay Cemetery on my birthday or Nov 2nd and sing a very quiet song titled "Allerseelen" or in English, All Souls Day. This German song by Richard Strauss is a gorgeous bittersweet song speaking of love that still lives on in the heart of someone who has lost their partner. I go there to sing amongst the quietude of the cemetery, a song for those who are laid to rest. I have always thought it would be a wonderful idea to sing a concert there for the community, to honour those who can only be there in spirit. The concerts will be encompassing repertoire from the classical art song genre on the topic of All Souls Day, and will include works by R. Strauss, Brahms, Schubert, and more.

 I will be accompanied by a small string ensemble, made up of professional musicians from various orchestras on the island. The music will be arranged for strings by a music arranger and will be tailored to the instruments and my voice.  I am employing professional musicians to play for this concert and therefore need to be able to pay them. I believe that musicians should be paid fairly for their art, but there are so many times when this just does not happen. This is why I need YOU to help us out to make this oncert happen!

There is also the challenge that the permit I have obtained for the concert restricts the ability to accept donations at the time of this event. I cannot sell tickets nor take cash donations at the site. I love that this concert is free and open to the public, and wouldnt have it any other way, but I also am limited on my own funds, and am having trouble coming up with the money I need to put on this concert. So far I have paid out of my own pocket for the expenses. I am putting my own time and money into my dream of having this recital, in order to give people the gift of music in such a special and sacred space.

 This is why I have created this crowdfunding campaign - I need help covering the costs of putting on a fabulous recital for the enjoyment of our community!


What We Need & What You Get

 

What we need: For this concert I will need 4+ instrumentalists for accompanying my voice. I would like to pay each player $300 (for rehearsal time + 2 concerts), totaling in $1200. I also need to hire a music arranger to convert the music to an instrumental accompaniment. I would like to pay him $200. I also need to purchase promotional materials to advertise the concert. This will cost $100. The permit and other costs associated with equipment/rental costs are approx. $100. Luckily I have already secured in-kind support for much of the equipment necessary as well as rehearsal space. In order to just break even, I would need these costs covered as well.

***UPDATE - Through sheer luck I have now arranged my schedule so that I no longer am missing work to perform in the concert, so the amount needed is actually a bit less now! yay! I will be donating my services as a musician and only wish to pay my performers, and pay for the associated costs to organize such an event. Booyah!***


If we raise over the amount of $2000, the extra will be distributed equally among the performers.

All donations are gratefully accepted and appreciated. This is an opportunity to support the arts and show our community that music is an essential part of our culture and our lives!

What you get:

1. If you live in Victoria British Columbia, you get to come down to the  concert and enjoy the music!

***Nov 2nd, 1-2pm, Ross Bay Cemetery (1516 Fairfield Rd), at the main cement path convergence across from the Thrifty Foods Plaza. Bring warm clothes. There will be limited seating for those who need it, and standing room is encouraged.***

2. AND: If you were to help sponsor this event by donating before Oct 21st , your name would be listed in the concert programme as a donor!

Why this is important:

I believe this is an important concert to have because it will  provide a valuable weekend of music and culture to the beautiful Fairfield community of Victoria. It is a rarity to even get a permit for Ross Bay Cemetery, and so this is a real opportunity to produce a truly special concert.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you  can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
A MASSIVE thank you for all the sharing, liking and contributions towards making the recording of our album happen!                       

In total we’ve pre-sold 50 albums and we think its super exciting that 3 of you will receive home concerts, 2 will learn beatboxing skills from Moritz and 2 of you will be joining us for 3 festivals over the Summer! 

            

On the evening before we got on a plane to South Africa our campaign reached its target of 3000 euros ! We’ve been overwhelmed by your support, especially considering the campaign had only been running for 10 days! 

There’s another 24 days left of the campaign, and we’d like to take this opportunity to show you the figures of what we’d ideally need to fulfil this project to its best ability. We’re super thankful that we’ve been able to crowd fund 25% of the monies that goes into making the wheel spin! 


If another 600 people pre order our album, we'd be able to fully fund the budget for the musical makings! It’s a goal we’d like to aim for!

 

So please continue to spread the Riders word & keep grooving to the tunes!


We promised you an inside look on our collection of bush diving footage if we reached the target! It's an African tradition we’ve grown fond of and we’ll continue to share our bush diving experiences as we tour up along the coast of South Africa. Find it here!


In the spirit of giving back, we’d like to remind you that our EP is free to download  on our Soundcloud.



If you’re excited about hearing more tunes, remember you can still pre order our full length album here! There are also still 25 guest list spots left to one of our release parties, 4 Summer Festival tickets left, Merchandise packages and much more ! 

                               



It all started 4 years ago, on the streets of Berlin, sharing our beats & melodies to the passing crowds, opening up our hearts and letting our inspiration flow.

We’ve been lucky to continue doing what we love and it's entirely been made possible because of the support you’ve given us. 


As the grey Berlin winter approaches, we are fortunate to fly to South Africa to tour the Western Cape for two months. It will be our first time touring outside of Europe, and we can't wait to share our music, make new connections and collaborations, and immerse ourselves in a different culture.

We want to create something unique, by recording a live album on the beach that feeds off the feelings, freedom and atmosphere. These next months are a perfect time to immerse ourselves outside of what we know so well, and by letting this flow we can create new beauty to bridge the gaps across the world. 



We're proud to have gotten this far independently with no record label & doing it all D I Y style, and we feel passionate about continuing to do so! We believe in the power of community and bringing together you music lovers in order to create an album which exudes positive energy in its diversity and originality 

We've worked out that we need to record and produce our album, and anything above will go towards the costs of distribution and promotion of the album. 

We want to keep everyone involved in fun and creative ways and have put together some exciting perks in exchange for the moneys. These include Beat Boxing Lessons, Festival Season Tickets, Living Room Concerts, Camping Trip, Life Time Guest List and much more! 


                                 


This will be our first full-length album and to have our friends, family & fans be a part of making this dream a reality is priceless! Lets do this! 

Together we can unleash the forces of creativity!

Alles begann vor vier Jahren auf den Straßen von Berlin als wir unsere Rhythmen und Melodien in dem wir unsere Herzen öffneten und unsere Inspiration fließen ließen, den vorbeigehenden Menschenmassen Preis gaben.

Wir sind unglaublich dankbar euch als Teil bei unserer Reise dabei zu haben.

Mit dem kommenden grauen Winter in Berlin den wir alle lieben, sind wir sehr glücklich nach Südafrika zu fliegen und eine zweimonatige Tournee auf die Beine gestellt zu haben.  Zum ersten Mal werden wir außerhalb Europas auf Tour gehen. Wir können es kaum erwarten unsere Musik zu teilen, neue Bekanntschaften zu machen, neue Kollaboration einzugehen und in eine neue Kultur einzutauchen.

Wir werdem die Schönheit anzapfen um etwas Neues zu erschaffen. Etwas Einzigartiges soll es sein. Ein Livealbum am Strand aufgenommen um das Gefühl und die Atmosphäre einzufangen. Die nächsten Monate sind ideal um aus unseren Gewohnheiten auszutreten und neue Brücken zu nutzen um die Klüfte dieser Welt zu überwinden.

In der Isolation entstehen keine neuen Verknüpfungen deswegen sind wir entschlossen unsere Liebe an allen Orten, die wir anpeilen zu verbreiten. Wir bitten euch daher demütig uns zu unterstützen und unser Vorhaben Realität werden zu lassen.


Wir sind stolz bis hierher gekommen zu sein und das unabhängig und eigenbestimmt ohne Label und wir werden auch weiterhin mit all unserer Leidenschaft weiterkämpfen. 

Die Kraft der Kommunikation bestimmt unseren Glauben und die Liebenden der Musik zusammenzuführen um ein Album zu schaffen, welches die positiven Energien in ihrer Vielfalt und Originalität verströmt. 

Nach unseren zusammenfassenden Berechnungen benötigen   wir zur Realisierung der Aufnahme und Produktion des Albums. Alles was darüber hinaus vorhanden sein sollte, werden wir in die Verbreitung und Veröffentlichung investieren.

In dem Geiste alle zu beteiligen und Spaß zu haben, haben wir uns die folgenden Entschädigungen einfallen lassen. Diese beinhalten einen Beat-Box Unterricht,Sommersaison Festivaltickets, Wohnzimmerkonzerte,  

Campingausflüge, eine Dinner Party und viel Andere! Das Album wird außerdem zur Vorbestellung erwerblich sein. Das erste vollständige Album und euch, unsere Freunde, Familie und Fans als Teil davon zu haben, ist unbezahlbar. Ran an die Bouletten!


Zusammen können wir die Kräfte der Kreativität entfesseln!
story_txt:
A MASSIVE thank you for all the sharing, liking and
contributions towards making the recording of our album happen!       
               
In total we’ve pre-sold 50 albums and we think its super exciting that 3 of you will receive home concerts, 2 will learn
beatboxing skills from Moritz and 2 of you will be joining us for 3 festivals
over the Summer! 
            




On the evening before we got on a plane to South Africa our
campaign reached its target of 3000 euros ! We’ve been overwhelmed by your
support, especially considering the campaign had only been running for 10
days! 

There’s another 24 days left of the campaign, and we’d like to take this opportunity to show you the figures of what we’d ideally need to fulfil this project to its best ability. We’re super thankful that we’ve been able to crowd fund 25% of the monies that goes into making the wheel spin! 



If another 600 people pre order our album, we'd be able to fully fund the budget for the musical makings! It’s a goal we’d like to aim for! So please continue to spread the Riders word & keep grooving to the tunes!



We promised you an inside look on our collection of bush diving footage if we reached the target! It's an African tradition we’ve grown fond of and we’ll continue to share our bush diving experiences as we tour up along the coast of South Africa. Find it here!





In the spirit of giving back, we’d like to remind you that our EP is free to download  on our Soundcloud.



If you’re excited about hearing more tunes, remember you can
still pre order our full length album here! There are also still 25 guest list spots left to one of our release parties, 4 Summer Festival tickets left, Merchandise packages and much more ! 

                               

It all started 4 years ago, on the streets
of Berlin, sharing our beats & melodies to the
passing crowds, opening up our hearts and letting our inspiration flow.

We’ve been lucky to continue doing what we love and it's entirely been made possible because of the support you’ve given us. 







As the grey Berlin winter approaches, we are fortunate to fly to South
Africa to tour the Western Cape for two months. It will be our first
time touring outside of Europe, and we can't wait to share our
music, make new connections and collaborations, and immerse ourselves in a
different culture.
We want to create something unique, by
recording a live album on the beach that feeds off the feelings, freedom and
atmosphere. These
next months are a perfect time to immerse ourselves outside of what we know so
well, and by letting this flow we can create new beauty to bridge the gaps
across the world. 



   







We're proud to have gotten
this far independently with no record label & doing it all D
I Y style, and we feel passionate about continuing to do
so! We believe in the power of community and bringing
together you music lovers in order to create an album which exudes
positive energy in its diversity and originality 
We've worked out that we need to record and produce our album, and anything above will go towards the costs of distribution and promotion of the album. 
We want to keep everyone involved in fun and creative ways and have put together some exciting perks in exchange for the moneys. These include Beat Boxing Lessons, Festival Season Tickets, Living Room Concerts, Camping Trip, Life Time Guest List and much more! 


                                 

This will be our first full-length album and to
have our friends, family & fans be a part of making this dream a reality is
priceless! Lets do this! 
Together we can unleash the forces of creativity!







Alles begann vor vier Jahren auf den Straßen von Berlin als wir unsere
Rhythmen und Melodien in dem wir unsere Herzen öffneten und unsere Inspiration
fließen ließen, den vorbeigehenden Menschenmassen Preis gaben.

Wir sind unglaublich dankbar euch als Teil bei unserer Reise dabei zu
haben.


Mit dem kommenden grauen Winter in Berlin den
wir alle lieben, sind wir sehr glücklich nach Südafrika zu fliegen und eine zweimonatige
Tournee auf die Beine gestellt zu haben.  Zum ersten Mal werden wir außerhalb
Europas auf Tour gehen. Wir können es kaum erwarten unsere Musik zu teilen,
neue Bekanntschaften zu machen, neue Kollaboration einzugehen und in eine neue
Kultur einzutauchen.


Wir werdem die Schönheit anzapfen um etwas Neues zu erschaffen. Etwas
Einzigartiges soll es sein. Ein Livealbum am Strand aufgenommen um das Gefühl
und die Atmosphäre einzufangen. Die nächsten Monate sind ideal um aus unseren
Gewohnheiten auszutreten und neue Brücken zu nutzen um die Klüfte dieser Welt
zu überwinden.

In der Isolation entstehen keine neuen
Verknüpfungen deswegen sind wir entschlossen unsere Liebe an
allen Orten, die wir anpeilen zu verbreiten. Wir bitten euch daher demütig
uns zu unterstützen und unser Vorhaben Realität werden zu lassen.






Wir sind stolz bis hierher gekommen zu sein und das unabhängig und
eigenbestimmt ohne Label und wir werden auch weiterhin mit all unserer Leidenschaft weiterkämpfen. 

Die Kraft der
Kommunikation bestimmt unseren Glauben und die Liebenden der Musik
zusammenzuführen um ein Album zu schaffen, welches die positiven Energien in
ihrer Vielfalt und Originalität verströmt. 
Nach unseren
zusammenfassenden Berechnungen benötigen   wir zur Realisierung der Aufnahme und Produktion des Albums. Alles was darüber hinaus vorhanden sein sollte, werden wir in die Verbreitung und Veröffentlichung investieren.
In dem Geiste alle zu beteiligen und Spaß zu haben, haben wir uns die folgenden Entschädigungen einfallen lassen. Diese beinhalten einen Beat-Box Unterricht,Sommersaison Festivaltickets, Wohnzimmerkonzerte,  Campingausflüge, eine Dinner Party und viel Andere! Das Album wird außerdem zur Vorbestellung erwerblich sein. Das erste vollständige Album und euch, unsere Freunde, Familie und Fans als Teil davon zu haben, ist unbezahlbar. Ran an die Bouletten!





Zusammen können wir die Kräfte der Kreativität entfesseln!

story:
The Miles Davis Memorial Committee of Alton, Illinois invites you to be part of the creation of a bronze statue of Miles Davis in the town of his birth. Alton is located on the Mississippi River, just 20 miles north of St. Louis, in a beautiful tourist area and entertainment district.

So What’s the Big Deal?

Miles Davis is regarded as one of the most innovative, influential and respected figures in the history of music.  He has been described as “one of the great innovators in jazz.”  The Rolling Stone Encyclopedia of Rock & Roll noted "Miles Davis played a crucial and inevitably controversial role in every major development in jazz since the mid-'40s, and no other jazz musician has had such a profound effect on rock. Miles Davis was the most widely recognized jazz musician of his era, an outspoken social critic and an arbiter of style—in attitude and fashion—as well as music.”

With his world renown, you would think there would be a public monument to him in his own country! Nope. There is a statue in France and also in Poland but nothing in the United States. In a country full of streets lined with statues and monuments for the well-known to the little-known, this icon of evolutionary music has been overlooked.

So What’s the Plan?

A bronze statue will be commissioned and then created by Preston Jackson, professor emeritus of the Art Institute of Chicago . Preston is not only a prolific sculptor but is a jazz musician, as well. Through his talents and skills he will represent Miles in a way that will not only feature the man but also his music.

The entire project from the sculpture itself to the site preparation and landscaping will cost $100,000. The modest goal we have for this indiegogo project is to raise enough to get our artist, Preston Jackson, started on the sculpture. At this time, we are nearly halfway there. However, we still have a long way to go. It’s time to open up this opportunity and involve  the greater community of Miles Davis fans. We want everyone to have the opportunity to pay tribute to the legacy of Miles Davis in a tangible way. Be part of bringing Miles back to his birthplace.

So What's In It For You?

Here are some "Perks of Appreciation" for getting involved:

       

Can coozie front & back              

Commemorative Pin

Sample Commemorative Brick

Sample Granite Block


Limited edition print of Miles by Jin G. Kam

(matted & framed)

Copy of Site Rendering



Maquette

Although not pictured, it will be an authentic, limited edition, artist-created, bronze miniature  of the statue. Sure to be a prized possession, since only a few will be available.

What If I Can't Give? 

Some of you may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!Use the Indiegogo share tools. We would really appreciate it!

story:
Hi gang!

Bob Collum here. Me and the Welfare Mothers are in the middle of recording our next Magnus Opus (i.e. our next lp) and we though we would come to you, our loyal public. with cap in hand and ask for a hand out…. or  if you like, "aural austerity" 
To finish off the record we need little but of moolah to pay for studio time and pressing etc and who better to mooch off of than the purveyors of fine taste and musical refinement. That means you by the way. 
If you contribute you get a copy of the new album PLUS the self satisfaction of having excellent musical taste.  And in this day and age isn't that what really matters?

Thank you 
BC

story:
PLEASE HELP CINDY NOW!


  Cindy Odom is well-known in the greater Santa Cruz community- and for good reason. She was a long-time member of the groung-breaking, personal growth radio program "Seeing Beyond". A fixture in the local folk music scene, Cindy hosts "The Continental Drift" airing on public radio KUSP 88.9 every Saturday afternoon from 1:00 pm. to 3:00 pm.

     For years Cindy has been generous to local charities and has been integral to KUSP's fundraising efforts. Recently she has fallen upon hard times. Her current financial situation is heading toward homelessness. Cindy is turning to her family for help. She has no other family- except for us. Please donate if you can and please share this campaign with everyone you know. Let's all help someone who is close to home and close to our hearts. THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

My name is AJ Russo and I am a singer-songwriter living in the pacific northwest. Music has always been my passion and i want to share it with a wider audience through this, my first full length album! With your help you can make that dream of mine come true.

What We Need & What You Get

For this project to be succesful I will need to raise about $500 to pay for the cost of printing CDs, getting the album onto sites such as Itunes, Spotify, etc. I will be offering 2 teirs of perks! the first perk is at $25 and will be a signed copy of my album sent straight to you! The second perk will be at $50 and it will also be a signed copy of my album, but with a personal handwriten note just for you :) Any and all funds will go toward paying for what i have previously stated and i will try to cover whatever i dont raise.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with funds for the project, don't worry! you can still help me out by sharing the project with your friends and spreading the word! :D Thanks so much!
